Raquel has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Raquel hopes to expand her business and purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready to wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 24 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one infant-age child.

Analyn has a small market at home to make a living. She sells assorted food items and refreshments .Analyn established her business for over four years. She earns PHP 4,000 every month from this business. Analyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase refreshments to sell.

Analyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Analyn hopes to own another store in her town.

loans.use: To purchase refreshments to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married and a mother of seven adult-aged dependents. She is 43 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Vilma is a farmer. She grows rice and harvests palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She earns approximately PHP 36,000 per quarter from this farm. She has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 at GDMPC to purchase rice seedlings to be planted this coming planting season.

Vilma has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Vilma hopes to gain more profit and purchase an additional rice field.

loans.use: To purchase rice seedlings.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is 27 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children. She works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en:
20-year-old Honeylyn has had a backyard pig raising business for three years now. Honeylyn is married and a mother of two children .She invested in a sow to raise multiple piglets in a short time. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She earns a total average monthly income of PHP 4,000 from this business. Honeylyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase a sow for piglets. 
Honeylyn has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Honeylyn hopes to raise pigs on a large scale.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sow for piglets.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, detergent, candies etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, detergent, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Don Nicolas tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y junto a su familia vive en la Comunidad El Triunfo. El inició su negocio criando y destazando cerdos, luego de un tiempo cambió de giro comercial y se dedicó a la venta de abarroteria en una pequeña pulperia que instaló en su casa de habitacion y como éste negocio no le fue rentable ahora se dedica a la compra-venta de ganado y al cultivo de café. Con la ayuda de algunos mozos, Don Nicolas puede atender sus negocios desde las 6:00 am hasta la 1:00 pm. Con el prestamo solicitado comprará abono, urea y pagará mano de obra. Espera que su negocio sea mas productivo y que le permita obtener ganancias y con eso podrá proveer de lo necesario a su familia. Gracias a Dios ni mi familia ni yo presentamos enfermedades, pero si estamos teniendo un poco de problemas con el cultivo de café, ya que la tierra no está tecnificada y por eso debemos tener mas cuidado. Su sueño es convertirse en un gran productor de Café, el año que viene piensa sembrar 2 manzanas mas de tierra y espera que FAMA le siga apoyando con los prestamos para conseguirlo. Este es su segundo prestamo y es muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 63 years old, married, and has five children.  He lives together with his family in El Triunfo community.  He started his business raising and butchering pigs then, after a while, he changed direction and started selling groceries from a small grocery store that he set up in his home.  As this business was not profitable, he now buys and sells cattle and grows coffee.  With the help of some young men, Nicolas is able to work in his businesses from 6.00am to 1.00pm. 

Nicolas will use the loan that he has requested to buy manure and urea (fertilizer).  He will also pay labor costs.  He hopes that his business will become more productive and enable him to make a profit so that he can provide his family with what they need.  "Thanks to God, neither my family nor myself are sick but we are having a few problems with our coffee growing since the land is not being farmed using modern technology and so we must take more care".

Nicolas' dream is to become an important coffee producer.  Next year he plans to sow two 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of additional land and hopes that FAMA will continue supporting him with loans so that he can achieve this.  This is his second loan and he is very punctual in making his repayments.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 41 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four grown dependents. Vilma has a fishing business to earn a living. She sells fish in the local community. She has been doing this for five years. She earns a total monthly average of PHP 6,200 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 at GDMPC to pay labor costs for fishing boat repair. Vilma has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Vilma hopes to purchase additional fishing boats and gain more profit.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Jijie

texts.en:
Jijie is 28 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one school-age child.

Jijie works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to pay the labor costs for fishing boat repair and repainting.

Jijie has been a  member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Jijie hopes to earn more income and to purchase an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to repair and repaint her fishing boat.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 48 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of seven school-age dependents.

Angelina works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Each month she earn approximately PHP 5,600 in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,500 at GDMPC to purchase fishing nets.

Angelina has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Angelina hopes to gain more profit from fishing and own an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is 38 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with one school-age child.

Larry works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. Each month he earns approximately PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 6,500 from GDMPC to purchase a brand new fishing net. 

Larry has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Larry hopes to gain more profit from this work.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new fishing net

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 46 years old and lives in the small village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four adult-age children.

Johna has a motorcycle taxi service to make a living. She rents her motorcycle everyday. She has been engaged in this service for four years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle spare parts and tires.

Johna has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Johna hopes to purchase another motorcycle to be used in her service.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie is 30 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of one school-age child.

Rechie owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to earn a living. He is a motorcycle taxi driver who carries and transports passengers. He has been in this service for four years. Each month, he earns a total average of PHP 2,500 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to pay labor costs for motorcycle repair and to purchase spare parts and tires.

Rechie has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Rechie hopes to purchase another motorcycle taxi and gain more profit.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to repair his motorcycle and to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 29 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-age dependents.

Aileen owns and operates a motorcycle taxi service to earn a living. She has been engaged in this type of business for three years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to purchase a brand new motorcycle to be used in her service.

Aileen has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Aileen hopes to purchase more motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new motorcycle.

loans.name: Everlinda

texts.en:
Everlinda is 38 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-age dependents.

Everlinda has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She sells different types of food products like biscuits, candies, noodles and canned goods. She had been in this business for five years. She earns a total income of PHP 5,808 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Everlinda has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Everlinda hopes to expand her retail business and gain more income to purchase other products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 21 years old, single, and lives in the small village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Madeline sells personal care and beauty products. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,700 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 at GDMPC to purchase personal care and beauty products to sell.

Madeline has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Madeline hopes to gain more income from her business and have a personal care and beauty products shop.

loans.use: To purchase personal care and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married and a mother of two school-age dependents. She is 36 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Leah sells freshly prepared snacks and viands to earn a living. She sells food at the school and at offices. She has been running her business for five years. She earns PHP 2,000 doing this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase kitchen utensils and food ingredients for her food vending.

Leah has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Leah hopes to gain more income and have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils and food ingredients.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married with 2 children. Nenita is 42 years old and lives in Oroquieta City.
Nenita sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7000 to purchase more different dried fish for her retail business .
Nenita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Ricmar

texts.en:
Ricmar is 35 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with two school-age children. Ricmar is a fisherman. He captures fish and shellfish for a living. This is the only means of subsistence for his family. He has been doing this for 10 years. He earns a total of PHP 8,284 each month in this work. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase fishing nets.

Ricmar has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Ricmar hopes to gain more income and purchase additional fishing boats.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 63 years old and a resident of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of one adult-age child. Eugenia has a sewing business. She sews household items, bedclothes, and comforters to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. She earns PHP 5,000 each month in this activity. Eugenia has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase a brand new sewing machine.

Eugenia has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Eugenia hopes to gain more income and to establish a tailoring shop in the city.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is married and a mother of two school-age dependents. She is 41 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosalyn has a food vending business at home. She prepares and sells food products at the schools and some public places. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She earns PHP 3,000 each month in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase food ingredients for food preparation.

Rosalyn has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 41 years old and lives in Tuburan Villafor, Oroquita City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lucia has a food vending business. She sells freshly prepared snacks and viands to earn a living. She sells at the offices, schools and her neighbors. She has been running her business for over three years. She earns a monthly income of PHP 3,000 in this vending business. Lucia has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase food ingredients and some kitchenware.

Lucia has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Lucia hopes to save the income from food vending so that she can build a food stall in the city.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients and some kitchenware.

loans.name: Freeland

texts.en:
Freeland is 27 years old and single. He earns about PHP 5,000 per month as a hog-raiser working in the Philippines, which he has been doing for almost 4 years.  He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise, as well as hog feed.

In the future, Freeland hopes to improve and strengthen this business since this is one of the sources of his family’s income. He hopes that someday he will be able to start another kind of business in order to help his parents in financing the education of his younger brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise, as well as hog feed

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en: Ramona is 76 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with 6 children. She has a shop where she sells clothes. She has had this business for 35 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more clothes for her shop. Ramona has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her shop

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 40 years of age and married with seven school-age children. Fatima is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 6,000 per month. 

Fatima is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase needed farm inputs like fertilizer and pesticides. Fatima grows rice and has been doing it for almost 20 years.

In the future, Fatima hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to have more earnings to finance the education of their children. She is thankful that she received a loan from the Kiva lenders. The loan helps a lot in the sustainability of her crops. Thus, she will be glad if the lenders will grant again her request.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 49 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married and does not have children. 

To earn a living, Angelina has a business of selling fish. She earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Angelina has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Angelina has been a member of PMPC since just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is married and a mother of one school-age child. She is 26 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ginalyn is a farmer. She grows different kinds of vegetables like peaches, beans and cucumbers. She has been dong this for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,200 doing this type of farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 at GDMPC to pay labor costs for land plowing. Ginalyn has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Ginalyn hopes to gain more profit and expand the vegetable farm.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for land plowing.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is married and a mother of five adult-age children. She is 59 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Paulina is a farmer and grows water spinach to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years with a monthly income of PHP 1,600. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers. 

Paulina has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Paulina hopes to purchase a hectare of land to plant water spinach and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 53-year-old father who has two adult-aged children. He earns about PHP 13,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. Alexander has been growing rice for almost 33 years. He is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase needed agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Alexander hopes to have a plentiful harvest to earn a higher income for the sake of his family. He is thankful that Kiva lenders offer financial assistance for him to increase his production.

loans.use: to purchase needed agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: Diego is married and has 6 children. He is 42 years old and lives in Aloran. Diego has operated a general store for 8 years. He sells a variety of products and earns a monthly income of PHP 3,000. Diego has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for his general store. Diego has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is married and has 3 children. She is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. Editha has been farming for 5 years, growing vegetables to earn a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers. Editha has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, baked breads, and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is 57 years old and lives in Aloran. He is married and has 4 children. Roger has a business selling snacks, earning about PHP 6,000 each month. Roger has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more ingredients for his snack vending business. Roger has become a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for his snack vending business

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is married and a mother of five school-age children. She is 44 years old and lives in the small village of Sinara Bajo, two kilometers away from the town of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Vergie has a food business to make a living. She sells snacks and viands to the streets, school, and offices. She has been engaged in this type of business for 24 years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 3,000 from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase kitchen utensils and ingredients for food preparation.

Vergie has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Vergie hopes to have a food stall in the town and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married, 44 years old, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines.  She requested an PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish.

Josephine has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Lhen

texts.en:
Lhen is married and is 34 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of groceries. Lhen has had this business for four years. She is thankful because she is blessed with five children. 

Lhen is requesting for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional groceries, such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, noodles and other daily basic necessity items. Due to the high cost of basic commodities, she would like to have additional stocks of groceries so that she can minimize her expenses in going to and from the market. Each month, Lhen is able to earn about PHP 10,000 from her grocery business.

In the future, Lhen hopes to improve her shop so that she can encourage more customers to buy at her store. She thus also hopes that she can obtain the loan amount that she has requested so that she can maintain her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, noodles and other basic grocery items for resale.

location.town: Aurora Villa Magat San Mateo, Isabela

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 48 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more feed for her pigs.

Josie has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns an additional income from her fruit vending business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach and her husband are rice cultivators who live in the Prey Chor district. The couple has been operating a farming business since they were single. They are able to generate a daily profit from this business of around $5 each day to cover their financial expenses such as food, school fees and utility expenses. They have given birth to seven children, two of whom are workers on a rubber plantation. 

Mach will use her loan to buy fertilizers, potato seed and rice seed for planting. In the future, Mach really wants to enlarge her crop-planting business and to decorate her old house.  

Mach and her husband are pictured here inside their house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, potato seed and rice seed for planting.

loans.name: Huệ's Group

texts.en:
Huệ  is a 53 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong district, Băc Ninh province. She is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 1 - nhóm 11 (11).

Huệ is married and has two adult-aged children. To making a living, Huệ owns and operates a business making food items such as beef noodle soup and bun cha, and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Thanh is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector of raising livestock and feeding pigs.

2.  Bình is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the production of traded goods and food such as beef noodle soup and bun cha.

3.  Hậu is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising pigs.

4.  Hương is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business of making furniture.

5.  Liễu is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business of selling soft drinks, beer, coca, etc.

6.  Thi is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector of raising pigs and chickens.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huệ  là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong district, Băc Ninh province.  Huệ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 1 - nhóm 11.


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh như phở bò, bún chả & những loại thực phẩm C. cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Huệ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy.  Huệ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Thanh  là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi và mua thức ăn cho lợn.


2.  Bình là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán hàng ăn sáng như phở bò, bún chả.


3.  Hậu là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.


4.  Hương là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Liễu là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng giải khát, bia, coca…


6.  Thi  là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn, gà.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale.

loans.name: Mam

texts.en: Mam is a sixty-one-year old who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. She has been working in a farming business since she was young. She and her husband help one another to support their whole family and to feed their kids. The couple has two married children living separately who are employed in different occupations, while the others are school-aged. Mam is currently requesting a loan to purchase rice seed to plant and a pumping machine to pump water into her farm field.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed to plant and a pumping machine to pump water into her farm field.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong is a tailor in the Kompong Speu Province, which is the best place for agriculture. Most of the people who reside in this province use their existing farmland to plant a rice crop or other crops following the rice season. Besides her current tailoring business, Suong works in the crop-growing business in order to get more net income. To generate more profits, her husband is employed as a causal construction worker. When he has some time fR. that job, he always assists Suong on the farm. 

They are blessed with two children who still study in the local school, and they depend on their income for a few needs such as food, clothing and education. This is the rainy season, which is best for planting crops, but Suong doesn’t have money to plant yet. That is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan to buy seed and some sacks of fertilizers so she can start to grow her crop. With the remaining cash, she will buy two cows for replacing their old cows.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers, and to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Ath

texts.en:
Ath is a 51-year-old domestic rice farmer in the Kompong Spue Province. She has many years of experience in this sector and is earning around $2.50 in profit a day. She can use her existing fertile farm at least twice a year, rainy season and dry season. She has a life partner with her husband who generates some income by working as a Khmer teacher in the community where he has a specific salary every month. 

As her house is getting old, it is not safe for Ath and her family to live in, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to repair their old house. She has five children, three of whom are married and are working in a factory. They always distribute some of their income to Ath to use for daily expenses.

loans.use: to repair their old house.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 62 years old and is a married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She and her husband are both farmers. She helps him till the land, where they grow rice crops. Alberta works hard to support her husband in providing for their family's needs.

Alberta requested a loan to purchase seven bags of fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies. She is hopeful that this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seven bags of fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a pesticide sprayer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 26 years old.

Ana is a farmer working in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice to sell. Ana earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She works hard to improve her business and earnings for the family. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ana hopes to earn better and be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 46 years old and married with four school-aged children. Rosalinda is a farmer working in the Philippines, and she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (Php) a month.

Rosalinda is asking for a loan of Php 16,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farm. Rosalinda grows rice, and has been doing this for 12 years.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes that her rice will grow better, and she wishes to have a good harvest to increase her income. She will use the profit in providing the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is 51 years old and married with six children. The oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest is nine.

Dionesio is a farmer who owns and tills land in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice and corn crops for 13 years. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Dionesio hopes to have a stable income that will enable him to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a 40-year-old married woman with three children aged 16, 12 and 4. Her husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Elenita has been engaged in farming for 16 years now. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 2,500 PHP per month doing this farming. Elenita works hard to improve her income. She requested a loan to fund her farm. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Elenita hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

Elenita hopes to send all her children to school and have them finish college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Arlyn has a shop that sells hypo or cleansing agent. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo or cleansing agent. Arlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make hypo or cleansing agent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow her corn farm.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 29-year-old hardworking lady. She is married and has no children. She has been selling second hand clothes for the last three years. She hopes to expand her business so that she can get enough capital to buy a piece of land.
Faith joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could easily access loans because the members of the group guarantees each other's loans.  She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Mila has a shop that buy and sells gold dust. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 23,000 to buy gold dust & sell it in bulk. 

Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gold dust and sell it in bulk.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.en:
Urbana is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. Urbana has a shop that sells rice per kilograms. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Urbana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Urbana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Yeom

texts.en:
Yeom, 49 years old, has been operating in the agriculture sector since 1998. She typically makes around $2.50 in profit each day to assist her family with their expenses. She has been married for many years to Mr. Chea, 48, a local farmer and domestic building worker, and they have four single children. Two of the children are employed, one as a sewing worker and the other as a local construction worker. The other two are studying in public school. 

Yeom is seeking a loan to plant potatoes. Her future expectations are to buy some fruit in bulk from other local farmers at a reasonable price and then resell it for more income, to build a new bathroom, and to support her children's schooling to finish in the high level.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Victoria has a shop that sells candies, biscuits, snacks, and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, and breads.

Victoria has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and breads.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is an aggressive 31-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a two-year-old child. He has been selling secondhand clothes for the last eight years. He hopes to open another business stall selling clothes within five years. Since Benson joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more knowledgeable on how to run his business and he has learned how to save his money.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy shirts to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Rosa has a fruit stand where she sells mangoes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for her mango trees. Rosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the mango trees

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month.

Eduardo is requesting a new loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds to grow on his farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

In the future, Eduardo hopes that his farming business will improve in order to gain more profit and improve their living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Janith

texts.en: Janith is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Janith has a shop that sells chickens like broilers. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional chickens to raise & sell in the future. Janith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Janith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines and earns additional income from abaca weaving.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family.  She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving.

Elsie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Meziel

texts.en: Meziel is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Meziel is providing trisikad (pedicab) or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippines pesos to buy tools needed and to pay for the utilities of the services. Meziel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Meziel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed and to pay for the utilities of the services.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing/fish vending business.

Justina has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Justina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business so she could secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Verna has a shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional firewood to sell.

Verna has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Verna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Loreza

texts.en:
Loreza is 42 years old and married with two children.

Loreza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Loreza has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 24 years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Loreza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Regina has a retail shop that sells used clothing, or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of used clothing. Regina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing, or ukay-ukay.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 19-year-old married man, living in the city of Biet Hanoun located in the Gaza Strip. 

He is in need of $700 to buy a stone crushing machine, which he doesn't have enough cash to buy. Since this machine operates effectively and would serve the needs of Biet Hanoun area in preparing construction stones (which can't be imported due to the closure on Gaza Strip) Nasser will with the help of FATEN's loan pay for the machine to improve his work doubling his production and increasing his income. 

Naser is photographed in Faten's branch in Beit Hanoun.

loans.use: Naser needs a loan to pay for a stone crushing machine.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Eufemia has a retail shop that sells food supplement products from DXN. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to sell medicinal or food supplement products from DXN.

Eufemia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eufemia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to sell medicinal or food supplement products from DXN

loans.name: Lucenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Lucenda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (convenience) store.  Lucenda is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lucenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maribe

texts.en:
Maribe is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Maribe has a retail shop that sells breads, candies and biscuits. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Maribe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maribe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Melinda has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, underwear and blouses. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stock like t-shirts and blouses.

Melinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Merced

texts.en:
Merced is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Merced has a retail shop that sells breads, biscuits and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Merced is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merced hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 69 years old and married. She has eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Manuela has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Manuela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

 In the future, Manuela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Julie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy breads, canned goods and candies to sell.

Julie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, canned goods and candies for resale.

loans.name: Tinocra

texts.en:
Tinocra is 30 years old and married. She has one child.

Tinocra works hard to provide for her family. She sells office and school supplies in the Philippines. She has been selling office and school supplies for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and from her general store.

She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Tinocra has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Tinocra aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
From the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province, Nourn, age 53, is a rice cultivator and a married woman who makes a daily income by planting crops on her own farmland. From this, she can earn approximately $2.50 each day.  Her husband is the other source for earning some income by providing building stone and wooden houses for his neighbors and other villagers. Nourn has given birth to two single kids who assist her in the field. From the Kiva loan, she is seeking to purchase a few farming raw materials, such as fertilizers and seed to facilitate rice-growing. 

She hopes she can help her husband's business buy more construction tools, to build a new house and to enlarge her crop-planting business. These are some of Nourn's future plans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seed to facilitate rice-growing.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Myrna has a food shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for five years. 

Myrna is a new member of HSPFI. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for chicken and pork barbecue.


In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for chicken and pork barbecue.

loans.name: Sibena

texts.en:
Sibena, 34, is married and has four children. Two are in school.

Sibena is in the business of farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for two years now and has borrowed three loans in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Sibena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Sibena would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old.  She is married and has three children who are in school.

Ruth is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets and feeds.

Ruth has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so that she could send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Rollyn

texts.en:
Rollyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.  Rollyn has been in this business for 12 years. Rollyn earns additional income from raising pigs.

Rollyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Maricel has a food shop that sells rice and cassava cakes. She has had this business for five years. Maricel has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make rice cakes.
Maricel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make rice cakes

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios believes that her farming business is the one of the most important needs of her community.

She is 51 years old, married and have five grown-up children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 7,000 a month.  Remedios grows corn and rice and has been doing it for 10 years.

Remedios is asking for a loan of PHP 26,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, she hopes that her farming business will improve so that she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Sinforiano

texts.en:
Sinforiano is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a carenderia (restaurant) business in the Philippines. Sinforiano has been in this business for six years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Sinforiano is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for his restaurant.

Sinforiano has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough money so he could afford to send his child to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for his restaurant business

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita is 54 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginita has been pig fattening for 11 years and also earns additional income from selling electronic loads and running a general store.

Virginita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is 27 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Richelle runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Richelle has been in this business for two years. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Richelle would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Mary Jane has a retail shop that sells RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more RTW clothing to sell.

Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is widow and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Violeta has been in this business for 25 years now. She works hard to support her family.

Violeta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Violeta would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Melanie has a retail shop that sells frozen products like hotdogs and bacon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional frozen products like hotdogs to sell.

Melanie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen products like hotdogs to sell.

loans.name: Roswin

texts.en:
Roswin is married with 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. She is 33 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur, with a fishing business in the Philippines. Roswin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment.

Roswin has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Celidonia

texts.en:
Celidonia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Celidonia has a retail shop that sells furniture such as dining tables. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for making furniture.

Celidonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Celidonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making furniture

loans.name: Remerose

texts.en:
Remerose is 31 years old and married with 2 children. With both children in school, Remerose works very hard to provide for them.

Remerose runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell  in her sari-sari store.

Remerose has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, sugar and soap. 

In the future, Remerose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 51 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Perla runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as sardines and groceries to sell in her store.

Perla has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and toothpaste. 

In the future, Perla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Lilian has a retail shop that sells dried fish like pinikas. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional dried fish.

Lilian is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lilian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 44 years old and married. She lives in the Philippines and she works very hard to provide for her family.

To make a living, Ofelia buys and sells eggs.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of eggs to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as salted eggs and other types of eggs.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim resides in Siem Reap Province. He makes a living driving a motorcycle taxi, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He earns an income of about $3.75 a day and has been running his service for six years. He has two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. His wife used to sell some goods in front of her house but now she stays at home doing household work. 

Lim is looking for a loan of $1,100 for his wife to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one which is very often broken down. He is concerned that she wouldn't pay for repair costs after receiving a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Bernard has a shop that sells silver-plated jewelry such as necklaces and bracelets. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy additional silver-plated jewelry.

Bernard is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Bernard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional silver-plated jewelry

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lydia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy piglets and feed.

Lydia has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: To build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Marilou has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to customers.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 2 years and also earns an income from tailoring and raising livestock.

She wants to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Monica has a retail shop that sells prepaid phone credits, also known as electronic loads, for different networks, such as Globe and Smart. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional prepaid phone credits to sell.

Monica is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Monica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid phone credits to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. Elvira is married and has a sari-sari (convenience) store business in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Elvira has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a sari-sari (convenience) store business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soft-drinks, curls (puffed cheese-flavored snacks), bread and other miscellaneous items.  Evelyn has been in this business for 16 years.

Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soft-drinks, curls, bread and other miscellaneous item

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Dominga has a taxi business.  Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools to maintain the taxi.

Dominga is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dominga hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools to maintain the taxi

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 41 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Jessica has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat and fishing equipment.

Jessica has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat and fishing equipment

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is married with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Honorata is 46 years old and has 5 children who are in school.

Honorata has a sari-sari (convenience) store business in the Philippines. Honorata requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Honorata has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Honorata would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Francisca has a retail shop that sells bananas, snacks and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy additional bananas and snacks. 

Francisca is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas and snacks

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 58 years old and widowed with 6 children.

Salome works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

Salome has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (restaurant).

Salome aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 47 years old and married with 2 adult-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns 40,000 PHP per harvest.

Wilma is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seed to grow. She grows corn and rice to sell and has been doing so for 15 years.

In the future, Wilma hopes that her farming business will become progressive to be able to provide the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Beverly Gil

texts.en: Beverly Gil, a 29-year-old married mother of two schoolchildren, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a dried fish business in the Philippines for the last five years. Now requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall,  Beverly Gil would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Evelyn has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing, or RTW, like t-shirts, underwear and blouses. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy clothing, like t-shirts and blouses.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has operated a sari-sari store business in the Philippines for the past five years. She is now requesting a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as candies, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as candies, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Helcunida

texts.en: Helcunida, a 50-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 30 years, Helcunida has operated a shells-crafting business in the Philippines. Now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her business, she would like to save money to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her shells crafting.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eleseo

texts.en: Eleseo, a 35-year-old married father of two children aged 11 and 10, is a farmer growing rice and corn crops in Sta. JOsefa, Agusan Del Sur. He earns about 3000 PHP per month from this business. Eleseo has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs and hopes to have a stable business that will help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him, 29, is a married woman and the mother of four young kids who still live under her care. She is a local farmer and she frequently plants various crops on her existing farmland and usually generates an income of $3.50 each day for use by the entire family. Her husband works as a domestic worker and is making about US$3.50 each day to share the financial responsibility with Mrs. Him. Presently, she wishes to plant potatoes and a few other kinds of vegetables but she has no cash on hand to plant yet. Therefore, Mrs. Him is looking for a loan to plant potatoes and vegetables during the rainy season.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and vegetables during the rainy season.

loans.name: Tuvdenjargal

texts.en:
Tuvdenjargal is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in Mongolia's Gobi-Altai province. His two daughters, ages 17 and 20, attend college, while his wife is a tailor who manages her own business. Tuvdenjargal makes wooden products in his town, a business he started in 1993 after working as a carpenter at a private company for three years. Now he has his own workshop near his home and is planning to expand his business in the future.

A kind man who was able to stabilize his business within a few short years, Tuvdenjargal is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood and some equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and some equipment for his business.

loans.name: Erneste

texts.en:
Erneste is 30 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 8 years old. He sells sorghum, Irish potatoes and beans from 8 am until 9 pm every day. He has two years of experience in his business and he currently employs one person to help him.


Erneste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more sorghum, Irish potatoes and beans that will allow him to expand his business. With his profits, he will reinvest in his business and pay his children's school fees and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum, Irish potatoes. and beans for resale.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Ms. Sou is a single woman who currentL. lives with her famiL. members in Cambodia. She makes a living by selling goods in front of her home. She has been a business woman for a few years. She sells some items like soft drinks, sweets for kids, some cooking supplies and other essential products. She is able to make a profit of an average of US$ 2.50 per day to cover daiL. expenses. Ms. Sou will be using the loan which she is taking out to buy some fertilizers to stock up for future sale while costs are low.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizers to stock up for future sale.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda, 54, earns a living through farming. She and her husband own land that they till together, and rice is the primary crop that they grow and sell. Esmeralda, who does her best to support her family, is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers such as urea. She hopes that this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest.

In the future, Esmeralda aspires to see their children succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as urea.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin and her husband, married since 1976 and the parents of four sons and three daughters, are farmers. They live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sin is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting because she does not have her own transportation.

Photo: Sin and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Married to a weaver, Sok, a farmer and a fisherman, lives with his wife in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Because Sok also knows how to weave, he helps his wife in her business when he is free (as shown in the photo). He is now requesting a loan of $250 to continue his farming business by paying for plowing fees and fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and fertilizer.

loans.name: Patricidra

texts.en:
Patricidra, a 53-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, has been planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living for over 30 years, earning approximately Php 8,000 a month. She is requesting a new loan of Php 16,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds for her farm.

In the future, Patricidra plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Mr. Hay is a 62-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Speu Province. Mr. Hay is married to Mrs. Khiev, age 61. This couple, who work together in the crop-planting business, have six children; two of the children are married and four are single. Mr. Hay is concerned that it is hard for him to walk everywhere and he dreams of having a vehicle so he can ride it to go anywhere without hiring a motor taxi, but he doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Thus, Mr. Hay would like to take out a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for his and his whole family's use. With this loan, he could reduce their travel expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for his and his whole family's use.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 24 years old and is married with seven children aged between 2 and 12 years old. He has three years experience in his business selling various produce such as sorghum, beans, etc. His business is well-organized. He currently employs one person to help him.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more produce such as Irish potatoes, beans, sorghum, etc. for sale. He will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in his business and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Genty

texts.en: Genty is a 32 year old married woman whose husband is business man. They have 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. Genty is currently in the business of selling fruit like tomatoes, mangoes, and pineapple, and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  With the extra profits from her loan, Genty hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat (pictured here) is 61 years old. His wife, Chamnan, is 57 years old. They live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six children.

Sophat and his wife are farmers. They grow mangoes. Sophat is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase pesticide to protect his mangoes from insects.

loans.use: To purchase pesticide to protect his mangoes from insects.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun (in the photo) has been running grocery store at home. She buys grocery items from the Prek Phnao market, about five kilometers from her house. Her husband assists his wife in the business. 

Savoeun wants to buy a motorbike because she does not have her own motorbike to carry her grocery items from market to home and has to spend a lot of money on motor taxis. Hence she decided to ask for a loan to help her purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry her grocery items.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Djiguisseme 1 sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, RAHAMA, qui est la deuxième debout à gauche,                          compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare  de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme 1 group are married women, on average 38 years old with 3 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, a village in the town of Massigui in the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region in Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they grow include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Rahama, standing second from the left in the photo, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and pay for labour costs to manage about 1 hectare of rice and peanuts.
After the harvest, the produce is sold town-wide in Missagui to a clientele composed of men and women. Each member intends to realize an average profit of about 70,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertiliser, herbicide, and small equipment.
