loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 54 years old, married with 3 adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, noodles and other daily basic needs of the community. Marina had this business for 10 years.

Marina is requesting for a loan of Php 11,000 to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and rice to sell. Each month, Marina earns about Php 4,000 in her selling business.

In the future, Marina hopes that her business will increase profits and she will become a more successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and rice to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: She is currently in the Business of selling . She want to small stock business.  She is 32 years old and married with a husband who is Farmer. She has 4 children and her 2 children go to school, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to run her family smoothly.

loans.use: Small Stock

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun (pictured above), 36 years old, is a garment worker. Her husband, 24 years old, is a driver. She is asking for a loan of $700 to buy a motorcycle to drive to work. 

Sokun and her husband live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about twenty kilometers away. They have been married since 1996 and have two children-one son and one daughter. All of them are in school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME 2 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SETOU, qui est la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir environs 0,5  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme 2 group are married women, on average 37 years old with 3 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the town of Massigui in the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region in Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they grow include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Setou, standing all the way on the right in the photo, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and pay for labour costs to manage about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.
After the harvest, the produce is sold town-wide in Missagui to a clientele composed of men and women. Each member intends to realize an average profit of about 50,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and small equipment.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea is 30 years old and married. She lives in Kompong Speu Province. She is a local cultivator, and she has only one child who attends school. Mrs. Chea generates an income of approximately $2.50 per day from her current occupation. Her husband is a car repairman in the community and earns average of US$ 13 each day to support his family. 

Mrs. Chea will use the loan to build a new fence in order to maintain safe living conditions for her family. Her old fence has been broken for a long time, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to rebuild it. That is the reason why Mrs. Chea made the decision to borrow some funds from Kiva, partnered with HKL.

loans.use: to build a new fence.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay is a 40 year old married woman with 3 school-aged  children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. She had been doing this work for 15 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000.

Gay is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase additional products to sell to the people of the community. She will buy vinegar, soy sauce, noodles, canned goods, and coffee. She hopes that through the loan, she can obtain more customers.

In the future, Gay hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, soy sauce, noodles, canned goods, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 28 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. Theogene sells goats. His business is well known and well organized. He employs one person as a helper and has fifteen years' experience in this business.

Theogene has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more goats to sell. With his profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME 3  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et  en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  KARIATOU YOUSSOUF, qui est la première assise à gauche,  compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir environs 0,7  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme 3 group are married women, on average 44 years old with 2 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the town of Massigui in the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region in Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they grow include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Kariatou Youssouf, sitting all the way on the left in the photo, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and pay for labour costs to manage about 0.7 hectares of rice and peanuts.
After the harvest, the produce is sold town-wide in Missagui to a clientele composed of men and women. Each member intends to realize an average profit of about 70,000 FCFA at the end of the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: She  has a small business of keeping animal and selling it to customers . Now she wants more income to able her purchase more stock. She is 32 years old and married with a husband who is a  businessman. She has four children and two of whom are in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and make a wonderful house.

loans.use: Small Stock Business

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao, age 55, is a rice farmer. Her husband, Khan, age 56, is a construction worker. He assists his wife in the farming business when he is free. They have been married since 1978 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One child is a construction worker, and the other two children are garment workers. They live in a village on National Road Number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Pao is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

Photo: Pao and her husband

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three baby calves and one milk cow.

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir has always been a hard-working man who has made sure from his young age that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married and has two children. He has had a grocery store for seven years where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweets, soft drinks, juices, and other items. Today, he needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells. 

With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Djiguisseme 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME  4 sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  en moyenne 1 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,   DIARATOU MOUSSA, qui debout au milieu enfant au dos, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguisseme 4 group are married women, on average 32 years old with 1 child each. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the district of Massigui in the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region in Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they grow include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Diaratou Moussa, who is standing in the middle with a child on her back in the photo, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and pay for labour costs to manage about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.
After the harvest, the produce is sold district-wide in Missagui to a clientele composed of men and women. Each member intends to realize an average profit of about 35,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small equipment.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and married.
 
Samer has had a photocopying and printing shop since 2006. He has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner, laptop and printer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase  two young cattle and one cow

loans.name: Djiguisseme 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME 5 sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,   ALIMA  qui est assise au milieu,                                                 compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage)pour entretenir environs 0,8 Hectare  de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguisseme 5 group are married women, on average 34 years old with 3 children each. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the district of Massigui in the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region in Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they grow include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Alima, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and pay for labour (hoeing) costs to manage about 0.8 hectares of rice and peanuts.
After the harvest, the produce is sold district-wide in Missagui to a clientele composed of men and women. Each member intends to realize an average profit of about 40,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children.

Mansour has had a shop since 2004 selling and repairing satellite equipment. He has much experience, a deep understanding of local consumers and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his shop and to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and materials used for repairing cars.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty  has a business of selling cloths. She  request a loan  from BRAC south sudan to expand her business. She is 30 years old and married. She has two children, two of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: She want more income to able her purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Amer has owned a farm for raising calves and cows since 1987. He has much experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to make a ceiling and to buy a water pump and generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a ceiling and to buy a water pump and generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase summer season women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fokaben I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Fokaben I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KOROTIMI, deuxième debout à gauche,                       compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de  riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  12.500 FCFA environs en de fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Fokaben I are married women who average 43 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Fissaba, a village in the Commune of Massigui, in the Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work as winter begins. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaborating with the institution. 

With this new loan, KOROTIMI, who is standing second from the left in the photo, intends to buy farm inputs and to cover the cost of plowing in order to maintain a half hectare of rice and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. KOROTIMI plans on making an average profit of about 12,500 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, and manure

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has five children.

Hussein has had a car workshop since 2003 for repairing and dying (painting). He has much experience and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of food items.

loans.name: Fargana

texts.en: Fargana is an active 34-year-old mother of two children. She is engaged in a flower-growing business and cultivates roses. Her husband always helps her to improve their living conditions. The income she earns from this business, which is about 100 USD, allows her to take care of her family. She has a good credit history. Fargana needs to buy seeds, fertilizer, and flowerpots for selling her roses in the central bazaar. Fargana is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to help her with this purchase.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and flowerpots.

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en:
Firangiz is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. Her husband is a construction worker. Since she was very young, Firangiz worked on a small farm, and now, along with her husband, she works cultivating fruits and vegetables. When their crop comes in, they transport it to the central bazaar in Agsu city to sell. This activity has helped to pay for the expenses of her family and increase her profit. 

Today she needs a loan to prepare her land for the upcoming season.  She requests 1,000 AZN. Firangiz wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Fokaben Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Fokaben II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  AWA MOUSSA, première debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour  et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
Then ten members of the Fokaben II group are married women, on average 43 years old with 3 children each. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the Massigui district in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali.
They work with with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their farming businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.
With this new loan, Awa Moussa, standing all the way on the left in the picture, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour and hoeing costs to manage about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanut crops.
The produce is sold in the town of Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. Each group member intends to realize an average profit of about 40,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Nizam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 45 years old, married and has six children. Two of the children work.

Nizam has had a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

She is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy two refrigerators and a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her market. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two refrigerators, a generator and more foodstuffs for her market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase newer instruments for hair cutting

loans.name: Fokaben Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Fokaben III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,   MAH DIAKARIDIA, deuxième debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
Then ten members of the Fokaben III group are married women, on average 38 years old with 3 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the Massigui district in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali.
They work with with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their farming businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.
With this new loan, Mah Diakaridia, standing second from the left in the picture, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour costs to manage about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanut crops.
The produce is sold in the town of Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize an average profit of about 20,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and small equipment.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is currently in the business of selling fresh fish. She hopes that after receiving a loan she can buy more fish to sell. She is 28 years old. She is  married. Her husband is a farmer. She has two children, and her children go to school. A loan will help her increase her profits and also to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products to increase the stock of goods in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to increase profit

loans.name: Fokaben Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Fokaben IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  NIASSA, assise au milieu,  compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,8 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
Then ten members of the Fokaben IV group are married women, on average 33 years old with 3 children. They all live in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the Massigui district in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali.
They work with with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their farming businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.
With this new loan, Niassa, sitting in the middle in the picture, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour (hoeing) costs to manage about 0.8 hectares of rice and peanut crops.
The produce is sold in the town of Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. Each group member intends to realize an average profit of about 60,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Fokaben V Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Fokaben V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le haricot, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI, assise à droite,  compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,9 hectare de riz..
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Fokaben V group are married women, on average 31 years old with 2 children. They live mostly in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the Massigui district in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali.
They work with with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their farming businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown include, among others, small millet, beans, rice, and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.
With this new loan, Sali, sitting on the right in the picture, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour (hoeing) costs to manage about 0.9 hectares of rice crops.
The produce is sold in the town of Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize an average profit of about 75,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is 25 years old and married.  Her husband a farmer.  She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  

She is currently working in another salon.  She knows how to work in the salon.  She asking for a loan in order to start a salon.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her child.  This Loan will help her start a salon.

loans.use: To start a beauty salon

loans.name: Fokaben Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Fokaben VI sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,   MARIYA, debout à  gauche tout de vert vêtue, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour(sarclage) pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachides.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. MARIYA, espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Fokaben VI group are married women, on average 26 years old with 2 children. They live mostly in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the Massigui district in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali.
They work with with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their farming businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.
With this new loan, Mariya, dressed in green and standing on the left in the picture, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour (hoeing) costs to manage about 1 hectare of peanut crops.
The produce is sold in the town of Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. Mariya hopes to realize an average profit of about 80,000 FCFA at the end of the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Narmine

texts.en:
Narmine is a 26 years old married woman and the owner of a baby clothing shop.  Narmine is a hard working woman.  She  sells accessories in addition to baby clothes in order to attract more customers and to increase her profits.

Narmine is a woman with good reputation and she is liked by most of her customers and friends,  Narmine is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner for the second time in order to increase her summer clothes collection.  Her previous loan had a positive effect on her business.  This time she hopes it will have the same effect.  In addition to that, Narmine might do a certain treatment for her face.  Narmine hopes to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock of summer clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and fabric for sale

loans.name: Zeid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children. 

Zeid has had a food market since 1996, where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, and other dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate the outside and inside of his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To renovate the outside and inside of his market.

loans.name: Massitan

texts.fr:
Madame Massitan est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille nucléaire   avec son mari et ses enfants  au quartier Attbougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, Massitan qui fréquenta plutôt l’école coranique, commença très tôt  le commerce  auprès de ses parents. Après  plusieurs années d’apprentissage à leurs côtés, elle finit par évoluer seule en optant pour le commerce d’habits et de chaussures. Elle mène cette activité depuis maintenant 15 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles qui sont des importations.
Dans le souci de faire de face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 60 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels  tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 balle de pagnes wax et 4 douzaines de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et au Togo. Massitan vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permet de rembourser son prêt, de participer à des événements sociaux et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Massitan is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Attbougou area of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Not having attended school for societal reasons, Massitan instead attended Koranic school, and very early on began selling goods with her parents. After several years of training alongside them, she finished by starting her own business, choosing to sell clothes and shoes. She has run this business for 15 years now and has extensive experience and a large clientele. Her strength in sales is due to the quality of her items, which are imported.
With the hope of meeting her customers' demands, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso and has been working with this institution for 60 months. After 4 group loans and 3 individual loans, all repaid properly, she is on her 4th individual loan, which she intends to use to buy 1 bale of pagnes wax (brightly-printed West African clothing) and 4 dozen shoes. She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso and Togo. Massitan sells her goods in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan, participate in local events, and help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy pagnes wax (brightly-printed West African clothing) and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods and frozen foods for her grocery store

loans.name: Seriba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seriba est âgé de 27 ans, marié et père  de 2  enfants.  Il   vit  dans une famille nucléaire   avec sa femme et  ses enfants  au quartier Bougoufié  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, il commença tôt le commerce  auprès d’une connaissance. Après des années d’apprentissage à ses côtés et riche de cette expérience, il  finit par évoluer seul pour faire le commerce d’articles divers. Il mène cette activité depuis 5 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Seriba est très connu dans beaucoup de structures professionnelles et dans la ville de Ségou car il vend en ambulant dans une charrette.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, il  a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, il est à son 1er prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 5 paquets de torches et 2 cartons de pâtes dentifrices. Il  s’approvisionne sur place. Seriba vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Il  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de subvenir à ses charges familiales. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Ségou ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Seriba is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a nuclear family with his wife and children in the Bougoufié area of Ségou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 
Not having attended school for societal reasons, he very early on began to work in business with an acquaintance. After several years of training alongside his acquaintance and enriched by this experience, he finished by starting his own business selling various items. He has run this business for 5 years and has extensive experience and a large clientele. Seriba is very well-known in many professional organizations and in the city of Ségou because he sells his goods door-to-door in a cart.
With the hope of increasing his sales, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso and is on his first individual loan, which he intends to use to buy 5 packs of torches and 2 boxes of toothpaste. He gets his supplies locally. Seriba sells his goods in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. He foresees realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow him to repay his loan and provide for his family. 
His ambition is to build a home in the city of Ségou.

loans.use: To buy various items.

loans.name: Cyr Castelan

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans, marie et pere de 6 ans dont l'age varie entre 4 et 21 ans. A l'arret de ses etudes en classe de 3e, il se lance dans la vente des vaisselles en 1999. Il s'approvisionne dans les grands depots de la place, les magasins de chinois et libanais.
Il a des ventes regulieres de 50.000 a 200.000frs par jour, et a des strategies de ventes pour encourager ses meilleurs clients.

A l'octroi de son pret, il compte renforcer  son stock en achetant 10 douzaines de series de bols, 10 douzaines de series de verres de champagne,10 douzaines de verres de vins, des bols en porcelaine et services de tableset des series en aluminium
A l'avenir , il veut ouvrir un grand magasin de vaisselles, faire la vente en gros et details des couverts ,epargner et a la longue aller en Chine pour acheter de la porcelaine pour faire des livraisons sur place.
texts.en:
Cyr Castelan is 41 years old, married and the father of six children, aged 4 to 21. When he stopped studying after third grade, he opened a hardware store in 1999. He gets his supplies at the big warehouses and stores run by Chinese and Lebanese. He has a steady turnover of 50,000 to 200,000 CFA francs per day. His business strategy consists in developing customer loyalty.

When his loan is granted, he will use it to increase his inventory. He will buy 10 dozens of sets of bowls, 10 dozens of sets of champagne glasses, 10 dozens of wine glasses, china bowls, cutlery and aluminum tableware. In future he wants to open a large hardware store, sell cutlery wholesale and retail, save some money, and ultimately travel to China to buy porcelain hardware for resale at his place.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, china bowls, champagne glasses and wine glasses.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 44 year old married man, the father of 3 children and the owner of a stone factory since 1974.  Khaled's business is going fine, but sometimes, like every business, it needs support and extra cash to satisfy customers needs.

Khaled manufactures the stone used in construction, and this field is widening these days.  This is Khaled's seventh loan with A. Majmoua-Kiva partner.  All of his previous loans helped a lot in improving his business and he hopes this one will have the same effect.  His loan will help in buying necessary materials for his business.

Khaled cares a lot about his family's standard of living and he seeks the best for them.  He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old and married. 

Hamid has had a barber shop since 2008. He has a lot of experience, a good reputation, and is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $1200 loan to make a crystal showcase for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To make crystal showcase for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for taxi maintenance so the car works for longer hours and increases his income

loans.name: Soumba

texts.fr:
Madame Soumba est âgée de 61 ans, mariée  et mère de 7 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari et ses enfants  au  1er quartier  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença dès le bas âge   le commerce  auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments et céréales. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle finit par évoluer seule pour faire le commerce de fruits et de jus de fruits. Elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses fruits mais également au goût de son jus.
Pour faire son jus : elle a besoin de 5 kg de sucre, 10 sachets de poudre de jus et 2 kg de gingembre en poudre, le tout mélangé dans 8 litres d’eaux. Ensuite elle met le jus dans de bouteilles en plastiques et dans des sachets, qui seront mis dans un congélateur avant la vente. 
Dans le souci de faire de face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 60 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels  tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, un congélateur. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Soumba  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 120 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de participer à des événements sociaux. Son ambition est  de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Ms. Soumba is 61 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in a traditional household with her husband and children in the 1st quarter of Ségou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali).
Not having attended school for societal reasons, she began working in business at an early age with her mother, who sold condiments and cereals. After several years of training at her mother's side, she eventually started her own business selling fruit and fruit juice. She has run this business for 20 years and has extensive experience and a large clientele. Her strong sales are due to the quality of her fruit and also to the taste of the juice she sells.
To make her juice, she uses 5kg of sugar, 10 packets of powdered juice, and 2 kg of powdered ginger, all mixed with 8 litres of water. She then pours the juice into plastic bottles and packets, which will be stored in a freezer before being sold.
With the goal of meeting her customers' demands, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso and has been working with this institution for 60 months. After 4 solidarity (group) loans and 3 individual loans, all repaid properly, she is on her fourth individual loan, which she intends to use to buy a freezer. She gets her supplies locally. Soumba sells her goods in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and participate in traditional social events. Her ambition is to build a home.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Lydie Blandine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 40 ans , mariee et mere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 a 13 ans.Apres son Bac , n'ayant pas pu faire des etudes universitaires, elle se lance dans le commerce des pagnes de qualite qu'elle achete chez les grossistes ou alors a kinshasa, elle a une forte clientele surtout les femmes qui sont dans des mutuelles, ses ventes sont de 30.000 frs a 120.000frs par jour.

avec le pret octroye, elle va renforcer son stock en achetant 10 lots de qualiwax, 10 lots de super wax, 10 lots de pagnes real, 12 lots de pagnes Guaranteed super wax.

Elle epargne beaucoup et avec ses benefices , elle veut ouvrir une boutique de pagne de tous genres et se faire grossiste et aussi aller chine et cotonou pour s'approvisionner .
texts.en: Lydie Blandine is 40 years old, married and the mother of four children, aged 4 to 13. She finished secondary school, but was unable to attend university. She began selling high-quality pagnes (colorful West African cloths) that she buys from wholesalers or in Kinshasa. She has many customers, especially women working in mutual benefit societies. She has a turnover of 30,000 to 120,000 CFA francs per day. When her loan is granted, she will use it to increase her inventory. She will buy 10 lots of "qualiwax" pagnes, 10 lots of "superwax" pagnes, 10 lots of "real" pagnes and 12 lots of "guaranteed superwax" pagnes. She saves a lot of money and, thanks to her profit, she wants to open a boutique and sell pagnes of all kinds. She wants to become a wholesaler and also travel to China and to Cotonou to buy additional inventory.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, namely 10 lots of qualiwax pagnes, 10 lots of superwax pagnes, 10 lots of real pagnes and 12 lots of guaranteed superwax pagnes.

loans.name: Joline Niptial

texts.fr:
Cliente de 27 ans, celibataire sans enfant, elle se lance dans la vente des sandales hommes , dames et enfants, il y'a de cela 3 ans apres l'obtention de son baccalaureat.
Elle s'approvisionne chez les grossistes  sur place dans les marches et parfois elle voyage pour acheter des stocks de chaussure en gros. Ses ventes sont considerables et elle vend en moyenne 30.000 a 40.000frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son credit elle veut renforcer son stock en achetant 12 douzaines de sandales hommes,10 douzaine des sandales dames 15 douzaines de sandales pour enfants et adolescents de differents marques.

Dans les jours avenir , elle veut ouvrir une boutique specialite sandales et faire la vente en gros des sandales et avec les benefices obtenues , epargner et acheter un terrain pour sa mere et ses  soeurs.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 27-year-old single woman without children. She started selling sandals for men, ladies and children 3 years ago after completing her bachelor’s degree. She gets her merchandise from local wholesalers at the market, and she sometimes travels to buy footwear wholesale. Her sales are substantial, reaching on average 30,000 to 40,000F per day.

She will use this loan to replenish her stock by buying 12 dozen men’s sandals, 10 dozen ladies’ sandals, and 15 dozen children’s and teenagers’ sandals of various brands.

In the future, she wants to open a specialty store to sell sandals, and also sell wholesale. The revenue will go towards her savings and the purchase of a plot of land for her mother and her sisters.

loans.use: to buy 12 dozen men’s sandals, 10 dozen ladies’ sandals, and 15 dozen children’s and teenagers’ sandals for resale

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 29-year-old married man, and the father of one child. He has been renting a cafe since 2007, where he serves hot drinks and coffee. He also has Hookas available for customers to use for smoking tobacco.

Samer's customers like dealing with him. They meet up every night at his cafe to chat with each other and to enjoy their night. Samer also serves most of his customers through his fast and free delivery service. He takes their order and sends the drinks to their work and also sends Hookas to customers' homes or other requested places. He is fast in replying to customers' needs, and that's why they rely on him.

Renting a Hooka is normal these days, and it's expanding a lot. That's why Samer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase the number of Hookas he owns.

Samer has been an Al Majmoua-Kiva borrower for five consecutive loan cycles, and he has good standing in his payback history. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to increase the number of Hookas he owns.

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.en:
Akbarali is married with four children. He lives in Kumsangir, Tajikistan, and sells men’s clothing in the central market. Akbarali’s discipline and orderliness have helped his business grow steadily over the past 11 years. He is very good with people and has a unique gift of understanding people and building relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him be successful in the competitive clothing market. 

Akbarali is requesting a loan to buy clothing to sell. His biggest dream is to have financial independence and provide a decent livelihood for his family. Akbarali hopes his current loan will promote further growth in his business and help him see his dream come true.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 49-year-old married man and father of two children. He works in the grocery store he opened 12 years ago, which he improves from time to time.

Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy more food and beverages to sell this summer, in addition to soft drinks.

He is a man with a good reputation and customers like to deal with him.

Ibrahim cares a lot about providing his family with a good living and hopes to stay capable of covering all their needs.

He hopes to expand his shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Shahlokhon

texts.en:
Shahlokhon runs her own business selling fabrics to be sewn into traditional women's dresses in the central city market. There are few other businesses selling similar items in the market where Shahlokhon has her kiosk. Because of this, customer demand continues to grow all the time. Shahlokhon has established a reputation as an entrepreneur with integrity. 

Shahlokhon is requesting a loan for 5000 TJS to re-stock her inventory before the fall season. Compelling prices, along with a wide range of fashion and fabric choices to suit every taste and lifestyle, will attract many new female clients to her business. An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and expand her trade even more.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase fabric to sell

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 29 years old and is married with a newborn son. He lives in Vanadzor with his young family and his parents. Six years ago, Arman and his father set up a butcher shop. They buy beef, pork, mutton, and lamb from Lori region villages and sell it at a rented stall at the Vanadzor food market. The market is always crowded and Arman never lacks customers. Thanks to profit from his business Arman is able to support his family. 

Arman is requesting an 800,000 AMD loan to buy calves to raise and butcher to sell their meat at his stall.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise and butcher

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is 33 years old and the married father of three children. For the past 22 years, he has worked as a plumber. Ziad started working too young because he had to help his family improve their income and cover expenses. This long experience has earned him the trust and recommendation of his customers.  Ziad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles, and he is a client in good standing. His previous loans have all had a positive effect on his business. 

Ziad is requesting a loan to purchase new plumbing machines and equipment to help him finish his work professionally and in a shorter period of time. He hopes to keep on improving his business and stay healthy to continue accomplishing his business in a professional way.

loans.use: to buy new plumbing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items to sell to expand her business.

loans.name: Landry Regisse Jackson

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans, célibataire avec un enfant, a l'arrêt de ses etudes , il y'a dix ans , il ouvre une petite mercerie avec un capital de 50.000frs.Ses ventes sont considérables et en moyenne il a des recettes journalières de 18.000 a 25.000frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son prêt, il va acheter des articles de couture comme les rouleaux de popeline de différents couleurs, rouleau de la vegeline, les rubans, de la dentelle , rouleau de satin, des tissus de rideaux, des boutons et aiguilles, fils a tricoter.
Sa stratégie est de vendre ses articles a des bon prix, a réserver un accueil chaleureux a ses différents clients.

Pour l'avenir il veut être grossiste et aller dans d'autres pays comme le Nigeria, la Chine pour aller s'approvisionner, Il a l'intention d'épargner pour qu'a la longue il puisse permettre a son enfant de faire des etudes supérieur.
ayant une bonne réputation , tout le monde l'apprécie pour son esprit entrepreneuriat et sa gentillesse.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 41-year-old single man with one child. He quit school ten years ago and opened a small haberdashery with a capital of 50,000F. His sales are substantial, reaching on average 18,000 to 25,000F per day.

He will use this loan to buy sewing supplies such as bolts of poplin in different colors, a bolt of vegeline, some ribbons, lace, a bolt of satin, curtain fabrics, buttons and needles, and knitting yarn.

His business strategy is to offer his customers affordable merchandise and a friendly greeting. 

In the future, he wants to become a wholesaler and travel to other countries such as Nigeria and China to acquire new stock. He plans to save so that his child may someday pursue advanced studies. 

He has a good reputation, and everyone appreciates him for his entrepreneurial spirit and his kindness.

loans.use: to buy bolts of poplin, vegeline, ribbons, lace, lining fabrics, satin, silk, curtain fabrics, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is 29 years old and single. He has worked in the transportation sector since 2002, when he bought a van that he uses to transport people and tourists all over Lebanon. He started out as an employee, but he has started his own business. 

Walid is requesting a first-time loan from A. Majmoua to complete necessary maintenance on his van, which is his only source of income. He hopes to improve his life through his work and to have a family in the future.

loans.use: to maintain his van

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two sacks of blouses for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cartons of slippers for her business

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is 59 years old. She is a widow and lives in Yerevan with her son, daughter-in-law, and three grandchildren. She has a high school education and 26 years of experience as a mathematics teacher.

After retiring on a pension, Sonya refused to be out of work, and nine years ago she decided to organize her own business selling women's clothes and underwear. Owing to this fact, she shares the family's expenses with her son. Sonya is renting a trading stall in the trade market in Yerevan.

Sonya says she likes her present business very much, and she is very happy that she has her occupation in her mature age. Sonya received loans from Nor Horizon eleven times without repayment delay. This is Sonya's second loan from Kiva.

In her stall, she sells swimsuits and women's underwear, and she is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to increase her stall's swimsuit assortment, as swimsuits are in popular demand during summer months.

loans.use: to increase the swimsuit assortment in her trading stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  charcoal, pepper oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two bags of rice, 15 gallons of oil, and spices for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 12 cartons of dishes.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 43-year-old married man. He is the father of six children. He has been working as a carpenter for 14 years.

Mohamad is a hard worker. He's recommended by most of his clients because of his good quality of products. Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to rebuild his factory's iron-pillar rooftop with stone, which is important for the winter season. He has to do it now, in the summer, to be ready for the winter season.

Mohamad hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to rebuild his factory's iron-pillar rooftop with stone.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one carton of pig feet and one carton of frozen meat along with oil and spices for her business

loans.name: Rose Natacha

texts.fr:
Cliente de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 17 mois et 7 ans. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille , elle ouvre une boucherie en 2006 ou elle vend des vivres frais comme les cartons de poule a boullir et cuisse de poulets, cartons de queue de bœuf, cartons de poissons.
Elle a des ventes de 10.000frs a 25.000frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son prêt elle va renforcer son stock en achetant 2 cartons de queue de bœuf,2 cartons de viande, 5 carton de cuisse de poulet,2 cartons de ailes de poulet, et 3 cartons de poissons comme la sardine,les harengs et capitaines.

Sa stratégie est d'avoir du courant en permanence et palier au difficulté de transport pour faire  ses achats.
Tres populaire dans le quartier, elle veut a la longue avoir une chambre froide pour faire la vente en gros.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 31-year-old married woman with three children ranging in age from 17 months to 7 years old. To support her family, she opened a butcher shop in 2006 where she sells fresh food such chicken for boiling and chicken legs, oxtails, and fish. Her sales average 10,000 to 25,000F per day.

She will use the new loan to increase her stock by purchasing two cartons of oxtails, two cartons of meat, five cartons of chicken legs, two cartons of chicken wings, and three cartons of fish such as sardines, herrings and capitaines (Nile perch).

As a business strategy, she plans to have the electricity running permanently and solve the transportation issues she faces when making purchases. 

She is very popular in the neighborhood, and wants to someday have a cold storage room and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cartons of meat, chicken for boiling, chicken legs, tripe, oxtails, etc.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 46, is married and has six children. He lives in the Biet Lahia area of the Gaza Strip. 

Mohammed took out a $3,000 loan in order to buy new home furniture. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee who receives a decent salary, but it isn't enough to allow him to buy furniture with cash. FATEN's loan, which is repaid on monthly basis, will allow him to purchase new home furniture to live in better conditions, as what he has is 30 years old. 

Mohammed is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to buy new home furniture.

loans.name: Neli

texts.pt:
Natural do distrito de Matutuine provincia de Maputo. Estudou atė a 9ºclasse. Ela trabalha na praia de ouro sul e  tem um filho com 5 anos de idade. 
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salário que recebe e lucro do negocio consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com seus irmãos que sao clientes da Hluvuku-Adsema e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
A  senhora veio  a tornar se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema apartir  este ano, pela primeira vez ,e pretende financiamento o valor de 15.000,00Mts para compra de produtos(arroz em sacos de 25kg e 10kg, cerveja, refresco, e outros) .
Tenciona ver  seu negocio a evoluir e concluir a sua casa concluida, para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Neli is from the district of Matutuine in Maputo province. She went to school through the ninth grade. She works on Ouro Sul beach and has a five-year-old son.
Neli currently lives and works in the popular tourist destination Ponta d'Ouro in Matutuine. She uses her salary and the profits from her business to support her family and even save a little in the Banco Comercial (BCI).
She heard about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with her siblings, who are Hluvuku-Adesma clients, and decided to approach the organization to find out more about how to become a client and to take advantage of the loans to carry out her projects. 
Neli became a Hluvuku-Adesma client for the first time this year, and is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals to purchase goods (25-kg and 10-kg sacks of rice, beer, soft drinks, etc.).
She wants to see her business grow and finish building her house, and will look to Hluvuku-Adesma for more financing.

loans.use: to purchase goods (25-kg and 10-kg sacks of rice, beer, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna was born in 1950 in Bolnisi city, Georgia. When she was 20 years old she decided to move from Georgia to Armenia. Zhanna is separated and now she lives with her 23-year-old son, who she brought up without any assistance.

For more than 24 years Zhanna worked as an accountant but she always dreamed about her own business. In 1997 Zhanna set up a clothes trading business. She sells clothes that she buys from Georgia. She runs the business from different rented places during different time periods. About 10 Zhanna rents a stall in the Airarat clothes trading market in Yerevan.

Thanks to the profit from her business, Zhanna solves her small family’s needs, pays for her son’s education and repairs her apartment. Zhanna is asking for a $3,000 loan to buy a large lot of swimsuits to resell because swimsuits are in great demand during summer holidays. This is Zhanna’s 10th loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of swimsuits to resell

loans.name: Valdemira

texts.pt:
Natural do distrito de Zavala provincia de Inhambane, não concluiu o ensino primário . Tem 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 9  a 13 anos de idade sendo o mais novo o unico rapaz. Saiu de Zavala com marido e vieram a ponta de a procura de  emprego nesta zona turistica.
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na nesta zona zona e recebe salário mensal com o qual alimenta a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-adsema apartir de conversas com seus amigos e vizinhos e decide aproximar para obter mais esclarecimento sobre as condicoes de acesso ao credito e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
É cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema ha mais de 6 . Teve como seu primeiro financiamento no valor de 6.000,mts para fabrico de  blocos para sua obra;  no segundo foi no valor de 7.000,00mts tambem foi para compra de cimento; no terceiro emprestimo foi para compra de pedra no valor de 6.000,00mts; no quarto emprėstimo no valor de 7.000,00mts foi para compra de cimento para iniciar com o levantamento das paredes da sua casa e no quinto emprėstimo de 7.000,00mts foi para compra de arros para janelas .
Com o presente emprėstimo de 20.000,00mts pretende pintar a sua casa e dar inicio a uma nova construção na ciadade de Maputo.
texts.en:
Valdemira is from the Zavala region in Inhambane province. She didn't finish 8th grade. She has three children between the ages of 9 and 13; the youngest is her only son. She and her husband left Zavala and came to Ponta, which has a lot of  tourism, to find work.
Currently she lives and works in this area and earns a monthly salary that she uses to feed her family. She is able to set some aside in the bank each month.
She heard about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with her friends and neighbors and decided to approach the organization to find out more about how to apply for loans and take advantage of Hluvuku financing to carry out her projects.
She has received more than 6 loans from Hluvuku-Adsema. She used her first loan, in the amount of 6000 meticals, to make building blocks for her construction project; the second, for 7000 meticals, she used to buy cement; the third, for 6000 meticals, she used to buy stone; the fourth, for 7000 meticals, she used to buy cement to erect the walls of her house; and the fifth loan, in the amount of 7000 meticals, she used to buy bars for the windows.
She plans to use this loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, to paint her house and begin building another structure in the city of Maputo.

loans.use: to buy supplies to paint her house.

loans.name: Destin Roland

texts.fr:
jeune commerçant de 31 ans, marie avec un enfant, ayant obtenu son Bac en 2000, n'ayant pas de soutien pour continuer les etudes universitaires, il se lance dans le commerce et vente des produits divers.
Ayant deja une grande expérience dans l'exercice de son activité, il vend en moyenne 10.000 a 25000 fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son prêt, il va renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des filets d'oignons ,filets d'ail ,de cartons de tomates, paquet des cubes,des sachets  de sels de table et de sacs de sel de cuisine.

Sa stratégie est de vendre ses produits  de bonne qualité a des prix pas trop élevé pour gagner beaucoup de clients
A l'avenir , il veut être un grand homme d'affaire, faire des ventes en gros et des livraisons a domicile de certains clients.
Ayant une bonne réputation , il est très célèbre dans son quartier.
texts.en: A young shopkeeper, 31 years old, married and a father of one.  Having earned his diploma in 2000, but not having the means to continue with university, he got into trading and selling various goods.  Since he already has a good deal of experience in this business, he sells about 10,000 to 25,000 Congolese francs’ worth every day.  With this loan, he will increase his inventory of supplies by purchasing bags of onions, garlic, boxes of tomatoes, packages of bouillon cubes, packets of table salts and bags of cooking salt.  His business strategy is selling high quality products at fairly low prices to win customers.  In the future, he wants to be a great businessman, selling wholesale and providing home delivery to some customers.  He has a good reputation and is very popular in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of tomatoes, packages of bouillon cubes, bags of onions, bags of garlics and bags of salt

loans.name: Juvencio

texts.pt:
Natural da localidae de Matimule distrito de Manjacaze provincia de Gaza. Tem dois filhos com idade compreendidas entre 2 a 4 anos de idade.
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salário que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adsema apartir de conversas com seus amigos e colegas de trabalho, e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
tornar-se cliente da Hluvuku ha mais de um ano. O seu primeiro emprėstimo foi no valor de 6.000,00mts para compra de um congelador, no segundo de 8.000,00mts para compra de cimento para fabrico de  blocos e pagamento de  mão- de- obra, terceiro no valor de 9.000,00mts para compra de chapas de zinco para cobrir a sua casa na sua terra natal. O presente emprėstimo de 12.000,00mts é para iniciar com uma nova obra na ponta de ouro, compra de cimento.
Tenciona ver  a sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento
texts.en:
Juvencio is from Matimule, in the Manjacaze district of the Gaza province.  He has two children ages 2 and 4.  He currently lives and works in the tourist zone of Ponta D'Ouro, in the Matutuine district.  His salary allows him to feed his family and save a bit in his bank account at BCI.  

He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through conversations with friends and coworkers.  He decided to learn more about the process og becoming a customer and benefiting from loans to complete his projects.  He has been a customer for more than a year.  His first loan was for 6.000,00mts, which he used to purchase a freezer.  The second loan was for 8.000,00mts which he used to purchase cement for cement blocks and for labor.  The third loan was for 9.000,00mts for the purchase of zinc to roof his home in his hometown. This loan  is for 12.000,00mts to purchase cement for a new construction project in Ponta D'Ouro. 

He is anxious to complete his home and will count on Hluvuku-Adsema for future loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Thessane Armen

texts.fr:
Cliente de 30 ans,célibataire sans enfant.Après l'obtention de sa licence, n'ayant pas pu trouve du travail , elle commence une pâtisserie , ou elle fait des beignets, brioches, pains au lait, elle vend en moyenne 18.000 a 25.000 fr par jour, ses gâteaux sont vendus en détail et en gros dans les différents marches et parfois dans les boutiques d'alimentation de son quartier.

A l'octroi de son premier prêt elle compte s'approvisionner en produits de première nécessite comme 2 sacs de farine, 1 bidon d'huile de 25l, 50kg de sucre,25kg de lait, de la levure , du sucre vanille et des palettes des œufs.

Pour mieux écouler ses produits , elle use de plusieurs stratégies,faire des bon prix, gentillesse a la clientèle.
Pour le futur elle pense ouvrir une petite pâtisserie et embauche une autre personne qui va travailler avec elle, épargner pour pouvoir réaliser ses ambitions d'ouvrir un salon de the un jour.
texts.en:
A 30-year-old client, single with no children.  After earning her degree and being unable to find work, she launched a pastry business where she now makes beignets, sweet breads, and milk breads.  She brings in an average of 18,000 to 25,000 Congolese francs every day.  She sells her cakes both retail and wholesale in various markets, and sometimes in little food shops in her neighborhood.

She plans on using her first loan to purchase some basic supplies: 2 bags of flour, a 25-liter jug of oil, 50 kg of sugar, 25 kg of powdered milk, yeast, vanilla sugar and cartons of eggs.

She has several strategies for moving her products, including low prices and friendly customer service.

In the future, she plans on opening a small pastry shop of her own and hiring another person to work with her.  She also wants to save money to fulfill her dream of one day opening a tea room.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar, bags of powdered milk, jugs of oil, bags of flour and cartons of eggs

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He has been an experienced construction worker for almost five years. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He works upon the request of the clients. He cooperates with his brothers to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional wood for his work. He reports that these sales will help him increase his profit by a large percentage. In the future, he is planning to improve his work and expand his business operation by working closely with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood for his work

loans.name: Elva

texts.fr:
Cliente de 32 ans, mariée avec 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 12 ans. A l'obtention de son Brevet d'études Technique , n'ayant pas trouve du boulot elle ouvre un restaurant en 2007, ou elle vend des plats de poissons d'eau douce , de poisson sale, de bouillon de viande et poissons grilles.
Elle vend en moyenne 27.000 a 35.000 fr par jour et ses potentiels clients sont les vendeurs dans le marche ou elle vend.
Des qu'elle va recevoir son prêt elle va faire des stocks et s'approvisionner en produits qu'elle n'arrive pas a acheter a cause des moyens,tel que cartons de soles, capitaines , cartons de queue de bœuf, cartons de morue, bidon de 25l d'huile, aménager son restaurant et ajouter quelques couverts.

A l'avenir avec ses benefices ,elle compte épargner et ouvrir un restaurant moderne.
texts.en:
A 32-year-old client, married with 3 children ranging from 2 to 12 years old.  In 2007, after earning her technical degree, and being unable to find work, she opened a restaurant where she sells dishes of freshwater and saltwater fish, meat broth, and grilled fish.

She brings in an average of 27,000 to 35,000 Congolese francs each day, and her potential customers are salespeople in the market that she sells in.

Once she receives her loan, she plans on purchasing supplies that she is having difficulty affording right now: boxes of sole, nile perch, boxes of oxtail, boxes of cod, a 25-liter jug of oil, equipment for her restaurant and several table settings.

In the future, she wants to save her profits to open a modern restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase saltwater fish, smoked fish, ocean fish, jugs of oil and bags of onions.

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and two siblings. He has 10 years of experience working as a car mechanic.  In 2005, he opened his own car repair shop. He states that his business income is barely sufficient to satisfy his needs. So from time to time, he also works in a locA. company in order to earn extra money and be able to meet his financiA. obligations. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase mechanicA. tools and supplies. He is eager to reinforce his business operation so that he can focus on one job and contribute with all his efforts with the intention of making his car repair shop a stable enough source of income.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Gbigbodote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBIGBODOTE est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à la même famille et qui résident tous ensembles dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sidonie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sidonie est âgée de 38 ans et mariée à un certain Dossou. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant avec eux. Sidonie et son mari supportent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sidonie a très peu fréquenté l'école.
