Pour subvenir à ses besoins et apporter une aide à son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille, Sidonie mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, la vente de repas. Sidonie prépare en effet de la nourriture (riz et pâte de maïs), qu’elle vend à son domicile. Sidonie s’approvisionne au Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Sidonie n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Sidonie et les autres membres du groupe GBIGBODOTE  sollicitent ensemble un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Gbigbodote group is a group of three people from the same family, living together in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group’s representative, Sidonie, is the one raising her hand in the photo.  This is the third time the group has come to Alidé to request financial support to improve their business.  Sidonie is 38 years old and married to a man named Dossou.  The couple has four children, all attending school and living with them.  Sidonie and her husband work together to provide for their family’s expenses.  Sidonie only attended school for a short time.  For about 15 years, in order to meet her needs and help her husband provide for the family, she has been working selling meals.  She actually makes food (rice and cornmeal) and sells it out of her home.  Sidonie buys her supplies in Benin.  Demand from her customers is growing, and with her limited resources, Sidonie is no longer able to meet that demand.  Because of this demand and her limited resources, she and the other members of the Gbigbodote group are together requesting a loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and corn

loans.name: Banamwana

texts.en:
Banamwana is 42 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 4 and 18 years old. She has two years' experience selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, and so on.

Banamwana has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business by buying a large quantity of rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc. for sale. Banamwana will use the profit generated from this loan to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Kpenagni 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPENAGNI 1 est formé de deux personnes qui appartiennent à la même famille et qui vivent au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Raliyatou, est la plus jeune sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Raliyatou est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un gestionnaire nommé Sulkifouli. Le couple a un enfant qui n’est pas encore scolarisé mais qui vit à leur charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Raliyatou a arrêté l’école à l’université. Il y a près de quatre ans que Raliyatou exerce comme activité, la vente de boissons en cannettes au Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Raliyatou  s’approvisionne également au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Raliyatou désire renforcer son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Raliyatou sollicite, ensemble avec le second membre du groupe KPENAGNI 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Kpenagni 1 group comprises two people who belong to the same family and live in Benin. The group representative is named Raliyatou and is the younger one in the photo. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support through ALIDÉ in order to raise the level of their business. Raliyatou is 26 years old and married to an administrator named Sulkifouli. The couple have one child who is not yet in school but lives in their care. The couple provide for the various family needs together. Raliyatou ended her studies at the university level. For close to four years, she has run a business selling canned drinks in Benin; this allows her to respond to her family's needs without too much difficulty. Raliyatou gets her supplies also in Benin. With the goal of better responding to the needs of her clientele, she wants to strengthen her business and augment the stock of her products. To do this, Raliyatou, together with the second member of the Kpenagni group, is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy canned drinks.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a 48-year-old man with two children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda and desires to educate his children up to the university level. He has been in the poultry business for two years. He started with 150,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings as his working capital. Ephraim's hardships are power shortages and diseases which result to death of chicken. His dream is to own 1000 birds and to install a solar system as a constant power supply. 

Ephraim intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a twenty nine year old hardworking man with three children.  He owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. He is the sole breadwinner of the family and his wish is to educate his children.  For seven years he has been selling house hold utensils such as cups and plates and this has helped him in maintaining the family. His challenge is high transport costs and breakages during transportation. Steven's vision is to own a wholesale shop dealing in the same merchandise. Steven needs this loan to buy cups and plates for sale.

loans.use: To buy cups and plates for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her master's degree in education

loans.name: Oklunon Lingbotoche Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OKLUNON LINGBOTOCHE est formé de trois personnes qui habitent tous ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Suzanne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Suzanne est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un militaire du nom de Sosthène. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. Suzanne a très peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs trois ans que Suzanne exerce comme activité, la vente de produits divers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Suzanne s’approvisionne dans un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Suzanne désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Suzanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OKLUNON LINGBOTOCHE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Oklunon Lingbotoche group comprises three people who live together in the same area. The group representative, named Suzanne, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. This is the first time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their business. Suzanne is 49 years old and married to a serviceman named Sosthène. The couple have five children, all of whom attend school and live with them. Suzanne has had very little schooling. For about three years, she has run a business selling various items at her home; this allows her to respond to her needs and those of her family without great difficulty. Suzanne gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. With the hope of better responding to the demands of her clientele, she wants to increase the stock of her products. To do this, Suzanne, along with the other members of the Oklunon Lingbotoche group, are seeking their first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy various items.

loans.name: Julio Jose

texts.es: Julio José tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de artesanía. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, es un hombre muy humilde ha demostrado que es un hombre muy trabajador, además siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda en donde a orillas de la carretera exhibe sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de barro, pinturas, cinceles entre otros.
texts.en: Julio José is 38 years old.  His business is making and selling handicrafts.  He has been in this business for more than 15 years.  He is a very humble man who has shown himself to be very hard working and he is always alert to what his customers are requesting.  His business is located in his home.  He displays his products by the side of the road.  He is requesting this loan to buy clay, paint, chisels, etc.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint, chisels, etc.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.es: La señora Rose Marie trabaja realizando tramites y ayuda social que realiza en una oficina la misma queda ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil, para ofrecer una atención mejor y más rápida a sus clientes. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito es canalizada a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Rose Marie prepares legal paperwork and carries out social assistance work in an office which is located in the city of El Alto.  She needs a loan to buy a laptop so that she can provide her customers with a better and quicker service.  She lives in her parents' home which is in San Pedro district, in the city of La Paz.  Rose Marie is divorced and has three children.  This is the second time that one of her loan requests has been channelled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to use in her work

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban trabaja como  mecánico en un taller que comparte con un chapista de vehículos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de herramientas de trabajo, como ser una gata, estuche de dados, arco para soldadura. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciado  y tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente trabaja con Impro y por el rubro en el que trabaja se está canalizando este crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Esteban works as a mechanic in a workshop that he shares with a panel beater.  He needs this loan to buy work tools such as a jack, a socket set and a welding arc.

Esteban lives in his own home which is located in Villa Nueva Potosí district, in the city of La Paz.  He is divorced and has five children.  This is the first time that he has worked with Impro and, because of the field in which he works, his loan request is being channelled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a jack, a socket set and a welding arc for his car repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lime, a wood plane, twine, a tile cutter, a palette knife, trowels and a mallet

loans.name: Elsa Dionicia

texts.es:
Elsa Dionicia tiene 55 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, edwin 20 años, Gullermo 22, Jenny 25 y Maria 30 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Elsa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz actividad que la realiza desde hace 10 años. Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades.No enfrenta desafios impportantes. Su sueño es tener una casa nueva.

Le gusta tener limpia la casa.
texts.en:
Elsa Dionicia is 55 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children: 20 year-old Edwin, 22 year-old Guillermo, 25 year-old Jenny and 30 year-old Maria, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Elsa is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Elsa is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She does not face any major challenges.  Her dream is to own a new house.

Elsa enjoys having a clean house.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Doudedji Group

texts.fr: DOUDEDJI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même localité au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Charlotte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Boniface. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Charlotte et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Charlotte n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la couture. Il y a près de dix huit ans que Charlotte exerce cette activité. A côté de cette activité qui lui procure des revenus l’aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Charlotte  vend divers articles de mercerie.  Charlotte s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Charlotte sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupe DOUDEDJI. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
DOUDEDJI is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same town in Benin. The group’s representative, Charlotte (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 36 years old and married to a retailer by the name of Boniface. They have five children who are all in school and in their care. Charlotte and her husband live together with their children. She did not attend school but learned how to sew. 

Charlotte has been sewing for nearly 18 years. Aside from this business, which brings in the revenues helping her to support herself and her children, she sells a variety of sewing supplies. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, she and the members of the group DOUDEDJI, are requesting an initial loan. They will use this loan to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 7 years old. She has 3 years' experience selling sheets. Her business is well-organized and she works from 7 am until 6 pm every day except on Saturday.

Vestine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sheets to sell. She will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in her business and to save for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more sheets for sale.

loans.name: Mauro Nicolas

texts.es:
Mauro Nicolas tiene 27 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Mauro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial S. y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

En los timepos libre le gusta hacer deporte y viistar a los padres no viven cerca.
texts.en:
Mauro Nicolas is 27 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Mauro is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial S. and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Mauro is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges such as pests attacking his crops.  His dream is to own his own home.

In his spare time, Mauro enjoys taking part in sports and visiting his parents who do not live nearby.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jenny Carolina

texts.es:
Jenny Carolina tiene 25 años, Es casado vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Jenny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener una casa y viajar a españa para tener mejores condiciones de vida.

En los timepos libre le gusta estar en la casa convercando con los hijos y con los suegros.
texts.en:
Jenny Carolina is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province. 

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Jenny is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Jenny is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests attacking her crops.  Her dream is to own her own home and to travel to Spain so that she can enjoy better living conditions.

In her spare time, Jenny likes being at home, chatting to her children and her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria tiene 38 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Ana Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial S. y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener una casa propia. 

En los tiempos libre le gusta ver la television y jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 38 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and five children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Ana Maria is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial S. and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Ana Maria is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests attacking her crops.  Her dream is to own her own home.

In her spare time, Ana Maria enjoys watching television and playing with her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Deddeh

texts.en: Deddeh is 38 years old and lives in Bardnersville, Liberia.  She is married and has two children ages 10 and 15. For the past three years Deddah has been running a grocery shop where she sells items like toothpaste, soft drinks, water and etc. She has a lot of customers and her daily sales are very high during the dry season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more toothpaste, soft drinks and water by for her business, Deddeh plans to expand her business and wishes her children to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, soft drinks and water  for her business

loans.name: Laura Emilia

texts.es:
Laura Emilia tiene 29 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Laura Emilia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial S. y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es  realizar un viaje a otro pais con toda la familia.

En los tiempos libre le gusta reunirse con las amigas ha conversar.
texts.en:
Laura Emilia is 29 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and four children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Laura Emilia is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial S. and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Laura Emilia is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs. She faces challenges such as pests attacking her crops.  Her dream is to travel to another country with her whole family.

In her spare time, Laura Emilia enjoys meeting up with her friends to have a chat.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 35 years old and lives in Bardnersville,Liberia. She is married and has two children ages 6 and 10.  For five years Catherine has been running a medicine store in her community since there are no health facilities in the community. She learned this business from a local medical school she attended. She is requesting a loan to purchase drugs( Paracetamol, Quinine, Amodaquine and Etc), Catherine plans to open a clinic in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase the drugs ( Paracetamol, Quinine, Amodaquine and Etc) for her medicine store.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Guillermo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar una maquina para trabajar mejor.

Le gusta trabajar y ayudar a los demas.

Guillermo Gustavo is 22 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents and siblings in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Guillermo is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Guillermo is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  His dream is to buy machinery so that he can work better.

Guillermo enjoys working and helping others.

loans.name: Mahudjro 22 Group

texts.fr: MAHUDJRO 22 est un groupe de six personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La présidente du groupe, Florence (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un technicien du nom de Joachim. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Florence et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs deux enfants. Florence a très peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a six ans environs que Florence fait le commerce de boissons, de l’huile végétale et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire à son domicile. Florence s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Florence sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit avec les membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 22. Ce crédit lui servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
MAHUDJRO 22 is a group of six people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group's president, Florence (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 29 years old and married to a technician named Joachim. They have two children who both attend school. Florence and her husband live together with their two children. 

Florence received minimal schooling. She started selling beverages and vegetable oil from her home six years ago. As a secondary activity, she also sells mobile phone recharge cards. Florence gets her stock in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. This business allows her to support herself and her children. 

In order to ensure customer satisfaction, Florence is seeking a third loan together with the MAHUDJRO 22 group. This credit will help her to replenish her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetable oil and mobile phone recharge cards for resale

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo de 49 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad por medio de unos ahorros que tenia  fue con muy pocos productos y que ya tenía conocimiento de brindar el servicio de carpintería. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad en sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de lija, madera, clavo, maque, martillo, serrucho, tenazas y taladro. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere mejorar sus ganancias y brindarle a su familia una buena vida.
texts.en: Reynaldo is 49 years old.  He is a hard-working man who started his business with some savings that he had and very few products.  He already knew how to provide a carpentry service.  Most of his customers request a lot of variety in his products.  He will use this loan to buy sandpaper, wood, nails, lacquer, a hammer, a handsaw, pliers and a drill.  With the help of the loan, he would like to improve his profits and provide his family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy sandpaper, wood, nails, lacquer, a handsaw, pliers and a drill

loans.name: Ngwa Christina

texts.en:
Christina is married to a lovely husband and they are both blessed with five children and all are above the ages of 15 and are in school. She lives in Bamenda North west region of Cameroon.
Her major challenges in life have been the difficulty of her children dropping out of school and inadequate capital to start up a business for herself  before joining GHAPE. She has also suffered greatly from ill health. Given a loan she plans to buy pig feed, drugs for the animals, maintain her piggery and transport her newly bought piglets to their nursing site. Christina knows her business is going to succeed because she had acquired some basic training in finance management and pig training from GHAPE and also has ten years of experience in this business. She also  has got the land and other support. The loan if granted will enable her to sell in her neighborhood at cheaper rates. Christina has successfully borrowed and repaid loansin the past
She will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to finish the construction plan she earlier started. Her childrens school needs will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy feed, maintain the  pigsty, transportation and purchase  piglets

Gregorio too is a farmer and grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his supplies in the Peña store and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas. He is seeking a loan to buy corn and rice seeds as well as supplies and fertilizer for his fields. The money will help him to buy daily necessities. Gregorio faces challenges such as the lack of working capital. His dream is to continue working so that he can get ahead.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old, married and has two children. One of his children is currently in school. They live in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.

For less than a year Daniel has had a hardware shop where he sells building materials. He also sells produce.

To help expand his business, Daniel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase building materials for resale.

With the help of his loan from BRAC, Daniel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for resale.

loans.name: Mayela Suyen

texts.es: La señora Mayela , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder apoyar a su hijo en su estudios para que pueda ser un  profesional a la vez mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Mayela es comerciante de frutas y verduras  , con mucho esfuerzos de ambos poco a poco realizan mejoras al negocio ya que esta vez la inversión la realizaran para el taller de refrigeración de su esposo ya que en un futuro quiere establecer una venta de abarrotes  y así poder estar más con su pequeño hijo. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ; ya que sin estos programas de micro-créditos para  pequeños comerciantes no podrían salir hacia adelante , ni mejorar las condiciones de vida .
texts.en:
Mayela lives in the town of Ticuantepe together with her husband and young son.  Her plans for the future are to support her son in his studies so that he can become a professional and to improve the family's living conditions.

Mayela sells fruit and vegetables.  With a lot of effort, Mayela and her husband have gradually made improvements to their businesses.  This investment is for her husband's air-conditioning workshop.

In the future, Mayela would like to set up a grocery store so that she can spend more time with her young son.  She is grateful for the support that Afodenic provide through their Kiva fund since, without these micro-loan programs that help small traders, they would not be able to get ahead in life or improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
Maria lives in the town of San Ignacio together with her husband and children.  Her plans for the future are to improve her living conditions.

Maria has been selling products for many years.  She used to sell electrical appliances.  The biggest problem she had was people stealing her products. With the support of her husband, she has managed to establish a fruit stand in the village where she lives, while at the same time one of them goes out to other departments to make her sales in order to improve her income.

Maria is grateful for the trust that Afodenic have placed in her by letting her access a loan through their Kiva fund.

Translated from Spanish:

La señora Maria , es habitante del municipio de San Ignacio , junto a su esposo e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Maria desde hace dos años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras ,anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de electrodomestico ; lo cual fracaso por el robo de gran parte del producto , con el apoyo de su esposo han logrado establecer su puesto de venta de frutas en el mismo municipio ala vez ,le permite que uno de ellos tres veces por semana venda en los departamentos para obtener mas ingresos , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo kiva ya que sin ellos no podria mejorar su negocio y sobre todo su nivel de vida .

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Sebastiana

texts.es: Maria Sebastiana tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos y reside en la Comunidad de El Triunfo. Actualmente es una pequeña productora de café e inició su vida laboral como cortadora de éste en una Finca local, luego de un tiempo ella adquirió un poco de experiencia sobre el cultivo y con la ayuda de su padre y de un dinero que tenía ahorrado sembró una y media manzana de tierra. Ha tenido algunas pequeñas dificultades por falta de dinero, pero ahora que FAMA la está apoyando con este prestamo espera que las cosas mejoren. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de insumos agricolas como lo son: urea, abono, altocien y bolsas. Maria cree que con el apoyo de este prestamo logrará que su finca produzca mas y mejor grano de calidad, tambien espera que los ingresos obtenidos le ayuden a satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Su meta es tecnificar su finca para llegar a ser una gran productora de Café y ayudar a sus hijos a terminar con sus estudios. Es el primer prestamo que recibe de FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas para que la Institucion la sigua apoyando.
texts.en: Maria Sebastiana is 50 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She lives in the community of El Triunfo. At present, she is a small coffee producer. She began her working life as a coffee cutter in a local farm. After a time, she acquired a little experience about the crop and with her father's help and some money she had saved she planted 150 meters. She has had some problems due to a lack of money, but now that FAMA is supporting her with this loan, she hopes things will improve. She is asking for this loan to buy farming materials such as: urea, fertilizer, fungicide and bags. Maria believes that with the supoort of this loan she will be able to make her farm produce more beans of better quality. She also hopes that with the income she obtains she will be able to satisfy her family's needs. Her goal is to technologize her farm to be anle to become a great coffee producer and help her children finish their studies. This is the first loan she has received from FAMA and she expects to make her payments on time so that the institution will keep supporting her.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 59 años, Es soltero vive con solo tiene dos hijos pero son casados y no viven con el, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener mas terreno para sembrar cacao.

Le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 59 years old.  He is single and lives alone.  He has two children but they are married and do not live with him.  Pedro lives in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Luchando por una Misma Causa'  community bank is located in La Primavera, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Pedro is a farmer who grows corn, rice and beans.  He buys his products in Comercial Peña and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Pedro is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  His dream is to have more land so that he can grow cacao.

Pedro likes cleaning his house.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Lesshy

texts.en:
Lesshy was born in 1974. She is single and she  is blessed with  two children . She lives in Bamenda in the north west region of Cameroon. With the loan funds, Lesshy will buy eru,(a type of sauce), from the bush market in a distant part of the country to resell in the local market. She will also use her funds to transport her business items to the market.

Lesshy has faced health and business challenges in the past but has repaid 5 loans to GRAPE. She thinks her business is going to succeed because she had acquired some basic training on finance management and marketing strategies from GHAPE and she also has some experience in this business. The loan, if granted, will enable her to sell in her neighborhood at cheaper rates.  Lesshy has taken and repaid loans from GHAPE more than five times. 

Lesshy will plow back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family and her childrens school needs. will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy and sell eru, a kind of sauce, in the local market.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena tiene 35 años, Es soltera vive con los padres y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maria Magdalena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Le gusta es cocinar para los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 35 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and children in the Ventanas canton of the province of Los Ríos.

The members of the LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA [Fighting for the Same Cause] community bank are in the town of La Primavera, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural crops such as corn and rice. 

Maria Magdalena works farming corn, rice and beans. She buys her materials in Comercial Peña and sells her products in the wholesale market of  Ventanas.

She is asking for the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy materials and fertilizers for her crops. The support of the loan will help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to buy land to continue planting. 

She likes to cook for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Marina Sandrine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 31 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 13 ans.Ayant arrêté ses etudes en classe de seconde, elle se lance dans le commerce de la friperie, celle ci  est en activité depuis 6 ans.

Cliente de Hope ayant deja bénéficie de deux prêts et  rembourse son prêt sans difficulté et a toujours  des épargnes considérables.
Avec son troisième prêt elle compte élargir son étalage des friperies et renforcer le stock des ballots en achetant 1 ballot de pantalons jeans, 2 ballots de marinières et body, 1 ballot de la layette.Sa  stratégie est de vendre  les habits de tout les ages , de tous les sexes et toutes les saisons vendus a des prix abordables.

Pour l'avenir elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir un dépôt de friperie ou elle fera la vente des ballots de friperie  en gros et continuer avec la vente en détails.
texts.en:
A 31-year-old client, single with two children ages 3 and 13.  After dropping out of school at the 10th grade level, she got into selling secondhand clothes, and has been doing so for six years.

She has already taken out two loans from Hope, paying them back without a problem and managing to contribute significantly to her own savings.

With this third loan, she plans on widening her array of clothing and increasing the number of bales in her inventory with a bale of jeans, two bales of long-sleeved shirts and bodysuits, and one bale of baby suits.  Her strategy is to sell clothing for all ages, for both genders and for all seasons, and at affordable prices.

Her ambitions for the future are to open a warehouse for secondhand clothing, where she will sell wholesale packages of secondhand clothes while continuing her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of jeans and jean skirts, bales of long-sleeved shirts, bales of bodysuits and bales of baby suits.

Andrea enjoys cooking for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Manka'a

texts.en:
Manka'a is a widow. Her husband died, leaving behind 8 children for her to support their needs. She lives in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. Manka'a has faced serious difficulties in paying rent for her house, her children dropping out of school, and inadequate capital to start up a business for herself before joining GHAPE. She has also suffered from ill health. 

With this loan she plans to buy baby pigs, purchase cassava to produce water fufu, and to be able to afford the transportation of her products to the market. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training on finance management and marketing strategies from GHAPE and also has some form of experience in this business. Manka'a has the skills and other supporting factors for success in her business. The loan, if granted, will enable her to sell in her neighborhood at cheaper rates. She has also taken and successfully repaid loans from GHAPE in the past.

She will put her profit back into her business and use part of it to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay children’s hospital bills. Her children’s school needs will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

Le gusta hacer deporte en especial futbool.

German Enrique is 33 years old.  He is married and lives with his in-laws, his wife and his children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Luchando por una Misma Causa'  community bank is located in La Primavera, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

German is a farmer who grows corn, rice and beans.  He buys his products in Comercial Peña and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

German is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  His dream is to build a bigger house for his family so that they can live more comfortably.

German enjoys taking part in sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Ngang Eunice

texts.en:
Ngang Eunice is married with 2 children. She lives in Mankon, North West Region, Cameroon. The family shares 2 rooms. She, as many other people, has faced major challenges in her life, especially when her parents and brothers died. She has also suffered from the hands of early marriage. She got pregnant at a stage when she did not expect and dropped out of school. 

With her first loan, Ngang Eunice expanded her business of sewing uniforms for school children, particularly those at the primary level. She was so happy with the fact that she was able to provide the school needs to her children, while many people around her find it difficult to do so. Given a loan, she plans to buy more fabric and produce more uniforms for school children that she will take to far-off villages. She will be able to sell there since very few persons go so far to do this particular business. Ngang Eunice hopes the business will succeed with the experiences she has in doing this for so many years and the location of her business site in the central town. Also, she is able to withstand the stress of traveling to far-off villages.

She will put the proceeds from this loan toward catering for her children's needs. She will ensure that her health and that of her children is taken care of by paying for their education. 

She prefers loans from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE gives and the ease of obtaining and paying back.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase materials for sewing uniforms

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa.
texts.en:
Alexandra Candelaria is 33 years old.  She is married, and she lives with her husband and their children in the  Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Luchando Por Una Misma Causa” (Fighting for the Same Cause) Communal Bank is in the La Primavera neighborhood in the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to growing short cycle corn and rice.

Alexandra grows corn, rice, and beans.  She buys her products at the Comercial Peña, and she sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support from the loan will help meet her needs.

Her dream is to plant great quantities of cacao.

She likes cleaning house.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nde Marie

texts.en:
Nde Marie was born in 1975. She is married with 7 children. She lives with her family in Bamenda, North West region of Cameroon. Nde Marie finds it difficult to provide for the needs of this number of children and to provide at least a balanced diet to them. The father, who was supportive to her in her matrimonial home, died and that worsens her situation. 

Since she joined GHAPE in 2007, Nde Marie started with buying and selling fresh tomatoes then later expanded to the selling of second-hand shoes. She has gained a lot of ground in this business. With the profit she got from the sale of shoes, she added another business of selling handbags, which is also of great demand in her business place.

With a new loan, Nde Marie plans to continue her business of selling second-hand shoes, as well as handbags, thanks to the experience she has acquired while in business. She thinks this business will succeed because she has set in place the right marketing techniques involved in this business.

With the profit from this loan, she plans to re-invest in her previous business, cater to the welfare of her children, pay for their education and guarantee a good and balanced diet. She says, of course, that she will increase her living standard. 

She prefers loans from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE gives and the ease of obtaining loans and paying them back.

About GHAPE

GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

His dream is to keep working.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Shirley Margoth is 30 years old.  She is married, and she lives with her husband and their two children in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Luchando Por Una Misma Causa” (Fighting for the Same Cause) Communal Bank are in the La Primavera neighborhood in the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to growing short cycle corn and rice.

Shirley grows corn, rice, and beans.  She buys her products at Comercial Peña, and she sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.name: Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi

texts.en:
Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi was born in 1973. She lives in Church Center Bamenda, Northwest region in Cameroon. She is separated with 3 children. With the difficulties she had in the matrimonial home she was unable to cope with the situation. Her parents died when she was still young. Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi was unable to continue her education. Her last resort was to get married, which could provide a solution to her problem, but later turned out to be a negative. Since she separated from her husband, the husband has never supported her nor provided needs for the children so she is the sole person that provides for the basic needs for herself and the children. 

Before joining GHAPE, she was roasting fish, but without capital. She usually borrows and sells before paying, which earns her little income. Given a new loan, Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi plans to continue her business and even expand. She has a good site with more customers who are ready to buy. The profit she will obtain from the loan will enable her to pay her children's school fees and also provide the family with basic needs. 

Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the interest rate and repayment modalities offered. It is better when compared to other financial houses found in her locality. This, along with the training GHAPE gives its clients before a loan is granted, has also encouraged her to join GHAPE.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase fish

loans.name: Ife Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Pélagie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Pélagie est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Bernadin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pélagie et son mari supportent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pélagie a très peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a neuf ans environs que Pélagie mène comme activité la vente de maïs à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Pélagie vend de la friperie de façon ambulante. Pélagie s’approvisionne au Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Pélagie n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Pélagie et les autres membres du groupe IFE sollicitent ensemble un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The IFE group consists of three friends who live in the same area in Benin. The representative of this group is Pélagie, whose hand is raised in the picture. This is the group’s second time seeking financial support from ALIDé to bolster their activity. 

Pélagie is 33 years old and married to a man named Bernadin. The couple has four dependent children who all go to school. Pélagie and her husband provide together for the various needs of the family. 

Pélagie received very little schooling. She started selling maize from her home about nine years ago. As a sideline, she is also a street vendor of second-hand clothing. She buys her merchandise in Benin. 

Customer demand is steadily increasing but given her limited resources, Pélagie is no longer able to meet expectations. For this reason, Pélagie and the other members of the IFE group, who are experiencing similar challenges, are seeking a loan from all ALIDé

loans.use: to buy maize and used clothing for resale

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
Cliente de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 13 ans.Ayant deja bénéficiee deja de deux prêts de Hope, elle a rembourse sans difficulte et a fait des épargnes considérables.

Avec le troisième prêt elle va élargir son activité en achetant des produits de beauté, des produits cosmétiques, un appareil a manucure et pédicure, des tissages et mèches.Elle a l'intention d'élargir son activité en améliorant aussi son salon de coiffure et ajouter un autre casque.
Elle a des stratégies très viable, baisser les prix pour attirer la clientèle pour faire plus de benefices.  

Pour l'avenir, elle veut agrandir son salon et faire beaucoup de benefices pour soutenir les etudes de ses enfants .
texts.en:
This client is 37 years old, married, and has three children who are between 3 and 13 years old. Having already benefited from two loans through Hope, she has made her repayments without difficulty and built up considerable savings.

With this third loan, she is going to expand her business by buying beauty and cosmetic products, a manicure and pedicure set, weaves, and hair extensions. She intends to expand her business also by improving her hair salon and adding another hair dryer.

She has very viable strategies, namely to lower prices to attract more customers and make a larger profit.

In the future, she wants to extend her salon and make large profits in order to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, hair straighteners, manicure and pedicure items, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Guerreras Group

texts.es:
Las Guerreras, así se hace llamar este grupo solidario de Credituyo y escogieron ese nombre porque no se dejan vencer ante ninguna adversidad que se les pueda presentar en la vida. Sus integrantes radican al sur de la ciudad de Escobedo y acaban de recibir su primer préstamo ya que desean mejorar sus pequeños negocios. La mayoría de ellas se dedican a vender ropa nueva y usada, otras tienen su tienda de abarrotes y lo combinan con la venta de snacks en su domicilio, una más de ellas vende bolsas de basura y artículos de plomería.

Vicenta, la mayor del grupo, tiene su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y snacks. Ella cuenta con 56 años de edad y de su matrimonio nacieron 5 hijos, los cuales ya se encuentran todos casados. Vicenta ofrece todos los días ropa nueva a sus vecinas y vende botanas en su casa como refrescos, galletas, tostadas etc. Ella comenzó a vender estos productos debido a la crisis económica que estaba atravesando. Ahora sus ventas han ido aumentando ya que es buena vendedora y ha logrado cubrir todos sus gastos. Con su crédito, Vicenta piensa comprar más ropa para vender, adquirir mercancía para ampliar la variedad de su snack y añadir algunos abarrotes. A futuro, Vicenta anhela salir adelante, progresar en su vida y ahorrar lo suficiente para tener una buena vejez.
texts.en:
'Las Guerreras' (The Warriors) is the name of this Credituyo community bank.  The members chose this name because they don't give up when faced with setbacks in life.  The members of the group live in the south of the city of Escobedo and they have just received their first loan as they would like to improve their small businesses.  Most of the women sell new and used clothing, others own grocery stores and combine this with selling snacks from their home, one of them sells trash bags and plumbing supplies.

Vicenta, the oldest member of the group, has a business selling new clothes and snacks.  She is 56 years old and has five children from her marriage.  All of her children are now married.  Vicenta offers new clothes for sale to her neighbors every day.  She also sells snacks in her home such as soft drinks, cookies and tostadas.  She started selling these products as a result of the financial crisis that she was experiencing.  Now her sales have risen as she is a good saleswoman and she manages to cover all her expenses.  Vicenta plans to use her loan to buy more clothes to sell, to acquire merchandise so that she can expand the range of snacks she offers and to add some groceries.  In the future, Vicenta hopes to get ahead, make progress in life and save up enough so that she can enjoy a comfortable old age.

loans.use: to acquire merchandise to increase her sales

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 20 años, vive en el caserío de Cayan. Desde muy joven comenzó a independizarse y apoyar constantemente a sus padres; con quienes vive en compañía de sus 2 hermanos: Robert y Jessenia. Sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, desde niña acostumbraba a acompañarlos durante largas jornadas de trabajo en el campo. Ya cuando terminó la educación secundaria, viajó a la ciudad de Tarma para estudiar Farmacia en un instituto privado, y ahora le falta poco para terminar la carrera técnica. Pero por el momento se está dedicando a apoyar a su padre, ya que su madre sufrió un accidente, quedando postrada en cama e incapacitada para poder trabajar. Es así que hace un año comenzó a asumir las riendas de su familia y aunque le duele dejar de estudiar, se siente feliz de volver a trabajar en el campo y ayudar en la economía de su familia. Su principal actividad económica es sembrar grandes cantidades de papa sobre los 3 terrenos de cultivo que posee, logrando producir 2 veces al año. Según cuenta cada periodo de siembra llega a producir 200 sacos promedio, es por eso que desea trabajar con muchas fuerzas para salir adelante con su familia y concluir con sus estudios. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para salir adelante. Asimismo se compromete a pagar de manera puntual con sus cuotas. Rocío de recibir sus apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para su próximo siembra de papa.
texts.en: Rocio, 20, lives in the rural Cayan settlement. From the time that she was very young she started to become independent and provide constant support to her parents.  She lives with her parents along with her two siblings Robert and Jessenia.  Her parents taught her to farm, and when she was a child she used to work with them during long days in the fields.  When she finished her secondary education she traveled to the city of Tarma to study in a private institution to become a pharmacist.  Now she is lacking only a little coursework to finish that degree.  But at the moment she is devoting her time to helping her father, since her mother was in an accident that left her bedridden and unable to work.  It was because of this that a year ago, she took on added family responsibilities. Even though it pained her to leave her studies, she feels happy to be once again working in the fields and helping her family economically.  She mainly cultivates large quantities of potatoes on 3 plots of land that she has, and she manages to produce 2 harvests a year.  Since with each cultivation cycle she can produce up to 200 sacks of potatoes on average, she wants to work very hard so that she can provide for her family and return to finish her education.  She belongs to the communal bank “Corazón de Jesús," and this is her first loan with MFP, where she awaits your assistance so that she can get ahead.  Furthermore, she is committed to making her payments on time.  Once Rocio receives your support she will invest the money in the purchase of a number of sacks of manure that she will use in her next cycle of cultivating potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business, such as sweaters, pants, coats, fleece jackets, and others.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 33 años, convive con Walter, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Steve, de 9 y Reynaldo, de 3 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Está trabajadora mujer todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana se dedica a la venta de diferentes variedades de frutas. Los cuales compra al por mayor a los agricultores de la selva, donde invierte un promedio de 2 mil nuevos soles; su buen juicio en las ventas le ayudan a obtener mejores ganancia. El secreto de Miriam, es vender frutas de temporada, así cada mes tienen nuevas y ricas variedades. Sus 6 años de experiencia le garantiza su éxito; ya que al día obtiene una ganancia de 50 soles, y los días jueves y domingo, que son días de feria, tiene mayor acogida de compradores, ahí obtiene una ganancia de 100 nuevos soles. A ella le agrada mucho salir adelante y poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, ya que él siembra papa en la localidad de Huasahuasi, donde comercializa sus cosechas a buen precio. Por ello más adelante desea abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad a los vecinos del barrio donde vive. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para impulsar su negocio. Comprometiéndose a cumplir con puntualidad sus cuotas, aparte de sentirse agradecida con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Miriam de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de abono orgánico para esparcir en los cultivos de papa que pertenecen a su esposo; ya que cosechará en los próximos meses.
texts.en:
Miriam is 33 years old and lives with her husband, Walter.  They have two children: Steve, 9, and Reynaldo, 3. They live together as a family in her parents’ house located in the city of Tarma.

This hard working woman sets out daily very early in the morning; she sells a variety of fruit that she buys at wholesale from growers in the jungle investing on average 2000 new soles a month.  Her good judgment in sales helps her obtain better profits.  Miriam’s secret is selling seasonal fruit so each month she has new and delicious varieties.  Her six years experience guarantee her success since she earns a daily profit of 50 soles and on Thursdays and Sundays, which are market days, she has even more customers earning profits of 100 new soles.

She very much enjoys getting ahead and being able to help her husband with household expenses since he’s a potato farmer in Huasahuasi where he sells his crops at a good price.  Because of this, later on she’d like to open a small grocery store to sell basic need items in the neighborhood where she lives.

She’s a member of the “Integra” communal bank and this is the 7th loan with MFP where she hopes for a small loan to propel her business while committing to punctually make her payments in addition to feeling grateful for the support from her communal bank.  

If Miriam were to get your help, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of several kilograms of organic manure to spread among the potato crops belonging to her husband because harvest will be in the upcoming months.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 31 años, convive con Robert, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Ziomara, de 9 y Sebastian de 1 año de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El trabajo al que se dedica Bertha, es la compra y venta de papa en un puesto  que alquila en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Donde vende un promedio de 50 nuevos soles diarios, con una inversión de 5 mil nuevos soles. Pero cuando vende su propia producción de papa, sus ganancias se incrementan a 200 nuevos soles diarios; ya que según afirma hace 12 años que siembra papa en sus terrenos agrícolas que tienen en el pueblo de Tapo y Huasahuasi, donde genera un promedio de 90 sacos en cada cosecha. Pero hace algunos días su esposo comenzó a sembrar papa de la variedad “pericholi” en la costa del país; donde espera generar mayores ganancias. Bertha agradece a Dios por toda la bendición que le dio hasta ahora, es por ello que quiere invertir sus ganancias en la compra de su casa propia, así como también en hacer crecer su negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse bien en su banco comunal donde cumple con pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Bertha de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de papa para su negocio de compra y venta.
texts.en: Bertha is 31 years old and she lives with Robert, her husband. They have two children together, Ziomara who is 9, and Sebastian who is 1. They live in a rented home as a family and it is located in the city of Tarma. The work that Bertha carries out is the buying and selling of potatoes from a stand that she rents in the wholesalers market in the city. On average she makes a sales profit 50 nuevos soles per day and her investment is 5 thousand nuevos soles. But when she sells her own potatoes her earnings increase to 200 nuevos soles per day. She mentions that she started sowing potatoes 12 years ago on the agricultural land she owns in the villages of Tapo and Huasahuasi. She generates an average of 90 sacks in each harvest. But a few days ago her husband started sowing a variety of potatoes called "Pericholi" in the coastal region of the country. He hopes to generate better earnings there. Bertha thanks God for all of the blessings she has received today and for this reason she wants to invest her earnings in the purchase of a house of her own. She also wants to make her business grow. She is a member of the communal bank "Integra" and it is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She hopes that with the help of your collaboration she will be able to realize her plans. In addition to feeling comfortable in her communal bank, she also is able to make her loan payments on time. Upon receiving your support, Bertha will invest the funds requested in the purchase of several sacks of potatoes for her buying and selling business.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Ifede Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFEDE est composé de neuf personnes qui sont issues de la même famille.  C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Olga Rose est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Olga Rose est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un fermier du nom de Samson. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus des enfants, Olga Rose a deux autres enfants à charge. Olga Rose assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Olga Rose mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, etc.) et de façon secondaire la vente d’œufs frais à son domicile. Olga Rose s’approvisionne au Bénin. Olga Rose exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Olga Rose sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFEDE, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en: The Ifede group is made up of nine people from the same family. This is the second time that the group has asked for financial help from Alidé, in order to increase their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Olga Rose, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Olga Rose is 39 years old and married to a farmer by the name of Samson. The couple has three children who are all at school. In addition to her own children, Olga Rose has two other children in her care. She provides for the various family expenses together with her husband. In order to cover these expenses, Olga Rose has a business selling various food products (corn, etc.) and as a secondary activity she sells fresh eggs from home. She gets her supplies in Benin. She has been carrying out this business for the past twenty years. With a view to providing customer satisfaction and increasing her turnover and profit, Olga Rose is requesting a second loan together with the other members of the Ifede group.

loans.use: to buy corn and trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Kyebbumba Combined Group

texts.en:
Gereva wants a loan to buy chickens, keeping a business he has run for 10 years. Age 41, Gereva hails from Kyenjojo District in Uganda and is a father of 8 children, with whom he lives together with their mother in a permanent house. 

Having begun in brick-making, Gereva saved money to start up a business which has grown over the years. His dream is to educate his children and increase his number of birds.

He is a member of a group where he is assessing this loan and as a policy, each member guarantees the other to assess a loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens for poultry farming

loans.name: Cristina Rosaura

texts.es: La señora Cristina es casada y tiene una hija de 18 años de edad, cristina se dedica a vender producto de belleza de diferentes catalagos como E bel, Avon, Esika entre otros,  viene laborando en esta actividad por casi 2 años , su esposo trabaja como maestro constructor y con los ingresos que genera ayuda en los gastos familiares, el préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoramiento de vivienda,para comprar los materiales de construcción como ladrillo, cemento, arena,entre otros  cristina desea construir un cuarto mas en su casa, como toda mujer luchadora cristina tiene sueños uno de ellos es que su hija termine su carrera universitaria y también desea convertirse con el tiempo en una supervisora de los productos que vende y así tener mas ingresos para su bienestar familiar, cristina esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Cristina is married and has an 18-year-old daughter.  Cristina sells cosmetics from various catalogues like Ebel, Avon and Esika, among others.  She’s been working in this line of work for almost two years.  Her husband works as a master builder and helps meet family expenses with the income he earns.  

The loan she’s requesting is to do some home improvements.  She will buy building materials and supplies like bricks, cement and sand, among others.  Cristina wants to add an additional room to her house.

Like any hard working woman, she has dreams.  One of them is that her daughter completes her university studies and she also wants to become, in time, a sales supervisor of the products she sells to have more income for her family’s wellbeing.  Cristina is very grateful for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 40 años, vive en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Comenzar junto a su esposo, el trabajo arduo de la artesanía, fue fácil y divertido. Ahora que él se encuentra en Estados Unidos, trabajando como ganadero, se siente sola, pero eso no la desanima pues desde muy joven Maribel incursionó en el negocio de tejidos artesanales, trabajando para otras personas. Ahora ella se ha comprado sus propias maquinas de tejer y trabaja a pedido. Sus tejidos son de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual cada vez tiene más demanda. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que ser creativa y muy disciplinada para cumplir con sus pedidos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todos los días sin descanso para alcanzar su meta. Con tiempo, espera comprar más maquinas para poder incrementar su producción. Ya que necesita dinero para terminar de educar a sus hijos que se encuentran en la ciudad de Huancayo estudiando una carrera universitaria. Por lo que dentro de unos meses comprará su casa propia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos para poder impulsar su negocio. Asimismo agradece el apoyo de su asociación por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Maribel de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar el pago para la compra de su propia casa y si el dinero le alcanza comprará varios hilos para tejer.
texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old and lives in San Pedro de Cajas.  She is noted for being a very unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her parents’ house with her three beloved children that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

She started the hard work of crafts making with her husband; it was easy and fun.  Now that he’s in the United States working raising cattle, she feels lonely but that doesn’t discourage her because from a very early age Maribel went into the business of weaving artisanal textiles working for others. Now that she’s bought her own knitting machines, she works on order.  Her textiles are of very good quality so demand grows every day.  

What she likes about her work is that she has to be creative and very disciplined to fill her orders.  She’s been in this occupation for ten years and considers the most difficult part having to work every day without rest in order to meet her goal.  In time, she hopes to buy more machines to increase production because she needs money to finish educating her children, who are in the city of Huancayo, going to the university.  In a few months she will buy her own house.

She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” (Women to the Future) communal bank and this is the 9th loan with MFP where she hopes to have collaboration from all of you in order to propel her business ahead.  She also is grateful for the support from her communal bank so she commits to pay her installments promptly.

If Maribel were to obtain your support, she will invest the requested money to pay off her house and, if money is left over, she’ll buy yarn to weave.

loans.use: to pay off her house and also to buy knitting yarn.

loans.name: Kerens Sjl Group

texts.es:
ALCANIA COMUNAL KERENS SJL

Yolanda Elizabeth es tesorera de L. Alcancía Comunal "KERENS SJL", llamada así porque las socias saben que "KEREN" significa "MUJER GUERRERA", el grupo esta formando por personas que trabajan en sus respectivos negocios para cubrir los gastos de su hogares y a su vez obtener un pequeño ahorro, todos ellos son muy unidos ya que desde muy pequeños se conocen pues crecieron en el mismo barrio.
Yolanda Elizabeth tiene 31 años, es madre soltera, es muy activa y enérgica, vive con su padre y sus hijos, su negocio consiste en L. venta ambulatoria de mochilas, loncheras, ropa, etc., los productos que vende según sea temporada varían, también vende productos cosméticos, elL. nos comenta que "siempre tiene algo que hacer, no puede estar un momento sentada".
