Con su esfuerzo ha podido conseguir lo que tiene y darle el tiempo suficiente a sus hijos, llevarlos al colegio, cocinarles, etc., con el préstamo desea comprar ropa, casacas, chompas, chalinas, ya que el clima en esta temporada es muy frío, sueña con terminar de poner una librería en casa y ver a sus hijos terminando sus carreras, sueño que elL. misma no duda en lograr ya que pone mucho esfuerzo en todo lo que hace.
texts.en:
KERENS SJL COMMUNAL BANK

Yolanda Elizabeth is Treasurer of the “Kerens SJL” communal bank, so called because the members know that “Keren” means “woman warrior.” The group is composed of people who work in their various businesses to cover household expenses while obtaining a bit of savings.  They are all very united and have known each other since childhood since they grew up in the same neighborhood.

Yolanda Elizabeth is 31 years old.  She’s a single mother.  She’s very active and energetic.  She lives with her father and her children.   Her business consists in being a street merchant; she sells backpacks, lunch boxes, clothes, etc.  The items she sells vary according to the season she sells them in.  She also sells cosmetics.  She comments that “she always has to be doing something; she can’t spend a moment seated.” With her effort she’s managed to acquire what she has and to spend time with her children; take them to school, cook for them, etc.  

She wants to use the loan to buy clothes: jackets, sweaters and shawls because the climate this season is very cold.  She dreams with completing the installation of a stationery shop at home and that her children finish their careers, dreams that she doesn’t doubt shell reach because she puts much effort into everything she does.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Santos Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Santos Violeta es casada, tiene 41 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar sus estudios de nivel básico, tiene 6 hijos, 3 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la artesanía al tejido de cortes típicos, inició siendo operaria para otro negocio, y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilo y labor para poder seguir tejiendo cortes típicos, ya que más adelante desea ver su negocio con mayor producción. y espera hacer por medio del crédito que está solicitando.
texts.en:
Santos Violeta is 41 years old and married.  She had the opportunity to complete her basic level studies.  She has six children, three of whom are in school.  Santos Violeta makes handicrafts.  She weaves traditional clothes.  She started out working in somebody else's business and has 20 years experience.  She has the support of her husband who is a salesman.

Santos Violeta decided to request a loan to buy thread and weaving materials so that she can continue weaving her traditional clothes.  In the future, she would like to produce more and she hopes to achieve this through the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy material for weaving

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en: Kassim is a Ugandan male 38 years old who needs a loan to buy cement for the hardware business he has operated for two years. He hails from Kyenjojo district. He is a father of six children and has a wife who is a shopkeeper in the same area.  He lives in a semi-permanent house with seven people that he takes care of and he dreams of educating his children and having a good and happy family. He acquired his initial capital from clothes trading and faces a problem of customers who buy on credit and don’t pay in the end. His greatest desire is to expand his hardware business.

loans.use: To buy cement for his hardware business

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en: Rauben is a 25-year-old married man with one child and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling sodas and beer for eight years. He got his capital from selling coffee. His hardship is the high transport costs and his vision is a large-scale retail shop plus a well-educated family. Rauben needs a loan to buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen is a 38-year-old single mother of two children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for seven years. She started with working capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is lack of enough capital and her vision is opening up another outlet in town.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is a 43-year-old married woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in coffee for three years and she got her initial capital from her monthly savings as a nurse. Her hardships are machine break down and delayed payment and her vision is to own a coffee store, buying another machine plus an educated family. Claire needs a loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 30-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for 10 years. He got his start-up capital from selling yellow bananas and firewood. His hardship is high commodity prices and his vision is a bigger retail shop plus a better future. Stephen needs the loan to buy a weighing machine and cassava flour.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine and cassava flour

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 38-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the agriculture business for four years. He started by growing bananas and now has added maize and mangoes. His hardships are price fluctuation and climatic changes. His vision is a well-established farm plus a well-educated family. Daniel intends to use the loan to buy chemicals to spray and to pay for labor.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to spray and to pay for labor

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra Lizeth tiene 32 años de edad, reside en la Comunidad de Telica Abajo a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Juticalpa, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Tiene un pequeña venta de abarroteria en su casa de habitacion, la cual atiende ella sola de Lunes a Domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. Sandra comenzo este negocio dado a que frecuentemente tenia que viajar hasta Juticalpa a comprar en una bodega la provision de alimentos para su hogar y como siempre mantenia un buen inventario de productos sus vecinos le iban a quitar prestado alguno de estos y luego de un tiempo se los devolvian, asi que se le ocurrio que en vez de prestarselos se los podia vender. Con el prestamo solicitado comprará abarroteria en general (arroz, cafe, azucar, frijoles, manteca, pastas, condimentos, etc) y su pulperia estará surtida de mas y variados productos. Una dificultad con su negocio es que algunos de sus clientes le piden fiado y se tardan bastante tiempo en pagarle y eso hace que en ocasiones no tenga dinero para invertirlo en la pulperia. Su meta es sacar a sus hijos adelante en sus estudios y tener un negocio mas grande. Desde que FAMA la apoya con prestamos siente que ha podido realizar muchas cosas para ella y su familia. Tienes varios ciclos en FAMA y ha sido una cliente puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sandra Lizeth is 32 years old and lives in Telica Abajo community, 40 minutes from the city of Juticalpa.  She is a single mother and has three children. Sandra has a small grocery store in her home which she works in on her own from Monday to Sunday, from 6.00am to 9.00pm.  Sandra started this business because she frequently had to travel to Juticalpa to buy food for her household in a grocery store there.  As she kept a good stock of products in her house, her neighbors always came round to borrow stuff.  After a while they would return what they had borrowed.  It occurred to Sandra that instead of lending products, she could sell them instead.

Sandra will use the loan that she has requested to buy general groceries (rice, coffee, sugar, beans, butter, pasta, herbs and spices etc.), so that her grocery store will be better stocked with a wider range or products.  One difficulty she has with her business is that some of her customers ask to buy on account and then take quite a long time to pay.  This means that sometimes she doesn't have the money she needs to invest in her store.

Sandra's goals are to get her children ahead in their studies and to have a bigger business.  Since FAMA have been supporting her with loans, she feels that she has been able to do many things for herself and her family.  She has been working with FAMA for several loan cycles and has been punctual in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Benito es socio hace más D. 3 años  D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto” donD. está conformado por 09 personas.
Benito tiene 36 años D. edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos (1 y D. 9 años). Benito trabaja en construcción civil donD. lleva  7 años laborando en dicho rubro, para salir adelante Benito a tenido que trabajar mucho ya que tiene dos menores que dependen D. él, es por ello que su conviviente toma L. decisión D.  apoyarlo  con los gastos del  hogar, es así que en L.  actualidad Benito ayuda a su conviviente en su negocio que tiene D. venta D. ropa y D. cosméticos generando utilidades para su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado Benito va invertir en el negocio D. su pareja comprando ropas adecuada a L. temporada como chompas, chalinas, buzos, entre otros. El deseo D. Benito es terminar D. construir su vivienda ya que falta techar el primer piso, y seguir apoyando a su pareja con su negocio. L. Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto” es un grupo responsable ya que no ha tenido problemas con su pago, ellos agradecen al Programa por apoyarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Benito has been a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto” for more than 3 years.  The bank is maD. up of 9 people.
Benito is 36 years old, lives with his partner and has 2 children (1 and 9 years old). Benito works in civil construction, and has done so for 7 years.  To get ahead, Benito has had to work a lot, as he has two dependent children to support.  That is why his partner maD. the decision to help him with the household expenses.  Currently, Benito helps his partner in her business selling clothing and cosmetics, which generates profits for their family.  With the requested loan, Benito is going to invest in his partner's business by purchasing seasonal clothing, like sweaters, track suits and scarves, among other items.  Benito's wishes are to finish construction on his home, since the first floor still needs to be roofed, and to continue supporting his partner in her business.  The communal bank “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto” is a group of responsible people who have had no problems with their repayments.  They are grateful to the Program for supporting them in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, track suits and scarves.

loans.name: Angel Silverio

texts.es:
El señor Ángel Silverio es casada, tiene 50 años de edad, tuvo la ocasión de estudiar 2 años, tiene 4 hijos 1 de ellos está estudiando, se dedica a la confección de ropa, la elaboración de sudaderos para damas y caballeros para diferentes edades, inició siendo operario para otro negocio, hasta el momentos lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sudaderos, compra de tela e hilos, ya que en el futuro espera ver su negocio más amplio y con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ángel Silverio is 50 years old and married.  He was able to attend school for two years.  He has four children, one of whom is in school.  Ángel makes clothes: men's and women's sweatshirts for different ages.  He started out working for another business and has two years experience.  He has help from his wife who takes care of the housework.  

Ángel decided to request a loan to buy raw materials for making sweatshirts such as fabric and threads.  In the future, he hopes to see his business expand and make him more income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 38 años, convive con Iván. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que quieren y aman. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El deseo de Edith, es invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que según afirma, “la mejor herencia es sacarlos profesionales”. Por ello, hace 12 años que viene dedicándose a la venta de verduras, hortalizas y maíz, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Los días de mayor movimiento comercial son los miércoles, jueves y viernes, donde sale a vender, según cuenta mueve un capital de 3 mil a 2 mil nuevos soles diarios, generándole una ganancia del 10%. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder vender todo lo invertido, pero como todo negocio, ¡hay altibajos!, a veces guarda mercadería para el día siguiente. Por otro lado también se dedica a cuidar sus terrenos de cultivo, en donde siembra papa y arveja en el caserío de Patay y Palca. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar sus objetivos. Razón por la que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Edith de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de verduras, hortalizas y legumbres para comercializarlos en la feria.
texts.en:
Edith is 38 years old and lives with her partner Iván. They have 4 children, whom they love dearly. The family lives in their own home, located in the city of Tarma. Edith's desire is to invest in her children's education, because she says that "the best inheritance they can have is to grow into professional people". For this reason, she has been dedicating herself to the sale of vegetables, herbs and maize for the past 12 years, in the largest market in Tarma. The main market days are Wednesday, Thursday and Friday, when she can turn over 2000-3000 Soles in a day, generating a profit of 10%. What Edith likes best is when she is able to sell out of everything she has brought, because like any business there are highs and lows, and some times she has to keep stock over to sell the following day.

At the same time, she dedicates time to cultivating her land in the hamlet of Patay y Palca, where she sows potatoes and peas. She belongs to the "Integra" communal bank, and this is her 7th loan from [field partner] MFP. She hopes for your support in achiving her goals and vows to make her repayments on time. On receiving your support, Edith will invest the money in purchasing sacks of vegetables, herbs and pulses to sell at the market.

loans.use: To buy sacks of vegetables, herbs and pulses.

loans.name: Nely Marleny

texts.en: Nely lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras where she makes a living selling clothes. She has had this small business for the past five years and has a stall located in a central location. Nely is requesting a loan of Lps 15,000 to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es: Serapio tiene 43 años, habita en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 queridos hijos, de quienes es el único sustento, ya que hace unos años su esposa falleció. A lo largo de su vida, Serapio ha trabajado en muchas cosas, ahora se decida al trabajo de la albañilería, y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos. Y es que cuando hay que levantar el techo de una casa o levantar una pared, él el encargado para estos trabajos. Lo que más le gusta es la manera en que disfruta de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con este digno trabajo puede pagar la educación de sus hijos. Lleva 10 años realizando este oficio y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que ha hecho que sus manos envejezcan rápidamente, por ese motivo desea renovar sus herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace. Es muy responsable tanto así que no quiere quedar mal en su asociación, por falta de dinero, así que constantemente hace contactos para realizar más trabajos de construcción. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece y espera tener una vez más su colaboración para continuar con su negocio. Razón por lo que se compromete en cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas. Serapio de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de tablones nuevos y materiales necesarios, con lo cual podrá trabajar en más construcciones a la vez y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Serapio is 43 years old and he lives in the community of San Pedro de Cajas. He is known to be a very simple and hardworking man. He lives in a rental house together with his 4 beloved children. He is their only support; a few years ago his wife passed away. Throughout his life Serapio has worked in many trades. Currently he is a construction worker and he is frequently sought out by his neighbors. Whenever there is a roof to be installed or a wall that needs to be built he is in charge of the work. What he most enjoys is the way he is able to enjoy his work in construction. He knows that with this decent work he is able to pay for his children's education. He has been in business for 10 years. The most difficult part is having to transport the heavy bricks and to mix cement with his bare hands. It has caused his hands to age very quickly. He wishes to upgrade his tools, to improve the work that he carries out. He is very responsible and he doesn't want to be in difficulties with his association for lack of money. So he is constantly making new contactsto secure more construction jobs. He is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres al Futuro", meaning "Women to the Future" and it is his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He is thankful and he hopes that he will have your support once again, to continue on with his  business. He is committed to making his loan payments on time. Serapio will invest the funds from the loan which he requests to purchase new wooden planks and necessary products. With these he will be able to work in additional construction projects and in turn, to improve his financial income.

loans.use: to purchase planks of wood and products he needs to improve his construction work.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma tiene 28 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que junto a su mamá  luchan por salir adelante. Viven juntas en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Está hermosa y valiosa mujer, todos los días trabaja en la venta de papa al por mayor y menor, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello, pues desde que era joven ayudaba a su mamá en la venta de papa por kilos. Pero con el tiempo su Mamá enfermó y por tanto Enma tuvo que dedicarse al negocio familia. Ahora en el mercado mayorista, donde ella vende, todos la admiran y respetan por su buen corazón y dedicación, ya que al mes genera una ganancia de 2 mil a 3 mil nuevos soles. La otra actividad que tiene es la agricultura, donde siembra papa, zanahoria y hortalizas en los terrenos agrícolas de sus padres, que según cuenta se ubican en el caserío de Huaricolca, donde todos los fines de semana los fertiliza, riega y cultiva. Para después cosechar y venderlo en el mercado de Tarma, donde ella trabaja, así obtiene mayores ganancias. Ahora ella está ahorrando para comprar su propia casa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todas ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Enma de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja y de papa de la variedad “yungay”, con ello comenzará su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Enma is 28, single and a hard worker, who works to better her life alongside her mother.  They live in their own house in the city of Tarma.  For the past 10 years, Enma has worked selling potatoes in both retail and wholesale markets.  She has been in the business since she was small, helping her mother sell potatoes by the kilo. After her mother took ill, Enma took over the family business.  She now has quite a following in the wholesale market, where she is widely admired for her good nature and dedication; each month she makes a profit of 2,000-3,000 soles.  Enma also grows crops such as potatoes and carrots on lands in the town of Huaricolca, which she visits every weekend to water, fertilize and tend her crops. After harvest, she sells her produce in the market inTarma, where they fetch good prices.  Enma is now saving to buy a house, and with this credit (her seventh with MFP) she hopes to move toward her goals.  Enma plans to buy sacks of seed to grow peas and potatoes of the “yungay” variety, to plant next season.  She is committed to prompt repayment.

loans.use: to buy sacks of seed to grow peas and potatoes

loans.name: Alva Rosa

texts.en: Alva lives in Danli, Honduras, where she earns a living by preparing and selling homemade baked goods. She has run this small business for the last 12 years, and primarily bakes bread as well as a local snack called rosquilla. Alva is a returning client and has a punctual payment history on her previous loans. She is currently requesting a loan of 14,000 Honduran lempiras (LPS) to purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal, eggs, butter, sugar, milk and cheese.

loans.name: Willian Alexis

texts.en: Willian lives in Danli, Honduras where he makes a living by selling clothes. He has run this business for the past two years and sells clothing out of a stall in the center of town. Willian is requesting a loan of HNL 15,000 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es: Doña Gumercinda tiene 59 años de edad, es casada, tiene siete hijos, y vive en el Barrio Victoria en el Municipio de Talanga. Desde muy joven Doña Gumercinda se dedicó a la venta de zapatos y ropa para mujeres, hombres y niños. Para adquirir la mercaderia viajaba a El Salvador y Panamá porque en esos paises la encontraba muy barata y asi ella podia venderla a sus clientes a un precio bajo. Pero con el transcurrir del tiempo se dio cuenta que estaba descuidando a su esposo e hijos, así que decidió cambiar de negocio y estableció en una parte de su casa una pulperia. El prestamo lo solicita para abarroteria en general y surtir su negocio, asi sus ventas incrementaran y con las ganancias obtenidas su condicion de vida y la de su familia mejorará. Su meta y la de su familia es hacer crecer el negocio. Doña Gumercinda es cliente de FAMA por varios ciclos y manifiesta que el apoyo recibido a traves de los prestamos ha sido de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Gumercinda is 59 years old, married, and has 7 children.  She lives in the Victoria neighborhood of the municipality of Talanga.  From a very young age, Gumercinda has worked in retail; at first she sold shoes and clothing for men, women and children.  To buy her merchandise she used to travel to El Salvador and Panama, because in these countries she could find very low cost products that she could sell to her customers at a very low price.  But over time, she realized that she was neglecting her husband and children and so she decided to change her business and set up a grocery store in her house.  The loan that she requests is to buy a variety of groceries to stock her store.  In this way her sales will increase and with the earnings she obtains, the living conditions for Gumercinda and her family will improve.  Her goal, and that of her family, is to grow the business. Gumercinda has been a client of FAMA for a number of loan cycles, and she states that the support that she has received through these loans has been a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rigoberto Antonio, es casado, tiene 24 años de edad, es graduado en mecánica, tiene 3 hijos 1 de ellos está estudiando, se dedica a la mecánica en general, reparación, mantenimiento de vehículos, inició este trabajo siendo auxiliar en otro negocio y al momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de una Pluma para levantar motores, ya que quiere contar con las herramientas  necesarias para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Espera ver su negocio bien posicionado y tener muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Rigoberto Antonio is married, 24 years old and has graduated from a mechanics training program. He has three children, one of whom is studying. He works in general mechanics, and fixing and maintaining vehicles. He started working as an assitant mechanic in another business and currently has six years of experience.

He is requesting a loan to buy a jack to lift cars, since he already has many of the tools necessary to bring quality services to his clients. He hopes to improve his business and have many clients.

loans.use: to buy a jack for his auto shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 21 years old, single and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. She lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.

Esther has a business of selling fruits and vegetables, which she has done for the past two years. To help grow her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by investing capital in her business.

With the help of her loan, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her child. In the future, Esther hopes to take a tailoring course.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Aurora Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura Francisca es casada, tiene 31 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la agropecuaria, a la crianza de animales domésticos, inicio la crianza de animales criando pollos y vacas, hasta el momentos lleva 10 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de cerdos y la alimentación de estos animales  ya que quiere mejorar en la granja que  tiene. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a: la ventas de refacciones,  venta de combustible de vehículos, confección de  delantales y a la crianza de animales. Ya que en el futuro desean tener una granja con muchos animales.
texts.en:
Aura Francisca is married, 31 years old, and she did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is a livestock farmer and she raises domestic animals. She started out raising poultry and cows. She has 10 years' experience in this field of work. She has her husband's support. He is a construction worker. 

She decided to organize a group to request a loan. It will help her to purchase pigs and livestock feed. She wants to improve the farm that she has. The other members of the group have the following business types: spare parts sales, fuel gas sales, apron sales, and livestock sales. In the future she wants to have a farm with many livestock.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and livestock feed.

loans.name: Sharifah's Group

texts.en:
Sharifah's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Sharifah herself is 21 years old, single and has no children. She lives in the town of Bulenga in Kampala’s western region in Uganda. For a year Sharifah has sold fruits and vegetables.

To help expand her business, Sharifah has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. Her loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. Sharifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sharifah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself by buying new clothes. In the future, Sharifah hopes to own a salon.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is not currently in school.  

Jackie has a beauty salon business, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jackie hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself like buying new clothes.  

In the future, Jackie hopes to expand her business into a bigger beauty salon. Jackie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her to be hard working and know that she has to repay the money.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is is not currently in school. Dorah has a business of a beauty salon, which she has had for two years. She also has a second business of selling cosmetics like body lotions.  

To help expand her business, Dorah has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Dorah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself like buying new clothes.  

In the future, Dorah hopes to own a plot of land and build a house. Dorah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: El  señor Eulogio es casado, tiene hijos los cuales ya son mayores y ninguno de ellos esta a  su cargo puesto que son mayores, eulogio se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de bicicletas, tambien a soldar cocinas, viene realizando esta actividad casi 6 años,anteriormente eulogio trabajaba como afilador de cuchillo en la calle con un esmeril de mano, los desafíos que enfrenta eulogio es la falta de seguridad en su negocio, ya que el local que  tiene carece de la misma, el préstamo que esta solicitando es para arreglar el portón de negocio y parte del dinero que le sobre comprara repuestos para su taller de bicicletas y reparacion de cosinas,eulogio tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es hacer crecer mas su negocio para brindar un mejor servicio a sus cliente y así tener una mejor calidad de vida, eulogio esta muy agradecido con la ayuda que se le esta brindado.
texts.en:
Eulogio is married.  He has grown-up children and none of them are dependent upon him any more.  Eulogio repairs and services bicycles.  He also services and repairs stoves.  He has been in this business for almost six years.  Eulogio used to work as a knife sharpener, working in the street with a whetstone.  The challenges that he faces are a lack of security at his business premises.  The loan that he is requesting will be used to fix the front door of his business premises.  He will also use part of the money that is left over to buy spare parts for his bicycle workshop and his business servicing and fixing stoves.

Eulogio has many dreams.  One of them is to grow his business some more so that he can provide a better service to his customers and thereby enjoy a better quality of life.  He is very grateful for the support that he has been given.

loans.use: to fix the main door of his premises and to buy some tools for his business maintaining bicycles and stoves

loans.name: Kevin's Group

texts.en:
Kevin‘s group is comprised of two hard working women. Kevin is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child who is not currently in school. Kevin has a business of selling food, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Kevin has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Kevin hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

In the future, Kevin hopes to own a plot of land. Kevin is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital and her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Daveiva Amparo

texts.es:
Daveiva de 46 años es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive en el municipio de Soledad con sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 a 19 años; allí se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y productos de limpieza para el hogar. Como esencias, fragancias, productos veterinarios, ácidos, venenos y desinfectantes.  Daveiva  empezó su negocio en el años 1995,  por iniciativa e su esposo ya fallecido, quien decidió proporcionarle un medio de sustento a su familia antes de morir, de manera que pudieran defenderse y eso fue su legado antes de morir en el año 2007. Su negocio ha sido posible, gracias a  los esfuerzos realizados conjuntamente con  su cuñada y su hijo mayor y se siente muy satisfecha porque su disciplina y trabajo han permitido responder a las necesidades básicas de su familia.  Su meta más adelante es ampliarlo y tener mas puntos comerciales, pero su capital de trabajo aun no es suficiente para este propósito. Este es justamente el motivo por el cual ha recurrido a su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará esencias, desinfectantes, productos veterinarios en mayor volumen, con tal de ganar descuentos por la compra de contado y en una cuantía que entusiasme a sus proveedores para hacerle una oferta tentadora.  
Su mayor desafío y sueño, es lograr que sus hijos tengan una educación de calidad para que en un futuro, logren ser exitosos en todo lo que emprendan.  Mientras Daveiva trabaja por cumplir sus sueños, se esmera día a dio por lograr fortalecer su negocio, en el cual ocurre un repunte en las ventas en cada quincena y una disminución de ellas en épocas de lluvia, lo cual se convierte también  en su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Daveiva, 46, is a hardworking woman who lives in Soledad with her three children who are from 11-19 years of age.  She sells natural products and cleaning items for the home such as perfumes, essence,  veterinary products, acids, poisons and disinfectants.  Daveiva began her business on her own in 1995 prompted by her husband so that she would be able to support her family if he died , and this business was his legacy when he passed away in 2007.  Her business has been possible thanks to the efforts she has made along with her sister-in-law and her oldest son, and she feels very happy because her discipline and work have allowed her to cover her family’s basic expenses.  

Her goal for the future is to expand her business and to have more sales options, but her working capital isn’t enough for this end.  So this is exactly the motivation she has to request a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use the money to buy  essences, disinfectants  and a large number of veterinary products so that she can receive volume discounts and purchase with cash in a quantity that will appeal to her suppliers to make her attractive offers.

Her greatest dream and challenge is for her children to have a quality education so that their futures will be successful in all they try to achieve.  While Daveiva works to fulfill these dreams, she strives every day to strengthen her business: her sales rise every payday and fall in the rainy season, which has also become a big challenge.

loans.use: To buy essences, disinfectants, and veterinary products in large volume

loans.name: Yvonne's Group

texts.en:
Yvonne‘s group is comprised of four hardworking women. Yvonne herself is twenty years old, single and has no children. She lives in the town of Nasana in the central region of Kampala in Uganda. For three years Yvonne has sold jewelry.

To help expand her business, Yvonne has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX, a portion of her group's loan, from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to purchase more jewelry to sell. Yvonne is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by investing in her enterprise.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yvonne hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself like buying new clothes. In the future, Yvonne hopes to own a small retail shop where she will sell sugar.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidée de 40 años es una mujer muy trabajadora, que vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 5 a 27 años. Desde hace 18 años, cuando recibió del estado nacional, la vivienda con la que actualmente cuenta, pues por causa de la erosión  había quedado damnificada,   decidió dedicarse a la venta de café y azúcar, aprovechando que su madre era conocida por trabajar en el mercado y un granero le financió sus primeras compras,  cuando la madre de Aidée desapareció, su negocio de vender plátanos quedó a su cargo, de aquí obtuvo su mayor experiencia. Posteriormente observando oportunidades de negocio en el barrio donde habita aun, y con tal de lograr un cuidado más cercano de sus obligaciones familiares, decidió ubicar un negocio de venta de alimentos,    pues los vecinos pasaban trabajo para preparar los almuerzos, porque no había gas y ellos trabajaban, fue así como se le ocurrió  ofrecer alimentos cocinando con leña; desde allí data su clientela, con los que poco a poco ha logrado un posicionamiento hasta el día de hoy, en el que cuenta con una mejor infraestructura y con un buen mercado de  amas de casa, empleados, trabajadores independientes, que son los consumidores de los  productos de fritanguera y almuerzos  que vende diariamente y de contado principalmente, aunque tiene unos pocos créditos. 
Su meta más adelante es hacer adecuaciones locativas, ubicando una terraza confortable protegida del sol y de la lluvia, para que sus clientes encuentren un refugio agradable y de descanso  en su punto comercial. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento y con el comprará en mayor volumen, insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos, pues su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar de contado y en un importante volumen, que le permita sostener unos buenos inventarios y disminuir los costos del transporte.
texts.en:
Aidée, 40, is a very hard working woman living in the town of Soledad with her spouse.  She has five children ranging in ages from 5 to 27 years.  For the last 18 years, since she received the house she currently lives in from the national government because she was the victim of erosion, she decided to sell coffee and sugar taking advantage of the fact that her mother was known for working in the market.  A grainer financed her initial purchases.  When Aidée’s mother disappeared her banana selling business passed down to her and this is where she gained most of her experience.

Later on, noticing business opportunities in the neighborhood where she still lives and striving to be able to pay closer attention to her family obligations, she decided to set up a food selling business because it was difficult for her neighbors because there was no gas and they had to work so it occurred to her to offer prepared meals cooked over firewood.  Her clientele dates from back then and she has gradually gained position in the market until this day when she has better infrastructure and a good clientele composed of housewives, employees, independent workers who consume the fried fast food and lunches she prepares daily; most pay cash though she does have a few credit customers.

Her goal for later on is to do more adjustments to her locale installing a comfortable terrace that’s protected from the sun and the rain so that her customers can find a place of rest and pleasant refuge in her place of business.

Her Kiva loan is her first.  She will buy ingredients in larger amounts to prepare her meals because her greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to pay cash and in significant volume that will allow her to keep good stock inventory on hand and to diminish transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy meal preparation ingredients in larger amounts.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 35 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad y tienen 3 hijos de 19, 15, 7 años de edad los dos primeros estudian en colegio y el ultimo en escuelas fiscales. Tiene una tienda.

Empezó hace 7 años con la venta de un terreno en el campo decidió establecer una tienda poco a poco fue creciendo. Labora de 5H00 am con su esposo primero van a monte bello hacer las compras a por mayor para su respectivas ventas en su tienda. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como arroz, azúcar, confitería. En un futuro desea comprar cemento, hierro y arena para seguir construyendo su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mariana, 35, lives in a peri-urban zone in El Fortín in Guayaquil.  Her husband’s a Security Guard and they have three children who are 19, 15 and 7 years of age.  The first two are in secondary school and the youngest goes to public school.  

She has a store.  She started out seven years ago with the sale of a piece of land in the countryside.  She decided to open a store and gradually it grew.  She starts work at 5am with her husband.  First they go to Monte Bello to make some wholesale purchases for subsequent resale in her store.  

With help from the loan she wants to buy more merchandise like rice, sugar and snacks.  In the future she wants to buy cement, iron rods and sand to continue building her house and that her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es: La joven Claudia Elena tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 3 años, la experiencia que ha obtenido en su negocio ha sido muy reconfortante. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Claudia tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, siempre se ha hecho responsable por proporcionarle las cosas más básicas, a pesar de que ella no pudo terminar sus estudios quiere que su hija logra ser una profesional. Este crédito es para la compra de  perfumes, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Claudia Elena has a business selling general merchandise.  The experience she’s gained in business over the last three years has been very reassuring.  Most of her customers request quite a variety of products.

Claudia has two children in her care.  She has always been responsible for providing them with the basics despite not being able to finish her studies; she wants her daughter to become a professional. 

This loan is to buy perfume, footwear, clothing in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.use: to buy perfume, footwear, clothing in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 22 years old, married and has two children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Kasubi in the central Kampala region of Uganda. For two years Evelyn has had a small shop where she sells sugar. She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.

To help expand her business, Evelyn has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar for resale. Evelyn is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which will help her prospects for the future.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Evelyn hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself like buying new clothes. In the future, Evelyn hopes to work hard to create a bigger shop. She wants to buy a plot of land for herself.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for resale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 34 años, convive con Américo, de 36 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, un varón y una niña recién nacida. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Se encuentra muy feliz, hace poco recibió la llegada de su última hija; en este tiempo se mantuvo en cama por problemas de salud. A pesar de ello está valiente mujer continua trabajando para poder brindarle a su hija todo lo necesario. El Trabajo al que se dedica está hermosa mujer, es la compra y venta de verduras, los que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad durante los días miércoles, viernes y domingos, en un puesto que arrendó en la sección de verduras. Estos días de feria, todos los pobladores compran alimentos para la semana, Lidia, mueve un capital de 3 mil a 4 mi nuevos soles, generando una ganancia del 10%, en los mejores días. Pero como buena administradora de sus ganancias ella invirtió todos sus ahorros en la compra de un camión, para trasladar lo que ha cosechado a la ciudad. Además se dedica en la siembra de papa y arveja, cuyo cultivo cuida y fertiliza los fines de semana. Le va muy bien en su trabajo ya que, vendiendo al menudeo ella misma, sin intermediarios, genera más ganancias en sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para concretar sus objetivos. Asimismo se compromete en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Lidia de recibir su apoyo, comprará con el dinero solicitado en varios sacos verduras, legumbres y hortalizas; para surtir su negocio y si le alcanza el dinero piensa comprar semilla de arveja para comenzar su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Lidia is 34 years old and lives together with Américo who is 36 years old. They both have two children, one boy and one newborn girl. They live as a family in a rented house located in the city of Tarma. She is very happy given the recent arrival of her last daughter. Recently she has been bedridden due to health problems. Despite this, she is a very courageous woman, continuing to work to be able to provide her daughter with the necessities. 

The work that this lovely woman makes a living at is the purchase and sale of vegetables. She sells them at the wholesale market in her city on Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays in a stall she rented in the vegetable section. On market days everyone in town buys food for the week. Lidia moves between 3,000 and 4,000 nuevos soles worth, generating a 10% profit on the best days. However, as a good manager of her profits, she invests all of her savings in the purchase of a truck to transport her harvest to the city. Additionally, she earns money by planting potatoes and peas. She tends to and fertilizes her crops on weekends. 

Her work is going well. Selling her product at retail herself, without middlemen, generates more profits on her crops. She belongs to the “Integra” community bank and this is her seventh loan with MFP where she awaits financial support to realize her objectives. She is committed to making her payments with punctuality. Upon receiving this support, Lidia will use the money requested to buy several sacks of vegetables, legumes and greens to supply her business. If there is enough money left over she will buy pea seeds to start the next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables, legumes and greens as well as pea seeds.

loans.name: Janneth Felicita

texts.es:
Janneth de 42 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Es viuda y tiene 2 hijos de 26 y 22 años. Se dedica a la venta de comida.

Escogió esa actividad a medida de que su esposo falleció y quedo sola son sus hijos. Labora todas la mañana en la preparación de los almuerzos y al medio día sale a entregar sus almuerzos a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar cosas para sus ventas de almuerzos como condimentos, arroz, carnes para aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere abrir un local para la ventas de comida, tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Janneth, 42, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (so called because of the tree of the species Guazuma ulmifolia; El Guasmo is a popular, humble class neighborhood that used to be a hacienda) in Guayaquil.  She’s a widow and has two children who are 26 and 22 years of age.  She sells food.

She chose this activity as a result of her husband’s death and being left alone with her children.  She works all morning preparing the meals and goes out at noon to deliver them to her customers.  With help from the loan she wants to buy things for her lunch sales like condiments, rice and meats to increase her income.  In the future she wants to open a locale for her food sales, to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and beverages.

loans.name: Jesus Enrique

texts.es: El joven Jesús, es soltero no tiene hijos se dedica a la fabricación de puertas corredizas, ventanas, portones, entre otro, aprendió el oficio por ayuda de sus tíos los cuales le enseñaron esta labor, viene trabajando en esta actividad por casi 3 años, el local en cual hace sus trabajos es alquilado, Jesús tiene un desafió que tiene que afrontar que son las lluvias que hacen la zona por donde vive y eso hace que sus herramientas de trabajo se mojen pero el enfrenta este desafió colocando una tolva de tela solo por el momento, es por ello que Jesús esta solicitando el dinero para comprar un techo de eternit para instalarlo en su local, y así evitaría que las lluvias mojen sus herramientas, Jesús tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es adquirir un local propio y así dejaría de pagar alquiler, y sus ingresos incrementaría con lo cual  mejorar su calidad de vida, Jesús esta muy contento con la confianza que se le esta brindada.
texts.en:
Jesús is single and has no children.  He manufactures sliding doors, windows and gates, among others.  He learned the occupation helping his uncles who taught him this work.  He’s been working at this for almost three years.  

The place where he does his work is leased.  Jesús faces a challenge which is the rain that's common where he lives.  It causes his work tools to get wet.  He answers the challenge by placing a temporary canvas covering but this is only a momentary solution.  Because of this, Jesús is asking for the money to buy an Eternit (registered trademark for fiber cement) roof and install it in his locale to keep the rain from wetting his tools.

Jesús has many dreams.  One of them is to get a place of his own and stop paying rental fees.  His income would increase and this would lead to improved quality of life.  Jesús is very happy because of the trust that’s been placed in him.

loans.use: to buy an Eternit roof for his business to protect himself from the rain.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda es socia del banco comunal La Positiva del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, lleva ocho años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, su esposo es técnico dental y por eso decidió trabajar, para estar también en actividad y sentirse útil.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará más productos de belleza como: 2 colonias, 1lápiz labial, 1 crema para el pelo, 1 delineador, 2 enjuagues, 1 esmalte de uñas, 2 perfumes para hombre, 1 fragancia de mujer.
Todos estos productos son los más solicitados por sus amistades y clientes.

Las ganas de trabajar se las dan sus hijos, porque ponen todo de su parte para salir adelante, tanto en sus estudios como en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a member of “La Positiva” (The Positive) Communal Bank of Calleria district, Ucayali department.  She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children.

Esmeralda has sold beauty products from a catalog for the last 8 years with loans from the Manuela Ramos organization. Her husband is a dental technician and she decided to work so that she too could be active and feel useful.

With this new loan of 1,000 new sols Esmeralda will buy more beauty products, including 2 colognes, 1 lip pencil, 1 skin cream, 1 eye liner, 2 moisturizers, 1 nail polish, 2 men's colognes, and 1 lady's fragrance. These are the products most often solicited by her friends and customers.

The motivation to work comes from her children. Esmeralda puts all her efforts into getting ahead, in her studies as well as in her work.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Josefina Andreina

texts.es:
Josefina de 28 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Su esposo labora en un hacienda San Juan y tienen un hijo de 8 meses. Se dedica a ayudar a los niños por medio de la ilustre municipalidad, como promotora.

Le encanta ayudar a los niños que se inspiro a ser parte de este proyecto municipal que ya tiene 4 años laborando en esta institución para servir a niños de los sectores marginales de playas. Labora de 8H30 am a 17H00 pm. También se dedica a vende colas, bonice, etc. con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para arreglo de su vivienda y quiere terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Josefina is 28 years old and lives in a town called “Beaches” in a tourist area of Ecuador where there is a wide diversity of shellfish. Her husband works at the San Juan Hacienda and they have an eight-month-old child. She helps children in this illustrious town by working as a promoter. 
She gets great joy by helping children as part of a municipal project. This project, started four years ago, helps children that are in marginal neighborhoods in the town. She works from 8:30am until 5pm. She also sells sodas, popsicles, etc. With the proceeds from this loan she would like to buy construction materials in order to fix her house. She would like to finish her higher education.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Camposeco Group

texts.es:
El señor Juan es casada, tiene 54 años D. edad, se dedica a la confección D. prendas o sastrería,  tuvo la oportunidad D.  estudiar seis años en educación primaria, tiene 8 hijos 6 D. los cuales están estudiando, inició este trabajo siendo empleado para otro negocio, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra D. materia prima para la confección, va a comprar telas D.  diferentes clases y colores, sierres, botones e hilo. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza D. animales, y a la confección D. pantalones.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old and married. His work is making garments and working as a tailor. He had the opportunity to go to school for six years of primary education. He has 8 children, 6 of whom are currently in school. He started this work when he was employed by another business, and now he has 10 years of experience. He has the support of his wife, who dedicates herself to domestic duties. 

He decided to organize a group so that he could request a loan that would allow him to buy materials to create his products. He will buy fabrics of diifferent kinds and colors, zippers, buttons and thread. The other group members work raising animals and making pants.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread and other items.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del banco comunal La Positiva del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  Todavía tiene una hija que está a su cargo, su esposo es empleado en una institución del estado.
Los préstamos recibidos de Manuela Ramos le han servido para invertirlos en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cerveza.
Con su nuevo préstamo de s/.1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 cajas de cerveza, 3 paquetes de gaseosas guaraná, 2 paquetes de gaseosa pepsi, 3 paquetes de agua, 2 paquetes de inca cola, 2 paquetes de coca cola.
Su negocio está bien surtido  ahora ya puede  atender mejor a sus clientes  porque tiene variedad de productos.  Su esposo la ayuda los fines de semanas.
Manuela Ramos tiene mucha confianza en que las mujeres pueden conseguir lo que se proponen en la vida gracias a su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga is a member of “The Positive” Community Bank located in the Calleria Department in Ucayali. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. She has one child who is still a dependent. Her husband has a job with a state agency.
The loans that she has received from Manuela Ramos have allowed her to invest in her business. She sells drinks, sodas and beer.
With this new loan of 1800.00 new soles she will buy 15 cases of beer, 3 flats of guarana soda, 2 flats of water, 2 flats of Inca cola and 2 flats of coca cola. 
Her business now has a good variety of products. Her husband helps her on the weekends.
Manuela Ramos has a lot of confidence that the women are able to complete their obligations in life thanks to your efforts.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas.

loans.name: Lucien Colombia

texts.es:
Colombia de 39 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Su esposo es chofer tienen 3 hijos que están en escuela fiscal. Tiene un taller de costuras.

Con las ganas de progresar decidió ponerse su taller de costuras. Labora sola de 6H00 am en adelante. Con el apoyo del préstamo quiere adquirir una maquina recubridora para realizar sus trabajos de costura mejorar su negocio. Ella desea expandir mas se negocio.
texts.en:
Colombia is 39 years old.  She lives in the Primavera area of Duran, is a suburban area that was originally an informal settlement, with a number of hills, creeks and lagoons which still linger - remnants of a disappearing ecology.  Her husband is a driver.  They have 3 children who attend school.  She has a sewing business.  

Colombia wanted to get ahead, so she set up a sewing business.  She works alone from 6am onward.  With help from a loan she would like to purchase a coverstitch machine to use in her sewing projects and improve her business.  She would like  for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a coverstitch machine.

loans.name: Betsy Margarita

texts.es:
Betsy de 37 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Su esposo trabaja en un taller automotriz y tienen hijos de 23, 24 y 18 años.. ella se dedica en su tienda de víveres.

El negocio lo tiene desde que se caso y con eso ha mantenido a su familia, labora de 6H00 am a 111H00 pm todos los días. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere compras mas víveres como arroz cola aceites a por mayor para vender en su tienda y mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro se quiere comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Betsy is 37 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil called "las Orquídeas" ["The Orchids"] (so named because there were originally many orchid flowers there). Her husband works in an automobile workshop and they have children who are 24, 23, and 18 years old. Betsy works in her own grocery store.

She has had this business since she got married, and with it, has been able to take care of her family. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m. every day. With the help of this loan, she will buy more foodstuffs like rice, soft drinks, and oil. She will purchase wholesale to sell in her store and improve her earnings. In the future, she would like to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store, such as candies, drinks, and canned goods

loans.name: Ana Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Ana es socia del banco comunal La positiva del Distrito calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Lleva poco tiempo en Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, la mercadería que compra es solo para repartir porque trabaja solo con pedidos y cancelan a fines de mes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 6 pantalones, 12 blusas, 12 polos, 6 faldas para niñas, 3 vestidos, 6 pantaloneta, 12 polos para niños, 6 pantalones para niños.
Es poco lo que puede comprar con su nuevo préstamo pero como son pedidos no se queda con nada, después que cobra vuelve a invertir en más mercadería.

Manuela Ramos  le ha dado la oportunidad de poder tener un pequeño negocio donde pueda generar sus propios ingresos para poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of communal bank "La Positiva" located in the Calleria district, Ucayali state.  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  

She recently joined Manual Ramos.  Her business is selling clothing.  The merchandise she buys is exclusively to fulfill orders and customers pay at the end of the month.  With a new loan of 1,000.00 New Soles she will buy:  6 pairs of pants, 12 blouses, 12 polo shirts, 6 girls' skirts, 3 dresses, 6 pairs of underwear, 12 boys' polos, and 6 pairs of boys' pants.  She can't purchase very much with her new loan, but since it is to fulfill orders, she is not left with unsold merchandise.  After she is paid, she buys new merchandise.  

Manuela Ramos has given her the opportunity to have a small business where she can earn her own income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, polo shirts, etc.

loans.name: Betty Gladys

texts.es:
Betty de 29 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Su esposo labora en una empresa como operador de maquinas. Tienen tres hijos de 3 y 2 años y uno de 8 meses. Tienen una papelería.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás cuando pasaron por una crisis financiera su esposo no trabajaba que ella hizo un préstamo y abrió una papelería para mantener a la familia. Labora de lunes a domingos de 6H00 am a 8H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas mercadería para sus respectivas ventas en el negocio y tener mas ingresos. En un futuro quiere darle lo mejor a sus hijos en educación y salud.
texts.en:
Betty is 29 years old.  She lives in Fortin, a peripheral area of  the city of Guayaquil. Her husband works for a company as a machine operator.  They have three children ages 3, 2, and 8 months. They have a stationery shop.  

She started the business some time ago when they were in a financial crisis and her husband was not working.  She got a loan and opened a stationery shop to support the family.  She works from Monday to Sunday from 6am to 8pm.  With this loan she would like to purchase more merchandise to sell and to increase her income.  In the future she would like to provide her children with the best education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase paper goods, notebooks, and pens.

loans.name: Olivia's Group

texts.en:
Olivia’s group is comprised of three hardworking women. Olivia herself is twenty years old, single and has no children. She lives in the town of Kasubi in the central Kampala region of Uganda. 

For a year Olivia has sold clothes. To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. Olivia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

Olivia’s loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Olivia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself by buying new clothes. In the future, Olivia hopes to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es socia del banco comunal La positiva del Distrito De calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos, solo dos de ellos están en su poder.
Hace cuatro años que pertenece a la familia de Manuela Ramos, tiempo que aprovechó y con un pequeño capital pudo trabajar como consultora de belleza, ofreciendo sus productos por catálogo y brindándoles facilidades a sus clientes a quienes les vende al crédito y al contado.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 champoo, 1 colonia para niño, 1 lápiz delineador,  1 crema para manos, 2 perfumes para hombres, 1 esmalte de uñas, 1 crema lipo reductora, 1 quita esmalte.
Toda sus ganancia que obtiene por la venta de sus productos lo invierte en la compra de madera para poder arreglar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida, sobre todo para sus hijos.
"Gracias a Manuela Ramos por todas las cosas buenas que me ha dado" y que lo estoy sabiendo aprovechar.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the communal bank "La Positiva" in the Callería district of the state of Ucayali.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 7 children.  Two of them still live with her.  

She has been part of the Manuela Ramos family for four years. She took advantage of this time and with a little capital she started a business as a beauty consultant.  She sells products by catalog, and offers her customers payment options of cash or on credit.  With her new loan of 1,000.00 New Soles, she will purchase 2 shampoos, 1 baby cologne, 1 eyeliner, 1 hand cream, 2 men's colognes, 1 nail polish, 1 slenderizing cream, and 1 nail polish remover. All of the profits she makes through the sale of her products are invested in purchasing wood to fix her home and improve her quality of life, especially for her children.  

"Thanks to Manual Ramos for all of the good things that they have given me and I am putting to good use."

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, colognes, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Rolando

texts.es:
Pedro D. 27 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno D. los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión D. mariscos. Su esposa le ayuda a su suegra en el restaurante ubicado en el mercado central, tienen 2 niña que estudian en escueL. fiscal. Se dedica L. servicio D. taxi motos.

Comenzó su trabajo alquilando una tricimoto para prestar sus servicios D. transportación D. carga y personal con unos ahorros y el préstamo compro su propia moto L. cual esta dentro D. una compañía D. taxi motos L. cual presta sus servicios dentro y fuera D. L. cuidad. Labora desD. muy temprano llevando a los niños a l escueL. y personas a sus trabajos, empieza desD. las 6H00 am a 7H00 pm.. Con L. ayuda del préstamo quiere darle mantenimiento a su tricimoto y comprar llantas nuevas para mayor comodidad. El anheL. un día comprar un carro para manejarlo como taxista y emprender una compañía D. taxis para que presten sus servicios dentro y fuera D. L. ciudad, ademas D. terminar sus casa para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro, 27, lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador's tourist sites with a vast array of seafood. His wife helps her mother in the restaurant located in the central market. They have two girls who are studying at the public school. He works in the motorcycle taxi business.

He started out by renting a three-wheeled motorcycle ("tricimoto") to proviD. transportation services for cargo and passengers. With his savings and a loan, he bought his own motorcycle that is part of a motorcycle taxi company, which operates both within and outsiD. the town. He starts work early, at 6 a.m., taking children to school and people to work, and keeps going till 7 p.m. 

With the help of this loan, he wants to maintain his tricimoto and buy new tires that are more comfortable. His dream is to one day buy a car that he can drive as a taxi and start up a taxi company to proviD. services both within and outsiD. the town. He would also like to finish his house so that he can live there with his family.

loans.use: to buy tires and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del banco comunal la Positiva del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos hace 10  años aproximadamente, se dedica a la venta de  producto de belleza, es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y muy puntual  con las cosas que tiene que hacer.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará: 3 esmaltes, 5 bolsos, 3 estuches de aretes, 1 collar, 4 colonias para hombre, 3 talcos para pies, 4 labiales, 2 cuartetos de sombras, 2 perfumes para mujer, 3 shampoo, 3 enjuagues, 2 espumas de afeitar y otros productos más que son muy solicitados.
Con este negocio ha podido cumplir con todos sus cuotas a Manuela Ramos sin ningún inconveniente, porque sabe administrar bien su negocio y  tiene  clientes muy responsables.
Agradece que Manuela Ramos por permitirle tener acceso a los préstamos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “La Positiva” (The Positive) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 65 years old and has four children.

Juana has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for approximately 10 years. She sells beauty products and is very dedicated to her work. In addition, she is very prompt with the things she has to do.

This new loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy three nail polishes, five bags, three cases of earrings, one necklace, four colognes for men, three foot powders, four lipsticks, two packs of eye shadow, two perfumes for women, three shampoos, three hair rinses, two shaving creams, and other products that are frequently requested.

With her business, Juana has been able to repay all of her loans to Manuela Ramos without any problems because she knows how to manage her business and has very responsible customers. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to access the loans.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics and toiletries.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child currently in school. Hadijah has had a wholesale shoe business for two years and has a second business selling tap water.  

To help expand her business, Hadijah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase shoes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hadijah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, Hadijah hopes to own a small retail shop that sells sugar. Hadijah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Cinthya Marina

texts.es:
La señora Cinthya es socia del banco comunal La Positiva, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 24 Años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.  Su esposo es docente (maestro).
Recién lleva 4 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y ya tiene un negocio rentable, ella brinda servicios telefónicos, cuenta con dos cabinas telefónicas donde pueden hacer llamadas de larga distancia local, nacional e internacional.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, comprará una cabina mas, 3 banquitos de madera, comprará recargas telefónicas y 20 tarjetas telefónicas.
Cinthya y su esposo decidieron poner este negocio para poder mejorar sus ingresos ya que sus hijos demmandan otros gastos y este pequeño negoico permite cubrir algunos gastos.

Manuela Ramos brinda la ayuda necesaria para que las mujeres puedan tener sus propios negocios  y puedan brindar a sus hijos la ayuda necesaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Cinthya is a member of the Communal Bank “La Positiva” (The Positive) which is in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 24 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is a teacher.

Cinthya has recently participated in four loan cycle with Manuela Ramos. She already has a profitable business providing telephone services. Cinthya has two phone booths where people can place local calls, as well as national and international long distance calls.

With this new loan of 1200 PEN, she will buy another phone booth, three wooden tables, rechargeable phone plans, and 20 calling cards. Cinthya and her husband decided to establish this business so that they can improve their income. Their child requires a lot of expenses and this small business allows them to cover some of them.

Manuela Ramos provides the necessary assistance to women so that they can have their own businesses and provide their children the support they need.

loans.use: to purchase another phone booth, three wooden tables, rechargeable phone plans, and 20 calling cards.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther‘s group is comprised of three hard-working women. Esther, on the left, is a 21 year-old who lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Esther has had a small hotel for one year.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food to cook for sale in the hotel. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, Esther hopes to study and get some knowledge of the Red Cross. Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects by imcreasing capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase food to cook for sale in the hotel.

loans.name: Chonimabaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Santa Catalina es casada tiene 55 años D. edad, tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar 3 años la educación primaria, tiene 9 hijos 5 D. los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a prestar servicios D. salud y como también a la crianza D. animales domésticos, inicio este negocio criando pollos criollos y hasta el momento  tiene 10 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo  que le servirá para comprar cerdos, para engorD. y cuando crezcan poder venderlos y recuperar la inversión y ganancias. Los demás integrantes también se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales. Esperan en el futuro contar con una granja.
texts.en:
Sra. Santa Catalina is 55 years old, married, and has a third graD. education. She has nine children, five of whom are in school. Santa Catalina provides health services and also raises domesticated animals. She started her business by raising chickens and has now accumulated 10 years of experience. Santa Catalina has the support of her husband, who works as a farmer.

She decided to organize a group so that she could request a loan for buying pigs to fatten. When the animals are grown, she will sell them so that she can recoup her investment and earn a profit. The other members also engage in agriculture and raising animals. They hope to have a farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and nails.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita tiene 61 años. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos en nuestra institución. Su actividad es la compra y venta de cerdos. Aduce la señora que ha logrado progresar aun más, ya que siempre ha invertido los créditos para lo que solicita. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad, pues la mayoría de sus clientes conocen muy bien la ubicación de su negocio, ya que es en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de dos cerdos.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is 61 years old. This is not the first time she has received loans from Fundación Leon 2000. Her business involves buying and selling pigs. Margarita states that she has been able to make significantly more progress as a result of investing the loans she has requested. She has been in business for more than 20 years and most of her customers know her very well. Her business is located at her home and most of her customers come to her to buy the animals.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two pigs.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal las fresitas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 49 años D. edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva 25 ciclos en el banco comunal, en los últimos años ha cambiando D. negocio, conla intención D. mejorar sus ingresos, ahora invertirá en la implementación D. un pequeño Kiosco que tiene en su casa donD. venderá productos D. pan llevar (abarrotes).
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 jabas D. gaseosa, 2 paquetes D. agua, 2 bolsas D. pan, 2 bolsas D. biscocho, 1 paquete D. néctar en cajitas, 2 paquetes D. fideos, 3 paquetes D. papel higiénico, 1 saco D. azúcar,1 saco D. arroz, 1 caja D. aceite, 1 caja D. conservas .
Espera que en este nuevo negocio pueda darle buenos resultados ya que aún tiene un hijo que requiere D. su ayuda económica para cubrir sus estudios.  Su esposo es operador D. maquinaria pesada.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. poder ayudar a su hijo que en este momento necesita D. su apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Fresitas” (The Little Strawberries) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children.

María has been with the Communal Bank for 25 loan cycles. In recent years, she has converted her business with the intention of improving her income. Now she will invest in a small kiosk in her house where she plans to sell baked goods and groceries.

With her new loan of 3000 PEN, María will buy five cases of sodas, two packets of water, two bags of bread, two bags of cookies, one packet of nectar in boxes, two packets of noodles, three packets of toilet paper, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, one case of oil, and one case of preserves.

She hopes that this new business will generate good results. María has a son who needs her financial support to pay for his studies. Her husband is a heavy equipment operator.

María is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to help her son who currently needs her financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, water, bread, cookies, nectar, noodles, toilet paper, sugar, rice, oil, and preserves.

loans.name: Jader Wadid

texts.es:
