Jader  de 29 años vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí se dedica a una actividad comercial a la cual ha adicionado servicios, él vende refrescos y variedades en un punto donde además ofrece servicios de comunicaciones , alquiler de películas y servicios de telecomunicaciones. Como su meta es crecer y aumentar sus ingreses mediante esta actividad, requiere siempre tener un capital de trabajo disponible, para lograr oportunidades de compras en mayores volúmenes y descuentos especiales por ofertas de contado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, Sexto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará al por mayor y de contado mercancía variada, gaseosas, poni malta,  planes de celulares para ampliar su cobertura, especialmente en este segundo semestre donde se incrementan por efectos de las primas y bonificaciones que reciben los jefes de familias, para cubrir necesidades gustos e intereses que no le serian posible sin estos ingresos adicionales recibidos a final de cada semestre. 
Jader inició su negocio en el año 2003 y terminó su carrera de abogado en el año 2010, ahora ejerce su profesión y es apoyado en su negocio por su señora madre,  mujer trabajadora que recibe su pensión de jubilación y ejerce esta actividad con la alegría que genera el servicio. Sus principales clientes son los peatones que allí circundan, referidos de sus clientes y familiares, por eso aunque la competencia es bien fuerte se sostiene con la fidelidad de sus compradores y el aprecio de su clientela, que en esta actividad  está en las mejores manos, las de su madre.  El negocio de Jader atiende en los horarios de 9:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m. de lunes a domingo y este esfuerzo acompañado del apoyo de la Fundación,   ha logrado su fortalecimiento y logros como el de ser hoy un abogado titulado que cada día se esmera por ganar prestigio y ser muy exitoso .
texts.en:
Jader is 29 years old and lives in the July 20th neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla. There he has a retail business that also provides additional services. He sells soft drinks and miscellaneous goods from a storefront that also provides communication services. Jader also rents out movies and offers telecommunication services. His goal is to grow and increase his income from his business activities. He is always in need of disposable operating capital so that he can take advantage of opportunities to make large purchases and secure special discounts for paying with cash. This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan, his sixth with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Jader will use the funds to buy in bulk and with cash. He plans to purchase various types of merchandise, soft drinks, Pony Malta (a Colombian brand of wheat soda), and a variety of cellular plans so that he can expand his coverage. During the second half of the year, many heads of household receive pay raises and bonuses. Jader wants to cater to the tastes and interests of his customers. Otherwise, it would not be possible for him to generate additional income by the end of the year.

Jader started his business in 2003 and finished his law degree in 2010. Now he practices his profession as a lawyer and his mother helps him with managing the business. She is a hardworking woman who receives a retirement pension and operates the business with a friendly and helpful attitude. His main customers are pedestrians off the street, referrals from his existing customers, and relatives. Even though the level of competition is strong, Jader is able to maintain the loyalty and appreciation of his customers because they know they are in good hands, those of his mother. Jader’s business is open from 9am to 9pm, Monday through Sunday. Through his efforts and with the help of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he has built up sufficient credentials to be recognized as a qualified lawyer. Each day he strives to gain prestige and become more successful.

loans.use: to purchase various types of merchandise, soft drinks, wheat soda, and a variety of cellular plans.

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es: Jenny de 45 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Ella tiene 1 hijo con el que sueña ver prósperos y productivos y por eso se esmera por lograr una educación de calidad y es precisamente su mayor motivación en el trabajo que desempeña como comerciante. Ella inició su negocio con capital propio, pues con ciertos ahorros que tenía decide comenzar a comprar ciertos productos para empezar a ofrecer a todo público en general. La competencia de su mercado es muy fuerte y para ella este es su mayor desafío, pero como maneja muy bien sus relaciones con los proveedores, logra precios que traslada a sus clientes, con los cuales los mantiene fieles. Este crédito es para la compra de  cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, lápiz labial, brillos, lápiz de ojos entre otras.
texts.en:
Jenny is 45 years old and sells cosmetics. She has a son who dreams of becoming prosperous and productive, so she strives to provide him a quality education. He also serves as great motivation for her work as a merchant. Jenny started her business with her own capital. She used her savings to buy certain products so that she could start offering them to the general public. Her greatest challenge is the competition in the marketplace since it is very strong. However, she has been able to manage the relationship with her distributors very well. By negotiating good prices, she is able to pass the savings along to her customers who have remained loyal.

This loan will be used to buy crèmes, treatments, shampoos, lipsticks, lip gloss, eyeliner, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase crèmes, treatments, shampoos, lipsticks, lip gloss, eyeliner, and other products.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es: Indudablemente las damas son las mejores vendedoras. ¿Porqué? Porque además de que  son carismáticas, conversadoras y sensibles: jamás se rinden!!! Así se identifican las señoras del grupo Dios es amor y mi guía con tres años y medio trabajando, la señora Shirley de 63 años de edad, es divorciada y es un vivo ejemplo de una mujer luchadora e invencible, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, con trece años en el negocio, y ahora es una gran  líder de ventas de dos empresas, comenzó en este negocio a raíz que la economía en su hogar era demasiada baja y necesitaba mayores ingresos para los  3 hijos que tiene, ella ha podido darles lo mejor ya que ahora son todos mayores de edad, con su esfuerzo a dado estudios a sus hijos y a podido mejorar su casa, también se dedica a la venta de zapatos que trae desde Trujillo, con el reciente préstamo piensa en viajar a traer variedad de zapatos.
texts.en:
Women are undoubtedly better sellers. Why? They are charismatic, conversationalists, and sensitive. Plus, they never give up! These qualities help identify the ladies of the group “Dios es Amor y Mi Guía” (God is Love and My Guide) and their work.

Sra. Shirley, age 63 and divorced, is a living example of a determined and invincible woman. She sells beauty products and has been in business for 13 years. Now she is the leader of two sales businesses. Shirley started working because the household finances were lacking and she needed more income to support her three children. She was able to provide them the best. Now that her children are grown, she strives to provide an education for their children and also make improvements to her home.

Shirley also sells shoes that she brings in from Trujillo. With this recent loan, she plans to travel so that she can bring back a variety of shoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora.  Ella habita en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas, ahí formó su familia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos a los que ama y son su razón de vivir. Está hábil y emprendedora mujer se dedica a la artesanía, la actividad agrícola de la mayoría de habitantes de la zona. Desde muy joven comenzó tejiendo diversas prendas de vestir de deferentes colores y tamaño. Con el tiempo pudo adquirir telares para tejer mayor variedad de prendas artesanales. Pero cuando formó su familia junto a su esposo, logró adquirir con su apoyo, un terreno agrícola extenso en la ciudad de Junín, donde comenzaron a sembrar maca en grandes cantidades. Según cuenta su esposo viaja constante a ese lugar, para poder cuidar de sus cultivos, además de aprovechar en dedicarse a su oficio de albañilería, con lo que hasta el momento puede ahorrar dinero para sus futuros planes. Ya que desean para el futuro abrir una tienda grande y surtida, donde pueda Silvia, vender sus tejidos y confecciones a un buen precio y ya no estar repartiendo a terceras personas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera una vez más del apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir con sus objetivos. Asimismo se compromete en cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas. Silvia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales como: palos de madera, algodón y diferentes tipos de hilos para confeccionar sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 32, is a hardworking woman who lives in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. Her family consists of her husband and the two children she loves because they are her reason for living. Silvia is a capable and enterprising woman who makes handicrafts even though most of the local residents engage in farming. At a young age, she began knitting different articles of clothing in different colors and sizes. Over time, she acquired looms for weaving a wider variety of handmade clothes. When she and her husband started their family, Silvia was able to gain his support. They have a large plot of farmland in the city of Junín where they grow maca root in large quantities. According to her husband, he must travel constantly to this place so that he can take care of the crops. In addition, he takes advantage of his job as a bricklayer by currently saving money for their future plans. Silvia wants to open a large store in the future that is well-stocked because she will be able to sell her woven creations at a good price without having to rely on third-party distributors.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Futuro” (Women of the Future) and this is her second loan with MFP. Silvia hopes to gain everyone’s support so that she can continue pursuing her goals. She also promises to complete her payments on time. With the support, Silvia will invest the money she requested in the purchase of materials such as wooden knitting needles, cotton, and different types of yarn for producing her knitted items.

loans.use: to purchase wooden knitting needles, cotton, and different types of yarn.

loans.name: Francisca Anita

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del banco comunal Miraflores del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Lleva 2 años en este banco comunal, ella se dedica a brindar el servicio D. lavandería.  Francisca deciD. trabajar para estar ocupada y ayudar a su esposo y lo hace solo en su casa, son hijos ya son mayores.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 bolsas D. cemento, 1 metro D. arena, 2 varillas D. fierro y 3 planchas D. calamina transparente, todo ello para acondicionar un ambiente más amplio para su lavandería.
Se siente muy bien porque pueD. generar sus propios ingresos y comprarse lo que necesita, agradece a Manuela Ramos por todas las cosas que ha conseguido hasta este momento.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the "Miraflores" community bank, in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 60 years old, married, and has three children.

Francisca has been a member of this community bank for two years.  Her business is providing a laundry service.  She decided to work so that she could keep herself busy and help her husband.  She does her work alone, at home.  Her children are already grown up.

Francisca will use this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy 5 bags of cement, 1 meter of sand, 2 iron rods and 3 sheets of transparent corrugated plastic in order to enlarge the area in which she carries out her laundry service.

Francisca feels very good because she is able to make her own income and buy what she needs.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the things that she has achieved up to now.

loans.use: to buy cement, corrugated plastic sheets, etc.

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es: Olga Isabel tiene 43 años, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario. Su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de costura, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para limpiar, realizar las compras y empezar las diferentes prendas de vestir que tiene pendiente. Hace más de  8 años, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es que decide establecer un pequeño negocio al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la habilidad para hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento es para hilos, tijeras, telas, botones, encajes, bordados, zipper y aceite para engrasar su máquina.
texts.en: Olga Isabel is 43 years old.  Her goal is to do well in life in order to get ahead in her business as it is extremely important in enabling her to continue supporting her family.  Olga's business is providing a dressmaking service.  She has to get up early in order to clean, do her shopping and start making the different clothes that she has pending.  She started this business more than eight years ago because she needed work.  She decided to set up a small business.  At first, she didn't have the experience she needed to run this business but, over time, she acquired the skill of talking to her customers.  She will use this loan to buy threads, scissors, fabric, buttons, lace, embroidered fabric, zippers and oil for oiling her sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors, fabric, buttons, lace, embroidered fabric, zippers and oil for her sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as filler, paint, thinner, hand tools, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isabelita

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 64 años D. edad.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, se dedica a dar el servicio D. alquiler D. cuartos (habitaciones), tiene una casa D. 2 pisos.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 baldes D. pintura, 2 rollos D. cables D. luz, 10 tubos pvc, 2 cinta aislante, pago D. mano D. obra (pintor y electricista).
Esta vez hará arreglos que necesita su casa para estar más presentable y poder alquilar sus habitaciones a un buen precio.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. poder pertenecer a esta familia, que por años viene trabajando D. esta manera.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 64 years old.  María has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years.  Her business is renting out rooms.  She has a two-storey house.

With this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy 15 large containers of paint, 2 rolls of electricity cable, 10 PVC pipes and 2 lots of insulating tape.  She will also pay labor costs (a painter and an electrician).

On this occasion, María will carry out repairs that her house needs in order to be more presentable, so that she can rent out her rooms at a good price.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to belong to their family.  She has been working in this way for years.

loans.use: to buy paint and electricity cables

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro Pablo es caficultor, tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene nueve hijos y junto a ellos y su esposa reside en la Comunidad de Rio Blanco. El es un señor muy amable y tiene un gran sentido del humor. Desde hace 18 años trabaja con el cultivo de café y lo aprendió de su padre ya que desde muy pequeño lo ayudaba en la finca. Actualmente los hijos de Don Pedro lo ayudan con el trabajo y lo hacen desde las 6:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm. Algunas de las dificultades que ha enfrentado es la falta de recursos economicos para combatir las plagas que atacan las plantas. Este es su primer prestamo y lo utilizará para la resiembra y necesita comprar algunos insumos agricolas y tambien abono. Don Pedro esta seguro que con el apoyo del prestamo la condicion de su cultivo mejorará y tambien la de su familia. Su sueño es comprar algunas manzanas mas de tierra para asi ampliar su negocio y ser uno de lo mas grandes caficultores de la region. Espera poder cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, para que de esta manera la institucion lo siga apoyando con prestamos con montos mayores.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is a coffee farmer.  He is 50 years old, married, and has nine children.  He lives together with his wife and children in Rio Blanco community.  Pedro is a very kind man and has a great sense of humor.  He has been growing coffee for 18 years, having learned from his father as he used to help him on the farm when he was a boy.  Now, Pedro's children help him in his work, working from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  One of the difficulties that he has faced is a lack of economic resources to fight the pests that attack his plants.

This is Pedro's first loan and he will use it to resow his plants.  He also needs to buy some agricultural supplies and manure.  Pedro is certain that, with the support of this loan, his crops will improve, as will his family's living conditions.  His dream is to buy a few more 'manzanas' (one 'manzana = 1.68 acres) of land so that he can expand his business and become one of the biggest coffee growers in his region.  He hopes to make his loan repayments punctually so that the institution will continue supporting him with loans for larger amounts.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Chicorral Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta Magali es casada, tiene 28 años de edad, estudio 9 años hasta tercero básico, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales está estudiando primaria, se dedica al comercio a la venta de conchas y chamarras, inició  este negocio de ser comerciante vendiendo bufandas y pañuelos, ya hasta ahora lleva 6 años de experiencia con este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica también al comercio.

Decide organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo, para comprar más mercadería: compra de colchas y chamarra para la venta. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales, a la venta de colchas y a la venta de ropa importada. Esperan ver su negocio prospero con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta Magali is 28 years old and married.  She attended school for nine years, up to 'tercero básico' (ninth grade).  She has two children, one of whom is in elementary school.  Marta's business is selling bedspreads and jackets.  She started out in her sales business selling scarves and headscarves.  She now has six years experience in her work.  Marta has the support of her husband who also sells products.

Marta decided to form a group so that she could request a loan, increase her working capital and buy more merchandise.  She will buy bedspreads and jackets to sell.  The other members of the group raise animals, sell bedspreads and sell imported clothes.  They hope to see their businesses prosper and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 43 años, vive en la localidad D. San Pedro D. Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar y sus 3 queridos hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Ella se dedica a varias actividades, pero lo que más le gusta es el tejido, es así que durante el día teje chullo (prendas tejidas para la cabeza), chalinas, guantes, telares. Ella disfruta mucho D.  esta actividad y lo hace muy hábilmente, sus tejidos los venD. en su pequeño puesto ubicado en centro artesanal del poblado D. San Pedro D. Cajas, donD. con mucha rapidez son adquiridos por sus clientes. Por otro lado se dedica también a la siembra D. papa y lo realiza una vez al año, esta característica hace que la tierra sea más fértil y proporcione un buen producto, por lo que obtiene buenas ganancias con ello. Asimismo recibe el apoyo D. su esposo quien tiene una pequeña radio comunal en la localidad. En adelante espera ahorrar lo suficiente para poner una tienda D. tejidos artesanales más granD., donD. pueda vender sus prendas con mayor tranquilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para continuar sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Elvira D. obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. 15 bolsas D. hilos D. diversos colores, para continuar con la elaboración D. prendas tejidas.
texts.en:
Elvira is 43 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro D. Cajas.  She is noted as being a very cheerful and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Cesar and her three children who she loves very much.

Elvira is engaged in several business activities but what she most enjoys is weaving.  During the day, she weaves 'chullos' (knitted hats with earflaps), scarves and gloves on her loom.  She very much enjoys this activity and does her work very skilfully.  She sells her products from her small stall which is located in a craft center in San Pedro D. Cajas.  Her customers buy her products very quickly.

Elvira also grows potatoes and does this once a year.  This means that her soil is more fertile and provides a good product which makes her good profits.  She also receives support from her husband who has a small community radio station in the town.

In the future, Elvira hopes to save up enough money to set up a bigger store selling woven handicrafts where she can sell her products more peacefully.  She is a member of the "Mujeres al Futuro" community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time.  With your support, Elvira will invest the money that she has requested in buying 15 bags of thread in different colors so that she can continue weaving her products.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, bread, cookies and detergents

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es: La Sra. Hermelinda  es casada, tiene 2 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Estrellas  D. Fátima” grupo  conformado por 12 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Hermelinda  trabaja desD. hace   4 años en la venta D. Gaseosa y cerveza en su domicilio este negocio surge a raíz D. que sus hijos empiezan la universidad ya que con el sueldo D. su esposo solo cubre los gastos básicos alimentación, pago D. servicios agua, luz, teléfono, a su vez Hermelinda también venD. semillas D. plantas, Hermelinda nos cuenta que nada fue fácil tuvo que trabajar muy duro para poder salir adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y dediacion ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos,  sus hijos van a la universidad , y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una  mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería gaseosa, cerveza. Sabemos que Hermelinda cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Hermelinda is married and she has 2 children. She is a member of the communal bank "Estrellas D. Fatima", meaning "The Stars of Fatima". The group is maD. up of 12 members and they all have different business activities. Hermelinda has been selling soft drinks and beer for the past 4 years from her home. This business was started out because her two children are starting university and her husband's wages are enough only to cover the basic expenses: food, water, electricity, and telephone. Additionally Hermelinda also sells seeds. Hermelinda tells us that it was not at all easy, that she had to work hard to move forward. It was thanks to her efforts and dedication that she has been able to improve her income. Her children are in university.  Over all the family enjoys a better quality of life. With the goal of continued growth she requests a new loan to purchase soft drinks and beer. We know that Hermelinda will meet her goals through hard work and effort, and loans from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her do that.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela socia del banco comunal Manos Maravillosas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos.
Son ocho años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene un pequeño kiosco en una agencia de transportes, donde vende refrigerios, golosinas y bebidas heladas.
Habiendo quedado viuda y tener a cargo dos hijos que todavía están estudiando, ha tenido que ver la forma de trabajar para que no les falte nada.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 2,400.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 paquetes de frugos, 2 paquetes de agua, 3 tiras de papitas, 3 tiras de chizitos, 3 tiras de maní confitado, 2 cajas de galleta, 2 cientos de vasos descartables, 1 paquete de sorbete.
Este negocio debe estar bien surtido para que pueda tener más clientela, trabaja todo el día, solo por la noche regresa a casa para poder estar con sus hijos.
Está tranquila porque puede darle a sus hijos las cosas que necesitan, solo lamenta no poder estar más tiempo con ellos.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the communal bank "Manos Maravillosas", meaning "Marvelous Hands", of the district of Calleria in department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old, a widow, and she has two children. She has been working with loans through Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for eight years. She has a small canteen at a sports center, selling frozen desserts, snacks, and cold drinks. Having been left a widow and having to take care of her two children who are still in school, she had to find a way to work so that they are not in need of anything. 

With her new loan of S/2,400 nuevos soles she will purchase: 3 packages of juice boxes, 2 packages of bottled water, 3 cases of potato chips, 3 cases of cheese twists, 3 cases of candied peanuts, 2 boxes of cookies, 200 disposable drinking cups, and 1 package of sorbet.

This business needs to be well stocked in order to attend more clients. She works all day and she only comes back at night to be with her children. She is content because she is able to provide her children with the things they need. She laments not being able to spend more time with them.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, juice boxes, and disposable drinking cups.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casad y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva cuatro años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida y lo hace por las noches en el patio de su casa, no le quita tanto tiempo ya que todo lo cocina al carbón.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 parrilla más grande, 1 batancito para  que prepare los tacachos (comida típica), 1 saco de carbón., 1 espátula para voltear los asados.
La venta de comida es muy rentable porque las personas por las noche prefiere comer sus asaditos calientitos, Engela está muyu tranquila porque con su trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de estudio de su último hijo, quien vive con ellos.
texts.en:
Angela is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" of the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old, married, and she has four children. She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for four years. She sells prepared foods in the evenings from the patio of her house. It is not very time consuming because everything is cooked with charcoal.

Her new loan is in the amount of S/3000 nuevos soles and she will purchase: 1 larger sized grill, 1 container to prepare tacachos (a traditional meal consisting of thin roasted meat), 1 sack of charcoal, 1 spatula to flip the roasts.

The sale of prepared foods is very profitable because in the evenings people prefer to eat her hot roasted meals. Angela is very content because she is able to help her husband with the school expenses of their youngest son, who still lives with them.

loans.use: to purcahse a new grill and kitchen implements.

loans.name: Claudia De La Concepción

texts.es:
Claudia, de 47 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, actualemente vive en Palacaguina - Estelí,, donde se casó y tuvo tres hijos, de profesión Maestra, tiene un pequeño bar desde hace trece años el cual lo inicio con capital propio, generandole éste mas ingresos a su hogar. La señora Claudia solicitó su crédito para ampliar su negocio, incrementar inventario y la compra de exhibidor para licorería. 
Dentro de sus planes futuros se encuentra ampliar el negocio y que sus hijos vayan a la universidad para la culminación de sus estudios.
texts.en: Claudia, 47, is from the city of Masaya but currently lives in Palacaguina, Estelí, where she got married and had three children.  By profession, she’s a Teacher.  She’s owned a small bar for the last 13 years that she started with her own capital; it generates extra income for her home.  Claudia requested the loan to expand the business, increase inventory and to buy a liquor display case.  Within her future plans are expanding the business and that her children attend the university to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy a display case and increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Kattya Janina

texts.es:
La señora Kattya es socia del banco comunal Miraflores del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo.
Se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (comida al paso), esta actividad la realiza por las tardes en la vereda de su casa (ambulante), tiene acondicionadas algunas mesas para la atención a sus cliente.  Trabaja desde las 5 de la tarde, no tiene ayudantes por ello ella tiene que hacer todo, desde la preparación hasta la atención.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles comprará una congeladora de segunda mano porque le hace falta para helar las gaseosas y refrescos que vende para acompañar las salchipapas.
Los cuatro años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha servido para poder mantener a su pequeño hijo, Tiene que trabajar para poder darle todo lo que necesita. Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha tenido un capital para poder trabajar y salir adelante sola.
texts.en: Kattya is a member of the Miraflores community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department. She is 27 years old, a single mother, and has one child. Kattya sells 'salchipapas' (fast food). She does this in the afternoons, from the sidewalk outside her house. She sets up some tables for her customers. Kattya works from 5.00pm. She does not have any helpers and has to do everything herself, from preparing the food to serving the customers. With this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles, Kattya will buy a second-hand chiller cabinet because she needs one to keep the sodas and soft drinks that she sells with her 'salchipapas' cold. The four years that Kattya has been working with Manuela Ramos have helped her to support her young son. She has to work so that she can provide him with everything he needs. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she has had the capital she needs to work and get ahead on her own.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand chiller cabinet

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una mujer que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de su actividad. Su actividad es un centro recreativo es su principal fuente de ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Desde hace mas 9 años empezó su negocio cuando a su esposo lo despidieron del trabajo y compro el área donde tiene el negocio, aprovechando que el lugar tiene vertientes de agua, modificaron el lugar con pilas de agua estilo piscina, lo que atrae el turismo de la ciudad y tiene clientes que alquilan el lugar para diferentes actividades de negocio, o turístico, en el lugar venden platillos variados, gaseosas, refrescos y otros productos varios, también servicio de música al gusto del cliente. El financiamiento es para realizarle ciertas mejoras al local y también comprar gaseosas, golosinas, verduras, carnes, entre otros
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a woman who has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time.  This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan as she is a very entrepreneurial person who enjoys her work.  Her business is running a recreation center.  This is the main source of income for her household.

Luz Marina started her business more than nine years ago when her husband lost his job.  She bought the area where she has her business, making the most of the fact that the location has springs of water.  They modified the place with large basins of water, swimming pool style.  This attracts tourists from the city and she also has customers who hire the place out for different business or tourist events.  In her premises, she serves different dishes, soda, soft drinks and other various products.  She also provides a music service to meet her customers' tastes.  She is requesting this loan to make certain improvements to her premises and also to buy soda, candies, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.use: to buy soda, candies, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Elisa es socia del banco comunal Las Tigresas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años de edad, y tiene dos hijos.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, y se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 comprará: 6 bebidas nutricional de diferentes sabores, 2 multivitaminico, 2 te concentrado, 1 proteína, 2 bebidas de aloe en polvo, 2 te instantáneo, 2 vigorizantes.

Tiene un club de batidos que funciona en su casa, cada mañana prepara los batidos para ofrecer a las personas que están  decididos a bajar de peso, ella misma es una de las personas que está siguiendo esta dieta nutricional.  Se puede decir que está innovando con este servicio ya que estos productos no son muy comerciales debido a su costo.  Son productos muy caros pero que están haciendo efecto en poco tiempo, de esa manera más personas se están animando a tomar los batidos.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos que le ha otorgado a la fecha y que le han permitido seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the Las Tigresas community bank of the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and has two children. She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 10 years, and she sells Herbalife products. With her new loan of S/. 3,000.00 she will buy: 6 nutritional drinks in different flavors, 2 multivitamins, 2 tea concentrates,1 protein, 2 powdered aloe drinks, 2 instant teas, and two 2 invigorators.

She has a smoothie club that she operates from her house. Every morning she makes the smoothies to offer to people who want to lose weight. She herself is one of the people who is on this nutritional diet. It can be said that she is an innovator with this service since these products aren't very marketable due to their cost. They are very expensive products but they are having an effect after a short time. In this way more people are deciding to drink the smoothies.  She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the loans it has given her so far that have allowed her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products

loans.name: Wilmer Manuel

texts.es: Wilmer Manuel tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos pequeños hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, y junto a su familia reside en la Comunidad de Rio Blanco. El es un pequeño Caficultor y se dedica a este cultivo desde hace 25 años, sus padres no pudieron enviarlo a la escuela y entonces desde muy joven ayudaba a su padre a trabajar. Su jornada laboral comienza desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta la 1:00 pm. Su mayor ventaja es que la tierra donde está cultivado el café es muy fertil, aunque por temporadas aparece un tipo de hongo perjudicial para el cultivo y para combatirlo tiene que aplicarle cal y eso le ocasiona gastos extras y a veces no cuenta con dinero necesario para hacerlo. Este es su primer prestamo y lo necesita ya que es temporada de resiembra y la hará con 6,000 plantas, ademas necesita pagar la chapia de 4 manzanas de tierra y comprar abono. Wilmer espera que con el apoyo de este prestamo tendrá lo necesario para mejorar las condiciones de su cultivo y por tanto sus ingresos seran mejores y con ello podrá sostener a su familia y enviará a sus hijos a la escuela para que sean personas educadas y que en algunos años sean profesionales. Su meta es ir ampliando la cantidad de plantas sembradas para convertirse en un gran productor de café.
texts.en: Wilmer Manuel is 32 years old. He is married and has two small children who are 9 and 2 years old. He lives with his family in the community of Rio Blanco. He is a small scale coffee grower and he has grown this crop for more than 25 years. His parents weren't able to send him to school so since he was very young, he helped his father work.  His work day begins very early in the morning and goes until 1:00 pm. His biggest advantage is that the soil where he grows his coffee is very fertile, although at times a harmful fungus appears. He fights it by applying lime and this incurs extra costs and at time she doesn't have the money to do it. This is his first loan and he needs it since it is time to re-plant and he will do it with 6,000 plants. He also has to pay for the clearing of 400 meters of land and buy fertilizer. Wilmer hopes that with the support of this loan, he will have what he needs to improve the condition of his crop and therefore his earnings will increase and he will be able to support his family and send his children to school so they will be educated and have a profession some day. His goal is to increase the quantity of plants in order to become a large scale coffee farmer.

loans.use: to buy farming materials.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
La señora Lupe es socia del banco comunal Las Tigresas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad y un hijo.
Lleva cuatro años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de picarones (dulce peruano), el cual prepara por las tarde en el patio de su casa, tiene un par de mesas para comodidad de sus clientes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 cientos de platos descartables, ½ saco de azúcar, para hacer su miel, ¼ de clavo de olor, ¼ de canela, 1 vainilla, ¼ de anís, 1 galón de aceite, 1 perol.
Sus ganancias le sirve para solventar sus propios gastos, porque vive sola consu hijo en la casa de su mamá y no tiene muchos gastos.  Está muy tranquila porque Manuela Ramos la sigue apoyando.
texts.en: Lupe is a member of the 'Las Tigresas' (The Tigresses) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department. She is 50 years old and has one child. Lupe has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years. Her business is selling 'picarones' (a Peruvian dessert). She prepares them in the afternoons, in the patio area outside her home. She has a couple of tables for her customers' convenience. With this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles, Lupe will buy: 200 disposable plates, half a sack of sugar for making her honey syrup, quarter of a bag of cloves, quarter of a bag of cinnamon, 1 lot of vanilla, quarter of a bag of aniseed, 1 gallon of oil and 1 pot. Lupe uses her profits to cover her own expenses as she lives with her son in her mom's house and doesn't have many expenses. She is very happy that Manuela Ramos continue to support her.

loans.use: to buy a pot, disposable plates and ingredients

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
La señora Melita es socia del banco comunal Las tigresas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo.
Hace algún tiempo comenzó con el negocio de venta de bebidas heladas y lo realiza en su misma casa, cuenta con una congeladora para helar sus bebidas, los días de calor son cuando hay más demanda.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 cajas de cerveza, 10 jabas de gaseosa, 3 paquetes de agua, 1 ciento de vasos descartables, 1 paquete de gaseosa coca cola, 1 paquete de gaseosa inca cola.
A pesar de ser tan joven no quiere depender del sueldo de su esposo, quien es ingeniero de sistemas y gana lo suficiente, pero Melita prefiere trabajar y no depender de él, además, dice que así se siente más útil.  Trabajando los dos podrán ahorrar y podrán asegurar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Melita is a member of the 'Las Tigresas' (The Tigresses) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 23 years old, married, and has one child.

Some time ago, Melita started her business selling chilled drinks from her home.  She has a freezer where she chills her drinks.  She has most demand on hot days.

With her new loan for 1,700 Peruvian soles, Melita will buy 15 crates of beer, 10 crates of soda, 3 packets of water, 100 disposable cups, 1 packet of Coca Cola and 1 packet of Inca Cola.

In spite of her young age, Melita does not want to depend on her husband's wage.  He is a systems engineer and earns enough but Melita prefers to work and not have to depend on him.  In addition, she says that this way she feels more useful.  As both Melita and her husband work, they are able to save and can guarantee their son's education.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es: Gissela tiene 34 años, convive con Edu, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que crían y educan en unión familiar en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Hace 11 años que se dedica en la compra y venta de papa en un puesto que alquiló en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Todos los días desde las primeras horas comercializa un promedio de 40 sacos diarios como mínimo, los cuales vende a 45 nuevos soles cada uno. Según cuenta maneja un capital de trabajo de 5 mil soles diarios. El trabajo que realiza es muy sacrificado y a la vez gratificante, pues lo que más le gusta a Gissela es negociar la venta de las diferentes variedades y clases de papa. Al terminar el día se siente agotada por el trajín diario. Ahora ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de un camión para poder trasladar los sacos de papa que cosecha hacía la ciudad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Razón por lo que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas, además de ser una persona responsable, ya que es miembro de su asociación. Gissela de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de papa de los agricultores para comercializarlos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Gissela is 34 years old and lives with her husband Edu.  The couple have four children who they raise and educate as a family in a rental house which is located in the city of Tarma.

Gissela has been buying and selling potatoes from a rented stall in the wholesale market in her city for 11 years.  She makes her sales every day, from very early in the morning, selling an average of 40 sacks a day at a minimum.  She sells each sack for 45 Peruvian soles.  She tells us that she manages working capital of 5,000 soles each day.  The work that she carries out is very demanding but also rewarding.  What she most enjoys about her work is negotiating the sale of her different varieties and classes of potato.  At the end of the day, she feels exhausted by her daily work.  She would like to expand her business by purchasing a truck so that she can transport her sacks of potatoes to the city.

Gissela belongs to the 'Integra' community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation in helping her to achieve her goals.  For this reason, she will make her loan repayments punctually.  She is a responsible person as she is a member of her community bank.  With your support, Gissela will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of potatoes from farmers so that she can sell them wholesale.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Felipe Nery

texts.es: Felipe Nery es un pequeño productor de café, tiene 53 años de edad, tiene un hijo y junto a el y a su esposa vive en la Comunidad de Rio Blanco. Don Felipe inició como cuidador en una finca de café y como ha sido un tanto curioso, él siempre estuvo pendiente de las actividades que realizaban los mozos de campo. Así que luego de un tiempo pasó al campo a trabajar y lo hizo por varios años, adquiriendo la experiencia necesaria para crear su propia finca. Actualmente Don Felipe trabaja su propio cultivo de 3 manzanas de tierra y ya lleva 4 años haciendolo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 2:00 pm. Este es su primer prestamo y con el comprará abono y pagará la chapia, y con esto podrá darle mayor y mejor mantenimiento al cultivo y por ende su produccion será de mejor calidad. La dificultad que hasta el momento habia pasado es que por ser un pequeño productor y por la zona donde reside ninguna institucion lo habia apoyado con financiamiento. Su meta es cultivar mas plantas y ampliar su produccion para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe Nery is a small-scale coffee farmer.  He is 53 years old and lives with his wife and son in Rio Blanco community.  Felipe started out looking after a coffee plantation and, as he was curious, he was always watching the work that the farm workers carried out.  After a while, he moved to working in the fields.  He did this for several years, acquiring the experience he needed to set up his own plantation.  

Felipe currently works on his own crops, which are planted over 3 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of land, and he has been doing this for four years.  He works from 6.00am to 2.00pm.

This is Felipe's first loan and he will use it to buy manure and pay somebody to chop down weeds with a machete.  This will enable him to provide his crops with more and better care. Consequently, he will enjoy a better quality production.  The difficulty that Felipe has had up to now is that, owing to the fact that he is a small-scale producer and owing to the area where he lives, no institution has supported him with financing.  His goal is to grow more plants and expand his production so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Iraida De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Iraida es socia del banco comunal Miraflores del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos (solo cuatro están a su cargo).
Iraida se dedica a la compra y venta de combustible, su esposo es motorista y hay ocasiones que encuentra combustible a un precio muy por debajo de lo normal y como todo comerciante aprovecha la oportunidad.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 50 galones de gasolina, 20 galones de petróleo, 10 galones de plásticos.
Este negocio lo comparte con su esposo, quien es el que consigue el producto a un buen precio, lógicamente la ganancia es buena.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido comprar sus cosas que le hacían falta y sobre todo poder educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Iraida is a member of the Miraflores community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has six children (only four of whom are in her care).

Iraida's business is buying and selling fuel.  Her husband is a driver.  He sometimes finds fuel at a price which is much lower than normal and, like any salesperson, makes the most of the opportunity.

With this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, Iraida will buy 50 gallons of gas, 20 gallons of kerosene and 10 gallons of plastic.

Iraida shares this business with her husband.  He is the one who acquires their product at a good price.  Logically, the profits are good.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Iraida has been able to buy things that her family needs and, above all, educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: Teofila Saturdina

texts.es:
La señora Teófila es socia del banco comunal Miraflores del Distrito De Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 58 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos.
Lleva 12 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, desde muy temprano empieza su labor porque tiene que ir al mercado para hacer todas las compras.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una licuadora, 3 ollas medianas, 1 tabla de picar, 1 espumadera, 2 cucharones, 3 cucharas para servir, también comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 galones de aceite.
Esta vez comprará los utensilios que más le hacen falta, para poder trabajar con más comodidad, cuenta con una ayudante para la atención al público.
Gracias a los préstamos de Manuela Ramos está terminando de implementar su negocio, todavía tiene un hijo que está estudiando y necesita mucho de su ayuda, por ello sigue adelante.
texts.en:
Teófila is a member of the Miraflores community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 58 years old, widowed, and has five children.

Teófila has been working with Manuela Ramos for 12 years.  Her business is selling food.  She starts her work very early in the morning because she has to go to the market to do all her shopping.

With her new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles, Teófila will buy a blender, three medium-sized pans, 1 chopping board, 1 skimmer, 2 ladles and 3 serving spoons.  She will also buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar and 2 gallons of oil.

On this occasion, Teófila will buy the utensils that she needs the most so that she can work more comfortably.  She has an assistant who serves her customers.

Thanks to loans from Manuela Ramos, Teófila is finishing off equipping her business.  She has a son who is still studying and really needs her help.  For this reason, she continues working.

loans.use: to buy a blender, pans, rice, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Mujeres Emprendedoras está conformado por personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Cristian Isabel forma parte de este grupo tiene 2 hijos menores de edad su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general hace 3 años, el financiamiento es para la compra ropa en general, cosmeticos, ropa interior ya que tiene de administrarlo ha a pesar de que no ha sido fácil por la gran competencia que tiene. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado adquirir experiencia y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) solidarity group has hard-working members who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, through their daily efforts, provide their children with a better future.

Cristian Isabel is a member of this group.  She has two dependent children and her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for three years.  She will use her loan to buy clothes, cosmetics and underwear.  She has to run her business in spite of the fact that it has not been easy owing to the competition that she faces.  Over time, she has managed to gain experience and keep improving every day.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and underwear

loans.name: Lluvias De Bendicion Group

texts.es:
El señor Juan Eduardo es casado, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la albañilería y a la crianza de ganado, vacas y cerdos, inició este trabajo de albañil como ayudante y ahora es albañilería y lleva en este trabajo 7 años de experiencia, y le gusta tener iniciativa para mejorar su condición de vida.

Por lo que decide organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le va a servirá para vacas y cerdos para crianza. Ya que quiere tener una pequeña granja. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la venta de mercería. En la foto aparece una de las socias con su esposo (estan de primero en la foto).
texts.en:
Juan Eduardo is 33 years old and married.  He studied three years at elementary school.  He is in the construction business and also raises cows and pigs.  He started the building work as an assistant and now he is a builder with seven years experience.  He likes to take the initiative in improving his living conditions.

Juan Eduardo decided to form a group so that he could request a loan to buy cows and pigs to raise.  He would like to own a small farm.  The other members of the group raise animals and sell sewing supplies.  In the photo, one of the members appears with her husband (in the front row).

loans.use: to buy pigs and cows

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 46 años, ella es de la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rolando y su querido hijo menor Gerardo de 22 años a quienes quiere  mucho. El negocio al que se dedica Nora son los tejidos artesanales, tiene su puesto de venta en el centro artesanal del poblado de San Pedro de Cajas, en el cual vende las prendas que ella misma confecciona y que son rápidamente compradas por sus clientes, ya que los modelos que hace son muy novedosos. Además de surtir los mismos con variedades de telares y tapices de otros artesanos de la zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y desarrollar su creatividad, lleva 7 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir, pero eso no la desanima ya que sabe que tiene que vender lo más rápido para poder cada 20 días darse un tiempo. Ya que su esposo llega de la mina donde trabaja y juntos comparten la mayor parte de su tiempo. Asimismo se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa una vez al año. Por todos los objetivos que está alcanzando, espera con el tiempo poner una tienda más grande, donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de ser uno socia muy cumplida y puntual con sus cuotas. Nora de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias madejas de lana de carnero y alpaca para continuar con sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Nora is 46 years old and from the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  She is noted as being a very cheerful and sincere woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Rolando and her youngest son, 22 year-old Gerardo, who she loves very much.

Nora's business is weaving handicrafts.  She has a sales stall in the craft center in San Pedro de Cajas.  This is where she sells the items that she makes and they are bought very quickly by her customers since the designs that she makes are very original.  She also stocks her business with a variety of loom-produced crafts and tapestries from other craftspeople in her area.

What Nora most enjoys about her work is weaving and developing her creativity.  She has been in this business for seven years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to spend the whole day on her sales stall without being able to go out.  However, this does not discourage her since she knows that she has to sell her products as quickly as she can so that she can take some time out every 20 days as her husband arrives home from the mine where he works and they are able to share most of their time together.

Nora also farms.  She grows potatoes once a year.  With all the goals that she is achieving, over time Nora hopes to be able to set up a larger store where she can serve her customers more comfortably.  She is a member of the "Mujeres al Futuro" community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She is very punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, Nora will invest the money that she has requested in buying several skeins of ram's wool and alpaca wool so that she can continue weaving her products.

loans.use: to buy ram's wool and alpaca wool

loans.name: G.s. Piedra Viva Group

texts.es: El Grupos Solidario Piedra Viva está compuesto por Néstor Javier tiene 42 años, su actividad económica es la venta de frutas. Este señor ha luchado todos los días por mejorar su condición de vida. En cambio Maria Del Carmen tiene 64 años y su actividad económica es crianza de cerdos, por lo que labora todos los fines de la semana. Ella aduce que sus hijos le apoyan. El financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
The 'Piedra Viva' solidarity group  has two members.

Néstor Javier is 42 years old.  His business is selling fruit.  This man has worked hard every day to improve his living conditions.

Maria del Carmen is 64 years old and her business is raising pigs.  She works every weekend.  She adds that her children support her in the business.  She will use this loan to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Los Copihues De Malleco Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal se llama “Los Copihues de Malleco” y está conformado por 18 socios, quienes se dedican principalmente al rubro del comercio, vendiendo ropa. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Rodrigo, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie arriba de una silla, el primero de derecha a izquierda. Viste con una chaqueta color café. Se dedica a vender joyas bañadas en oro y plata, su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora de joyas en la ciudad de Temuco, en la cual venden al por mayor, lo que es conveniente económicamente para Rodrigo. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 5 años, sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta y tiene bastante clientela, por lo que le va muy bien.
Sus metas en su negocio es establecerse en un local y tener una joyería en la cual pueda vender sus joyas por mayor y al detalle. 
Rodrigo vive junto a su esposa e hija d 5 años de edad, quien asiste al jardín infantil. Comenta que sus sueños son salir a vacacionar con su familia para descansar.
Fondo esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo, ya que no contaba con el capital para invertir su negocio, el cual le ha servido para obtener mayores ingresos. 
Por lo tanto se encuentra muy agradecido, respecto a las capacitaciones, éstas le han servido para registrar sus gastos e ingresos. El grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy organizado y unido. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The “Los Copihues de Malleco” community bank has 18 members who mainly work in sales, selling clothes.  They are all from the city of Temuco.

Rodrigo is the man on the far right of the photo who is standing on a chair.  He is wearing a coffee-colored jacket.  His business is selling gold- and silver-plated jewelry.  He buys his merchandise from a jewelry distributor in the city of Temuco who sells wholesale.  This is financially convenient for Rodrigo.  He has been in this field for five years and makes his sales door to door.  He has quite a lot of customers and things are going very well.  His goals for his business are to set himself up in some premises and start a jewelry store where he can sell his jewelry wholesale and retail. 

Rodrigo lives with his wife and 5 year-old daughter who is in kindergarten.  He says that his dream is to go on holiday with his family so that they can relax.

Fondo Esperanza have been a great source of support as Rodrigo did not have the capital he needed to invest in his business.  The capital has helped him to make more income.  For this reason, he is very grateful.  The training sessions have been useful in helping him to record his incomings and outgoings.  The community bank to which he belongs is very organized and united.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  There are a series of lakeside resorts in the surrounding area (Pucón, Villarrica) and very striking native flora and fauna can be found in nearby nature reserves.  50% of the Mapuche (indigenous people) in our country live in this region.

loans.use: to buy silver- and gold-plated jewelry

loans.name: Rafael Leopoldo

texts.es: Rafael Leopoldo tiene 43 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios, pues su Padre le enseño este medio de vida, pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado adquirir experiencia. Trabaja todos los días para conseguir gastos para sufragar su hogar. Este crédito es para la compra vacas, toros y chivos.  Desea mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
43-year old Rafael Leopoldo earns his living buying and selling cattle. He started the business using his own money; his father taught him about the cattle business but as time passed he got more and more experience of his own.

Rafael works every day to earn money for household expenses. This loan is to be used to buy cows, bulls, and young goats. Rafael wishes to earn more money so he can provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls, and young goats

loans.name: Linna

texts.en:
Linna, age 26, is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Bunnat, age 28, is a motorbike repairman. He operates a business at home. The couple has just been married since 2010 and has one young daughter. They live in a village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Linna is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to help with her husband’s motorbike repairing business. She will be purchasing additional motorbike spare parts.

loans.use: to help with her husband’s motorbike repairing business by purchasing additional motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly is 29 years loan and her husband, Sokkea, is 23 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2009 and have no children yet.   

Chhunly sells vegetables. Her husband is a driver; he drives for a company in Phnom Penh. Chhunly is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work. 

Photo: Chhunly and her husband.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok (in the photo) is a rice and vegetable farmer, while her husband is employed full-time in a company delivering pure drinking water. Sok has asked for a Kiva loan. She now is requesting another loan of $1,000 to add to her own money to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son-in-law to drive Tuk Tuk taxi.

Sok and her husband live in a village on National Road Number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five married children. Four live outside the family home and another one still lives in the family home.

loans.use: to add to her own money to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Kunthy (shown in the photo), 48, and her husband, Sok, 40, are fishermen and rice farmers. They live along National Road number five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and one daughter. Two are garment workers and another one is married and lives in separate home.

Kunthy is asking for a loan of $600 to fill-up the land of her house foundation and to bury a highway drainage pipe because the house where she lives needs a more functional water system.

loans.use: to fill-up the land of her house foundation and to bury a highway drainage pipe because she needs to arrange a more functional water system for her house.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak is a farmer.  She also produces rice wine and raises pigs. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and assists his wife in the businesses when he is free. Vannak has asked for a Kiva loan before, and is now requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting, because she does not have transportation. Vannak and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sokchhun

texts.en: Sokchhun (in the photo) and his wife Yem are rice farmers who also produce rice wine and raise pigs. They have been married since 2004 and have three children – two sons and one daughter. One is in school and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sokchhun is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to buy three more pigs to raise, as well as feed for his pigs.

loans.use: to buy three more pigs to raise, as well as feed for his pigs
